While the chemical structures of naturally–occurring sugars and added sugars are identical, there is an important difference. According to the Guidelines
post_title: whole foods that naturally contain sugars also naturally contain vitamins
post_excerpt: minerals
ping_status: and other essential nutrients — all of which contribute to \"diluting\" the concentration of sugar in the food.

ID: These foods and beverages include vegetables
post_author: fruits
post_date: whole grains
post_content: beans
post_excerpt: nuts
post_status: and seeds that are prepared without added sugars
post_password: and sodium. These foods are high in nutrients (nutrient–dense) and low in calories. Foods and beverages that contain excessive amounts of added sugar

post_author: there are more calories but not more nutritional value. Items with added sugars are thus energy–dense and nutrient–poor — the overall calorie density of the food increases while the overall nutrient density decreases.

ID: Recommendations for added sugars in the diet vary between different organizations
post_author: and there is no consensus regarding what constitutes acceptable levels. However
post_date: one common theme seems to run through all of the recommendations
post_date_gmt: and that is that individuals should decrease their consumption of added sugars.

ID: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends that added sugar should account for less than 10 percent of total calories per day
post_author: and is considering adding the suggestion that less than 5 percent per day would provide additional benefits.

ID: The American Heart Association (AHA) recommends a prudent upper limit — for most American women
post_author: that is no more than 100 calories per day (about 6 teaspoons of sugar) and for most American men
post_date: no more than 150 calories per day (about 9 teaspoons).

ID: When foods and beverages with added sugar are routinely consumed in place of nutritious plant–based foods such as fruits
post_author: vegetables
post_date: starchy vegetables
post_content: as well as lean proteins
post_title: it becomes increasingly difficult for individuals to achieve recommended nutrient intake while controlling calories. In the interest of your optimal health
post_excerpt: it is important to understand the amounts of added sugars present in the food products you consume
post_status: and to monitor the intake of these products."

post_content: It’s 3 a.m. and your baby is crying again. Does her diaper need changing? Is he hungry? Does she need to be changed and fed? Unfortunately, interrupted sleep is a fact of life for parents of a newborn which makes those first few months of parenthood utterly and completely exhausting.  It is not at all unusual for new parents to feel sleep deprived and wonder if they will ever get a good night’s sleep again. While a night of uninterrupted sleep is unlikely those first few months, there are strategies you can use to maximize the amount of rest you do get. Incorporating those strategies can help to alleviate some of the negative health consequences that can occur due to disrupted sleep. Effects of Disrupted Sleep This probably comes as no surprise, especially if you are currently in the midst of caring for a newborn…but adequate sleep is a vital component of your health and well–being, and when you don’t sleep well, many important aspects of your life can suffer including your mood, cognitive ability, attention span and energy level. Numerous studies support this conclusion including a study published in the November 2015 journal Sleep that examined the effects of three different sleep conditions—three consecutive nights of either forced awakenings
post_title: delayed bedtimes or uninterrupted sleep--on 62 healthy men and women. Results confirmed the negative consequences interrupted sleep has on your energy level and mood. The study found that after the first night the participants who were subjected to eight forced awakenings and those with delayed bedtimes showed similar low positive mood and high negative mood. After two nights however
post_excerpt: the group with forced awakenings had a 31 percent reduction in their positive mood and the group with a delayed bedtime had only a 12 percent reduction in positive mood compared to the first day. Both groups had similar negative moods on all three days. The researchers discovered that the forced awakening group had shorter periods of deep
post_status: slow-wave restorative sleep than the group with the delayed bedtime
comment_status: and the lack of this type of sleep had a statistically significant association with the participant’s reduction in positive mood. They also found that interrupted sleep not only reduced participant’s energy levels
ping_status: but also reduced their feelings of sympathy and friendliness. Another study conducted on students and published in the July 2014 issue of Sleep Medicine
post_password: found a causal link between interrupted sleep patterns and reduced cognitive abilities

post_author: the joys of new parenthood can go a long way towards making up for the sleep deprivation you feel
post_date: but you can also employ some strategies to help mitigate the effects of interrupted sleep. Most parenting experts suggest trying the following:

ID: • Sleep when your baby sleeps. This can’t be emphasized enough! When your baby naps
post_author: you nap. When your baby goes to bed at night
post_date: it’s time for you to go to bed too. Turn off your phone
post_content: and tablet. Leave the dishes in the sink
post_title: the laundry in the hamper and any other household chores that aren’t finished for another time. Your sleep is much more important.

ID: • Split nighttime duties with your partner. This can be done in several different ways depending on your specific situation. If your baby is bottle fed
post_author: divide the night into four hour shifts
post_date: so each of you can get four hours of uninterrupted sleep
post_date_gmt: or alternate entire nights so each of you get a full night of uninterrupted sleep every other night. Another option is simply alternating who feeds and changes the baby each time the baby awakens. (You can even sleep in separate rooms during this time so the parent that is “off-duty” can get undisturbed sleep.) If the baby is breast fed
post_content: nursing mothers could pump a bottle of breast milk in advance so her partner can take a turn feeding the baby at night. If pumping breast milk is not an option
post_title: the partner can bring the baby to the breastfeeding mom and handle nighttime diaper changes.

post_author: dark
post_date: and unstimulating. For overnight feedings and diaper changes
post_date_gmt: keep lighting as low as possible using a night light with low illumination
post_content: and keep distractions to a minimum.

ID: • Ask for and accept help: If any trust worthy adult in your life asks if you need any help
post_author: say yes! Have them spend time with the baby while you take a nap. Or
post_date: if your family members or friends want to visit say yes and ask them to let you take a nap to recharge.

ID: • Remember there is a light at the end of the tunnel: Although you may feel like you’ll never get a good night’s sleep again
post_author: remember that this too shall pass. Babies generally start sleeping for longer
post_date: more humane stretches of time by 3 to 6 months of age.

ID: Being a new parent has many highs and lows—it is a joyful time and an exhausting time as well. While sleep deprivation is almost guaranteed in the first few months of your baby’s life
post_author: it is also possible to get some relief. Try some--or better yet all--of the strategies above to maximize the amount of rest you do get. Remember that a fundamental aspect of being a good parent is taking good care of yourself so you can take good care of your family!"
post_date: New Parents And Sleep
post_content: publish
post_excerpt: open

post_content: Dr. Mehmet Oz
post_title: host of the popular “Dr. Oz” TV show
post_excerpt: has been called out recently for promoting untested dietary supplements. A Congressional Subcommittee is investigating Dr. Oz for false claims about the health benefits of “Pure Green Coffee
post_status: ” marketed as a miracle weight loss cure despite a lack of scientific evidence. While Dr. Oz is the most high-profile celebrity to be caught in the controversy surrounding dietary supplements
comment_status: he is not alone in facing scrutiny.

post_author: a research study in the Annals of Internal Medicine suggested that multivitamins are not useful in maintaining health
post_date: while USA TODAY recently reported on the unregulated dietary supplements industry and the undisclosed ingredients found in some multivitamins.

ID: \"It is important not to get carried away by broad headlines that do not take every individual situation into account and only offer so much information
post_author: \" says Dr. Susan Spear
post_date: EHE Vice President of Medical Affairs. \"Every individual case is unique
post_date_gmt: based on a person's medical history
post_content: background
post_excerpt: diet and other factors. Before determining whether to include or eliminate multivitamins from your nutritional routine
post_status: consult with a doctor who knows you and is familiar with your medical history.\"

ID: The need for medical consultation with a healthcare professional cannot be overstated. By taking supplements based on advertisements and hearsay
post_author: you will (at best) be wasting money
post_date: but will also (at worst) run the risk of damaging your health. If your doctor does recommend the use of a supplement
post_date_gmt: be sure to research the brand and ingredients carefully before purchase.

ID: While the headlines may now be focused on a celebrity doctor’s questionable promotion of supplements
post_author: an important health truth should not be overlooked. The use of supplements can never substitute for proper food choices and healthy eating. According to the Dietary Guidelines Advisory Committee (DGAC)
post_date: you should be obtaining your nutrients from real foods that contain many other substances that promote health. The key is to eat a wide variety of foods including fruits
post_content: whole grains
post_title: fresh beans and lean sources of protein that can adequately nourish your body with all necessary vitamins and provide many other important nutritional elements such as fiber
post_excerpt: antioxidants and phytochemicals in their proper forms.

ID: Most Americans are not eating the right foods and are therefore not obtaining the necessary vitamins. For example
post_author: over 90 percent of the grains consumed in America are refined (bran and germ are removed)
post_date: and refined grains constitute 21 percent of the average American's caloric intake. The typical caloric intake of most Americans includes:

ID: • Two-thirds from highly refined and processed foods which have been stripped off their nutrients.
• 23 percent from refined/processed oils that are added to foods
This dietary pattern is calorie-rich and nutrient-poor. By consuming a diet that is much more nutrient-rich
post_author: the vast majority of individuals can eliminate the nutrient deficiencies associated with a diet that is nutrient-poor. This common sense approach will always outweigh the medical quackery
post_date: fad diets
post_date_gmt: and miracle cure-alls that come and go.

ID: MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: The information is not intended to constitute medical advice and is not a substitute for consultation with a physician or other health care provider. Individuals with specific complaints should seek immediate consultation from their personal physicians.

We all face a myriad of challenges in our daily health decisions which can sometimes be overwhelming. Understanding the complexities of medical care and navigating an intimidating healthcare system add to the frustration and the feeling of helplessness. Nurses continue to be our best ally, as both caregiver and resource. The contribution of nurses is frequently unrecognized over the physician in medicine. Nurses play a critical role, particularly in preventive care. Assessing a patient’s condition requires more than diagnosing ailments; it frequently requires a thoughtful and honest conversation with a patient. “Nurses have been the 'face of healthcare' to the patient,” a recent Forbes article explains
post_title: because they put us as ease. This is more than just a sentiment. Studies have consistently demonstrated that nursing is the most trusted profession in America. Many of us find nurses more approachable than doctors and feel less intimated to ask questions.

ID: Corporate preventive care programs with strong nursing staffs are at the vanguard of employee health. In these programs
post_author: nurses serve as educators in promoting healthy living and disease prevention in addition to their clinical duties.

ID: “From Minute Clinics to the hospital setting
post_author: nurses remain patient centered and are true advocates for the well being of individuals
post_date: ” explains Marianne Dyke

ID: “That’s why EHE International employs many nurses and nurse practitioners in its offices nationwide.”
The role of nurses in delivering care and advocating for patients is expanding within the evolving heathcare system. In hospital setting research
post_author: nurses have been shown to decrease a length of stay for patients and subsequently decrease associated costs.  In order to live a healthy life and stay out of the hospital altogether
post_date: nurses provide consistent reinforcement and compassionate care. As doctors in the U.S. turn to specialization over general practice
post_date_gmt: nurses are filling a gap in medical centers and (increasingly) in preventive programs for employee health.

ID: Yet shortages remain. EHE nurse Mia Ross says that nurses are not readily accepted into the preventive/wellness realm.
<div>“But I think we can fill the void.  We are astute listeners
post_author: critical thinkers and are not afraid to advocate for patients and their wellbeing.  Imagine
post_date: though
post_date_gmt: if we had more nurses dedicated to prevention
post_content: subsequently bypassing hospitalization completely.  How much time and money would be saved?”

ID: Businesses have learned that employee health and wellbeing cannot be taken for granted. It’s unproductive to have sick staff and fiscally unsound to pay for chronic
post_author: preventable diseases. Detecting medical problems early and supporting healthy lifestyles is an ethical decision and smart business strategy. Nurses are vital to the success of preventive care and thus provide the foundation for employee health.

ID: MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: The information is not intended to constitute medical advice and is not a substitute for consultation with a physician or other health care provider. Individuals with specific complaints should seek immediate consultation from their personal physicians.

post_author: Nurses Are the Foundation of Employee Health
post_date: Nurses are the foundation of employee health as both a caregiver and resource for patients.
post_content: open

Foods that are refined, processed, and/or packaged – whether organic or non-organic – often contain high levels of added sodium/salt, saturated fat, dietary cholesterol, added sugars/caloric sweeteners, added fats/oils, refined flours/grains, and/or hydrogenated/Trans fats. As your diet is critical in maintaining your health, knowing how to read the Nutrition Facts Label and the Ingredients List on food items is necessary in understanding exactly what you’re putting into your body. This article will examine these two items and can help you to make better food decisions.

What is the Nutrition Facts Label?

Commonly found on the back of packaged food items, the Nutrition Facts Label displays pertinent nutritional information about a particular food product (See Figure 1). In 1990, the Nutrition Labeling and Education Act made it mandatory that this label appear on food items regulated by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA). This label contains key information that empowers individuals to make informed health choices including: the serving size and servings per container
post_title: the amount of calories consumed per serving
post_excerpt: the amount of nutrients consumed per serving
post_status: and the recommended values of certain nutrients based on a 2

ID: [caption id=\"attachment_1659\" align=\"alignright\" width=\"237\"] Figure 1: The Nutrition Facts Label as it appears on food. Image sourced from Wikipedia.[/caption]
The “Serving Size” and “Servings per Container” values at the top of the label can be used to guide understanding of the other values on the label. For example
post_author: if one serving size portion contains 230 calories and 160mg of sodium
post_date: then two serving size portions will contain 460 calories and 320mg of sodium. The serving size
post_content: is standardized across similar foods and is shown in units such as cups or teaspoons followed by their metric equivalents in grams.

ID: The amounts of “Calories” per serving along with the amount of “Calories from Fat” are displayed beneath the servings per container. Both weight gain and loss are commonly associated with caloric intake
post_author: making this section of particular importance to many individuals. However
post_date: calories are simply energy
post_date_gmt: and solely managing one’s caloric intake doesn’t lead to lasting health as such an approach does not factor in nutrients. There is a reason that the term “empty calories” exists.

ID: Beneath the calories is the “Nutrients” section which lists the values of important nutrients including fat
post_author: cholesterol
post_date: sodium
post_content: protein
post_excerpt: this section can be split up into two sub-sections: the nutrients that you want to limit and the nutrients that you want to maximize. In essence
post_status: foods containing vitamins (examples of which include vitamins A through K
post_name: and so on) should be consumed in abundance
to_ping: whereas foods with very little vitamins and/or large amounts of nutrients that are not vitamins (i.e. fat

post_author: there is the section that includes nutrient intake recommendations based on a 2
post_date: 000-calorie diet. As you may have noticed in Figure 1
post_date_gmt: the nutrients present on this list contain those that should be limited.

ID: [caption id=\"attachment_1660\" align=\"alignright\" width=\"461\"] Figure 2: The List of Ingredients highlighted in red. Image sourced from the Boston Public Health Commission.[/caption]
While the Nutrition Facts Label goes a long way in making healthy food choices
post_author: it is only half of the picture. It is also important to know the ingredients that were used in making the food. The Ingredients List is normally found near the Nutrition Facts Label for convenience (See Figure 2).

ID: According to the American Heart Association
post_author: there are two things to consider when reading the Ingredients List:

ID: The “ingredients are listed in order of quantity.” This means that the first few ingredients listed will be the ones that are primarily incorporated into the food. For example
post_author: in Figure 2 above
post_date: water
post_content: tomatoes
post_excerpt: corn
post_status: and red bell pepper are the primary ingredients of the food product (in descending order)
comment_status: with the rest of the ingredients making up less than two percent of the food.

ID: While the ingredients list displayed in Figure 2 is easy to read and understand
post_author: many other products aren’t so…digestible (See Figure 3 below).

ID: [caption id=\"attachment_1661\" align=\"aligncenter\" width=\"879\"] Figure 3: List of Ingredients in the popular breakfast cereal “Lucky Charms.” Image sourced from Berkeley.[/caption]
2. The “ingredients can go by several names.” As you will notice in Figure 3
post_author: the marshmallows have the second largest presence in the food and include several types of added sugar (among other additives). This brings us to the fact that certain ingredients
post_date: in this case sugar
post_content: ” “corn syrup
post_excerpt: many seemingly common ingredients can go by a variety of names. To fully understand what you are consuming

ID: FDA and other sources which help to demystify ingredient names.
In order to maintain your health
post_author: you must watch what you eat; however
post_date: simply choosing organic
post_content: or reduced calorie products won’t do the trick. You must know and understand the Nutrition Facts Label as well as the Ingredients List in order to ensure that what you’re putting into your body is: a) healthy and b) suitable for your current dietary needs. When selecting a product from the grocery store
post_title: it is recommended that you turn the container over and read the back.

ID: MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: The information is not intended to constitute medical advice and is not a substitute for consultation with a physician or other health care provider.

post_author: Maintaining Health While Healthy Part 4: Nutrition Facts Label and Ingredients List
post_date: In order to maintain your health, you must watch what you eat; however, simply choosing organic, sugar-free, or reduced calorie products won’t do the trick. You must know and understand the Nutrition Facts Label as well as the Ingredients List in order to ensure that what you’re putting into your body is healthy and suitable for your current dietary needs.
post_content: open

In the previous entry of the “Maintaining Health” series, it was established that what you put into your body is the most important factor in maintaining your health. But while reducing or eliminating refined, processed, and/or packaged foods is fundamental advice for cleaning up your diet, sometimes things get lost in translation when it comes time to shop. According to the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA)
post_title: the demand for organic produce has exploded from 2005 to 2014 and the trend looks to continue. However
post_excerpt: it is important to note that simply eating organic food doesn’t necessarily mean that one’s diet is safer and more nutritious.

ID: According to the USDA itself:
<em>“Organic is a labeling term that indicates that the food or other agricultural product has been produced through approved methods. These methods integrate cultural
post_author: biological
post_date: and mechanical practices that foster cycling of resources
post_content: and conserve biodiversity. Synthetic fertilizers
post_excerpt: irradiation
post_status: and genetic engineering may not be used.”

post_author: the National Organic Program of the USDA observes 4 organic distinctions:
all ingredients and processing aids must be organic
post_date: the information panel must identify organic ingredients
post_date_gmt: and the product may display the USDA organic seal.

post_author: most of the ingredients are organic
post_date: but non-organic ingredients specified on a National List may be used as well (up to five percent of food content). Foods that are organic must identify organic ingredients and may display the USDA organic seal.

ID: • “Made with organic:” This category specifies multi-ingredient products that contain at least 70 percent organic ingredients. The information panel must identify these ingredients
post_author: and the product may display up to three organic ingredients or ingredient categories on the front; the USDA organic seal may not be used.

ID: • Specific organic ingredients: This category specifies multi-ingredient products with less than 70 percent of its ingredients being organic. These products may only list its organic ingredients on the back as such and may not display the USDA organic seal.
It should be noted that none of the aforementioned categories require the inclusion of labels for livestock products such as:<em> free-range
post_author: cage-free
post_date: natural
post_content: pasture-raised
post_excerpt: and no added hormones.

ID: How Does Organic Food Compare to Non-Organic Food?
Individuals who aren’t familiar with the definition(s) of organic food tend to think that they are paying a premium for food that is safer and more nutritious than non-organic food; however
post_author: this is only partially true. According to a study published in the Annals of Internal Medicine
post_date: the nutritional content of organic foods was not determined to be significantly more nutritious than non-organic food; but the study goes on to say that the consumption of “organic foods may reduce exposure to pesticide residues and antibiotic-resistant bacteria.”

ID: Since the nutritional comparison of organic foods to non-organic foods is mostly a moot point
post_author: individuals who are looking to understand why choosing organic foods could be beneficial should look to what forms of pesticides are used on the food. According to the National Pesticide Information Center (NPIC)
post_date: organic foods have less pesticide residue when compared to their conventionally-grown counter-parts (non-organic food). Additionally
post_date_gmt: organic products may not use synthetic pesticides.

ID: While “organic pesticides vs. synthetic pesticides” is an ongoing debate in need of further research
post_author: with some sources remarking upon the harmlessness of both (1
post_date: 2)
post_date_gmt: what has been decided is that organic foods contain less pesticide residue.

ID: Choosing organic foods over non-organic foods won’t have a drastic effect on your health. Organic foods aren’t significantly more nutritious than non-organic foods and may still be refined
post_author: processed
post_date: and/or packaged—meaning their nutritional content may be reduced.

post_author: the things to look out for remain the same: added sodium/salt
post_date: saturated fat
post_content: added sugars/caloric sweeteners
post_excerpt: refined flours/grains
post_status: and hydrogenated/Trans fats. Individuals are encouraged to take note of these ingredients and their respective amounts as indicated on the Nutrition Label.

ID: By making decisions based on nutritional content rather than focusing too heavily on organic vs. non-organic
post_author: you can ensure that your diet is healthy and nutritious.

ID: MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: The information is not intended to constitute medical advice and is not a substitute for consultation with a physician or other health care provider. Individuals with specific complaints should seek immediate consultation from their personal physicians. It should be noted that none of the aforementioned categories require the inclusion of labels for livestock products such as: free-range
post_author: cage-free
post_date: natural
post_content: pasture-raised
post_excerpt: and no added hormones.

post_author: Maintaining Health While Healthy Part 3: Organic Foods
post_date: By making decisions based on nutritional content rather than focusing too heavily on organic vs. non-organic, you can ensure that your diet is healthy and nutritious.

The Journal of American Medicine reports that more than one-third (approximately 79 million) U.S. adults are obese. Obesity has been shown to be a significant risk factor for “heart disease
post_excerpt: type 2 diabetes and certain types of cancer.” The kicker is that these obesity-related conditions are the leading causes of preventable death. Yes
comment_status: these issues can be resolved by becoming and/or staying physically fit.

ID: <!--<br-->While people usually subscribe to the notion that physical fitness is for athletes and models
post_author: this article will present physical fitness as a preventive healthcare measure for everyone.

ID: Getting active and ‘in-shape’ as a means to maintain one’s good health is termed “health-related physical fitness
post_author: ” and the American College of Sports Medicine’s Guidelines for Exercise Testing and Prescription defines it as:

ID: <li><em>“A state characterized by (a) an ability to perform daily activities with vigor
post_author: and (b) a demonstration of traits and capacities that are associated with low risk of premature development of hypokinetic diseases (i.e.
post_date: those associated with physical inactivity.” (pg. 57)

ID: The “traits and capacities” mentioned are the components that determine health-related physical fitness. These include body composition
post_author: cardiorespiratory endurance
post_date: muscular strength and endurance

ID: To better understand the importance of increasing your physical fitness
post_author: you must first understand the physical fitness components listed above.

ID: Body composition: One’s body is naturally designed in a certain way. Some people are tall and others short
post_author: some people are bulky and others svelte. For this reason
post_date: body composition — the ratio of bodyweight made up of fat to that made up of fat-free tissue — is the preferred way to distinguish whether one is in a good place in regard to weight. Having a high ratio of fat to non-fat is detrimental to your health.

ID: Cardiorespiratory endurance: This component is the one that most individuals associate with physical fitness as it involves many muscles in the body
post_author: is typically moderate-to-high intensity
post_date: and includes dynamic movements — all while being performed for extended periods of time. The standard method of determining cardiorespiratory endurance is measuring one’s maximal oxygen uptake (or rate of oxygen consumption) during exercise (typically cardiovascular exercise).

ID: The Guidelines for Exercise and Testing Prescription states that:
<li>“… (a) low levels of cardiorespiratory fitness have been associated with markedly increased risk of premature death from all causes and specifically from cardiovascular disease
post_author: (b) increases in cardiorespiratory fitness are associated with a reduction in death from all causes
post_date: and (c) high levels of cardiorespiratory fitness are associated with higher levels of habitual physical activity
post_content: in turn

ID: Muscular strength and endurance: When it comes to the muscles in your body
post_author: strength and endurance are the categories that will determine your physical fitness. ‘Muscular strength’ involves the amount of force that a muscle can generate in a given time
post_date: and ‘muscular endurance’ refers to the number of times a muscle can be used (contracted) without exhausting.

post_author: muscular strength and endurance has numerous health benefits including: increasing your metabolism
post_date: reducing the ratio of fat to fat-free tissue in the body

ID: Flexibility: One of the more overlooked components of physical fitness
post_author: flexibility determines your range of motion. Being able to move without unnecessary encumbrance is key to physical fitness as it will determine your fitness ceiling. Inflexible people are unable to recruit their joints and muscles efficiently
post_date: and are thus limited in the exercises that they can perform. Put another way
post_date_gmt: inflexibility in a situation that might require greater range of motion (such as exercise) can cause tissue damage as the joints and muscles are pushed pass their limits.

ID: Tips and Exercises to Increase Health-Related Physical Fitness
Now that we understand the importance of being physically fit along with the components of fitness
post_author: it is time to act on this knowledge. But first
post_date: here are some important guidelines to remember from EHE International Health Coach Gayle Salomon:

ID: • Focus on you; don’t make comparisons with others unless it is used for motivation.
• Physical fitness is about movement and activity. Try an exercise and see if you can do it; worry about performance later.

post_author: remember to take it slow—progression is the aim.

ID: <li>Once you’ve become comfortable doing certain exercises/running certain distances
post_author: look to gradually increase the workload.

ID: <li>Age is a big factor in progression: the older you are
post_author: the more time it will take and the more care you should give to your fitness regimen.
you can switch up your routine by adding or targeting different muscle groups; just try something totally new so that you can keep improving.

ID: <li>Observe what you are doing so that progression may take place. Monitor your heart rate
post_author: count your steps
post_date: and time your runs. Take your exercise routine seriously by tracking your progress.

ID: By adhering to these simple guidelines
post_author: you will have a safe and healthy mentality when looking to increase your physical fitness.

ID: Body composition: Becoming physically fit will naturally help your body composition
post_author: so there aren’t specific exercises for body composition.
jogging
post_date: running
post_content: interval training
post_excerpt: and swimming. Remember to start out slow; look to increase your workload as you feel more comfortable.

ID: Muscular strength and endurance: Effective exercises include push-ups
post_author: sit-ups
post_date: squats
post_content: and calf-raises. For muscular strength
post_title: you should look to perform these movements with added weight; for muscular endurance
post_excerpt: you should look to practice timed tests in which you perform as many repetitions as you can
post_status: without sacrificing form. Beginners should first get used to the movements and then look to improve. More advanced individuals should look to increase resistance for strength and increase time

ID: Flexibility training: These exercises should be performed every day
post_author: ideally twice a day — 5 minutes in the morning and 5 minutes before going to bed. Flexibility training is similar to muscular training in that it is specific to target location (i.e.
post_date: if you stretch your legs
post_date_gmt: your shoulders won’t necessarily increase in flexibility). Some effective exercises are: hamstring and quadriceps stretching (standing
post_content: sitting
post_excerpt: spinal twists
post_name: and neck stretches. Beginners and advanced individuals should go as far as they can until they feel slightly uncomfortable — but not to the point of pain — and look to stretch
pinged: etc. a little further each time.

ID: Becoming physically fit is a mindset as much as it is a performance. By understanding the benefits of being physically fit and the types of exercise that will help you achieve your goals
post_author: you can embark on a journey toward a healthier life.

ID: MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: The information is not intended to constitute medical advice and is not a substitute for consultation with a physician or other health care provider. Individuals with specific complaints should seek immediate consultation from their personal physicians.

post_date: While people usually subscribe to the notion that physical fitness is for athletes and models, this article will present physical fitness as a preventive healthcare measure for everyone.

Whether you are a frequent international traveler or planning an once-in-a-lifetime vacation, you can ensure a healthy and safe trip by taking the necessary precautions. To best prepare, consult with a travel medicine expert at least six-to-eight weeks prior to traveling. In this consultation
post_title: you can discuss health precautions and preventive measures

Vitamins are nutrients that the body requires for normal cell function, growth and development. There are 13 essential vitamins: vitamins A, C, D, E and K along with the eight B vitamins (thiamine, riboflavin, niacin, pantothenic acid, biotin, vitamin B6, vitamin B12 and folate). Each vitamin plays an important role in body function and all vitamins are necessary for good health. The best way for an individual to ensure that he or she is consuming adequate amounts of vitamins is to adhere to a healthy diet that includes a variety of nutrient-dense, plant-based foods. According to the Dietary Guidelines Advisory Committee (DGAC)
post_title: nutrient intake should come primarily from food because foods contain many other substances that promote health. The use of supplements can never substitute for proper food choices.

ID: A diet that includes a wide variety of foods including fruits
post_author: vegetables (especially green leafy vegetables)
post_date: whole grains
post_date_gmt: fresh beans and lean sources of protein can adequately nourish an individual’s body with all necessary vitamins in addition to many other known important nutritional elements such as fiber
post_content: antioxidants and phytochemicals in their proper forms.

ID: The key is to make sure that the majority of one’s calories come from a variety of foods within each of these food groups.
There are a few times when supplements may be necessary to meet specific nutrient requirements. For example
post_author: individuals who have little exposure to sunlight or are otherwise at risk for vitamin D deficiency may need a vitamin D supplement. Women of childbearing age who do not consume an adequate diet may benefit from a folic acid supplement to help reduce the risk of certain birth defects. Adults over 50 may benefit from a B12 supplement as their ability to properly absorb and metabolize B12 may be reduced. Those who choose to follow a vegan diet may also benefit from a B12 supplement.

ID: If you have concerns about possible vitamin deficiencies
post_author: it is important that you discuss them with a physician. It is unnecessary and possibly even dangerous to make supplement decisions on your own. By adhering to a diet with the elements listed above
post_date: you should achieve nutrient adequacy without the need for supplements while also benefiting from the many other nutritional elements found in these healthful foods.

ID: MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: The information is not intended to constitute medical advice and is not a substitute for consultation with a physician or other health care provider.

People suffer from many issues, from psychological, to emotional, and of course physical, but dealing with these issues sometimes compound the problem rather than alleviating it; for instance, painkillers are commonly prescribed for those who are in pain, however, many prescribed painkillers (such as Oxycontin, Vicodin, Percocet, and their generic incarnations/derivatives) contain the inherent risk of dependence, whether it stems from a psychological dependence from being prescribed this medicine for a particular issue, an emotional dependence from the thought of having to deal with life without the effects of the drug, or a physical dependence from the drug’s active ingredient. A person’s pain threshold varies, not to mention it is impossible to measure pain outside of an individual asking the person suffering of the intensity of the sensation on a scale of 1 to 10—so prescribing pain medicine is a tricky situation. Nevertheless, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) states that: “The United States is in the midst of a prescription painkiller overdose epidemic.” And while the amount of prescribed painkillers has quadrupled since 1999
post_title: there “has not been an overall change in the amount of pain that Americans report.”

post_author: which means…?

ID: According to a recent MedlinePlus article
post_author: primary care doctors are the leading prescribers of narcotic painkillers with 28.1 million prescriptions being issued in 2013
post_date: data which was gathered by looking at “Medicare Part D prescription drug coverage claims.” Additionally
post_date_gmt: nurse practitioners and physician assistants issued 7.2 million prescriptions in their own right.

post_author: it comes as no surprise that the CDC reports that: “Every day
post_date: 44 people in the U.S. die from overdose of prescription painkillers

ID: So what is being done? What can be done? The article concludes by saying education in better prescription practices
post_author: increased oversight on healthcare providers
post_date: greater community awareness
post_date_gmt: and a willingness from both sides to curb habit-forming treatment as being the keys to success in the endeavor to reduce the painkiller epidemic.

ID: Another key component in reducing the amount of lives affected by prescription painkillers is to focus on preventive healthcare. While accidents happen and pain from different sources can be inevitable
post_author: treating the problem shouldn’t make it more severe. Preventive healthcare
post_date: which conditions patients to keep an eye on their health
post_date_gmt: while also giving them the support they need in order to accomplish their health goals will enable them to manage their situation better than just relying on prescribed medicine to magically fix the situation.

ID: Being prescribed painkillers doesn’t mitigate the risk inherent in these drugs. It simply allows individuals the ability to consume them in a (hopefully) controlled environment. But the fact of the matter is that people are overdosing or becoming addicted to these drugs at an increased rate that coincides with the amount of prescriptions being issues
post_author: all without reducing pain. So what does that mean? It means that magic beans can grow into a giant beanstalk leading to a golden solution to pain
post_date: but you must first evade the giant looking to keep you trapped in his castle.

There are many different methods that have successfully helped people to quit smoking including counseling services, self-help materials, prescription medications, over-the-counter (OTC) products such as skin patches, lozenges, and gum, and even quitting cold turkey. For most people, the best way to quit will entail some combination of the above including a change in personal habits and emotional support. It is important to remember that there is no safe level of exposure to tobacco smoke and there is no safe tobacco product. All forms of tobacco — cigarettes, pipes, cigars, hookahs, and smokeless tobacco — are hazardous to your health. Additionally, although marketed as such, filtered or low-tar products are not any ‘healthier’ for you than regular cigarettes. If you are a smoker who wants to quit, there is an abundance of help available. Nicotine replacement products and non-nicotine medications approved by the FDA can be very effective in helping you cope with cravings and withdrawal, while counseling and behavioral therapy can help you address the psychological aspects of quitting smoking.

The Bottom Line – For Your Health!

Remember that there is there is no one ‘right’ way to quit and that no single approach will be successful for all individuals. It may take several attempts, but quitting smoking is possible and the health benefits are undeniable and life-saving.
MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: The information is not intended to constitute medical advice and is not a substitute for consultation with a physician or other health care provider.
post_title: A Quick Thought on Smoking Cessation
post_excerpt: The benefits of regular physical activity are enormous. In addition to weight management, stress relief and an improved sense of well–being, the performance of regular physical exercise reduces the risk of many diseases and conditions, improves the overall quality of one’s life and helps maintain the functional independence of older adults.

post_content: Most expert organizations are in basic agreement about the need to limit fat intake:

ID: • The American Heart Association’s (AHA) Nutrition Committee recommends that healthy Americans over the age of two:
<li>Consume 25 to 35 percent of their total daily calories from fats in foods such as fish
post_author: nuts
post_date: and vegetable oils.

ID: <li>Limit the amount of saturated fats consumed to less than seven percent of total daily calories. For example
post_author: individuals that need approximately 2
post_date: 000 calories per day should consume less than 140 calories (or 16 grams) from saturated fats.

ID: <li>Limit the amount of trans fats consumed per day to less than one percent of total daily calories. For example
post_author: individuals that need approximately 2
post_date: 000 calories per day should consume less than 20 calories (or 2 grams) from trans fats.

ID: • Consume fats that are mainly monounsaturated or polyunsaturated.

• The Institute of Medicine (IOM) recommends that the total fat intake for adults 19 years of age and older be limited to no more that 20 to 35 percent of total calories. The IOM does not indicate maximum levels for saturated fat or trans fat
post_author: but suggests that individuals consume as little of these fats as possible.

ID: • The Guidelines recommend that Americans consume less than 10 percent of calories from saturated fat by replacing them with monounsaturated and polyunsaturated fats. To reduce cardiovascular disease risk further
post_author: the Guidelines suggest lowering the percentage to seven percent. Additionally
post_date: the consumption of trans fats should be should be kept as low as possible.

ID: It is important for individuals to monitor their fat intake. The Nutrition Facts label found on foods and beverages is there to help individuals compare foods and make informed food choices. The Nutrition Facts label must display the total fat per serving as well as the amount of saturated fat and trans fat per serving. Different brands of the same food type can vary widely in their fat content.

post_author: the FDA recommends looking at the Nutrition Facts label and combining the saturated and trans fats and choosing the product with the lower combined total. Health experts recommend that the consumption of fats be kept as low as possible
post_date: but recognize that eliminating them completely from the diet is not practical.

ID: An important caveat to be aware of is that manufacturers are able to list trans fats that fall below .5 grams per serving as “0 grams of trans fat per serving.” Consumers can view the products ingredient list
post_author: however
post_date: to see if a product does indeed contain some trans fats. If the terms
post_content: \" \"partially-hydrogenated vegetable oil
post_title: \" or \"hydrogenated vegetable oil\" appear on the ingredient list
post_excerpt: then the product does contain trans fats.

ID: The consistent consumption of excessive fat
post_author: particularly the wrong types of fat
post_date: can lead to serious health complications. Individuals must educate themselves regarding the many foods and beverages—both expected and unexpected—that contains saturated and trans fats so that they may monitor their intake and not exceed recommendations. The key is to choose unsaturated fats and to stay within individual calorie needs."
post_content: Understanding the recommended values for fat intake.
post_excerpt: open

post_content: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
post_excerpt: and the American Heart Association all recommend that individuals engage in strength training exercises at least two days per week.

post_author: a variety of exercises should be performed that work all muscle groups and can be performed up to three days per week (though there should be at least 48 hours between sessions). Most adults should perform two to four exercise ‘sets’ (a set is a specific number of exercise repetitions) per muscle group. Individuals should rest for two to three minutes between sets.

ID: <span id=\"hs_cos_wrapper_post_body\" data-hs-cos-type=\"rich_text\" data-hs-cos-general-type=\"meta_field\">The resistance or weight selected for each exercise should allow an individual to complete 8 to 12 repetitions per set
post_author: or the number needed to cause muscle fatigue but not exhaustion. This will improve strength and power for most adults. Older adults and/or those new to strength training may want to start with lower resistance and higher amounts of repetitions.
it is important to have specific goals to work toward (e.g.
post_date: increasing muscle size
post_content: power
post_title: and/or endurance). Each of these goals can be enhanced by modifying the load (or weight) lifted in a given set
post_excerpt: the volume (or total number of exercises
post_status: repetitions and sets) performed in a given session
ping_status: and the frequency or number of exercise sessions per week. The load
to_ping: and frequency with which an individual performs strength training exercises should always be determined by his or her goals
post_type: What are the recommendations on strength training?

post_content: The apparent suicide of beloved actor and ground-breaking comedian Robin Williams was greeted by a collective national shock. People are understandably distraught over a popular figure dying by his own hand.

ID: Robin was a performer bursting with vitality; sadness to the point of suicide didn’t appear to be in his DNA.
Although he has opened up about his alcohol and drug addiction over the years
post_author: Robin’s manic performance style left audiences with an impression his life was perhaps over-flowing at times but not depressed.

ID: Robin Williams’s death is a reminder of our misperceptions about clinical depression and its severity.
Depression is the most prominent mental disorder and a major national health risk
post_author: affecting nearly 16 million Americans at some point in their lives. “But despite how common the illness is
post_date: ” reports Karen Rowan of Yahoo News
post_date_gmt: “many people do not understand exactly what it means to have depression
post_content: and often think of it as being the same as sadness.” Mental health professionals define clinical depression as a severe mental state that doesn’t go away with time and places the sufferer’s physical health in danger.

ID: Mental illness takes a toll on the body. “Depression is a prevalent and chronic mental disorder causing suffering
post_author: loss of function and loss of life
post_date: ” says psychologist Dr. Mike Friedman
post_date_gmt: medical advisory board member at EHE International. Dr. Friedman further explains on his Psychology Today blog:

ID: “Depression is associated with reduced heart rate variability
post_author: platelet aggregation and increased sympathetic nervous system activity
post_date: all of which increase risks for patients with cardiac disease. Further
post_date_gmt: depressed individuals often have reduced energy and lower motivation
post_content: which interferes with activities like exercise
post_excerpt: and attending medical appointments
post_status: all of which are critical for restoring heart health.”

ID: Robin’s death tragically demonstrates the greatest threat. “Suicide is a common symptom of severe
post_author: clinical depression
post_date: ” explains Dr. John M. Grohol on his blog. “When properly treated
post_date_gmt: the feelings of suicide often remit as the depression lifts. But even under treatment
post_content: sometimes people choose to take their own life.”

ID: Suicide is the 10th leading cause of death in the U.S.
post_author: but Robin’s fate is not the inevitable result of depression. Mental illness has warning signs
post_date: knowable health risk factors
post_date_gmt: and available treatment options. \"But there are barriers that need to be overcome to adequately address depression
post_content: \" notes Dr. Friedman in a CNN.com op-ed. \"First and foremost
post_title: the stigma of depression is making us sicker.\" May the great funnyman’s loss serve to enlighten us about the reality of depression and help us to recognize and treat it early.

ID: MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: The information is not intended to constitute medical advice and is not a substitute for consultation with a physician or other health care provider. Individuals with specific complaints should seek immediate consultation from their personal physicians.

post_author: Robin Williams & Depression’s Health Risk
post_date: Robin Williams’s death is a reminder of our misperceptions about clinical depression and its health risk.
post_content: open
The NY Times recently posted an article with the headline “Cutting Sugar Improves Children’s Health in Just 10 Days
post_title: ” where they cite a study where foods with added sugar (as distinct from naturally-occurring sugar found in fruits) were removed from children’s diets and replaced with carbohydrates to keep overall calorie intake the same.

ID: This is significant because added sugar is typically refined sugar and is therefore stripped of all nutrients
post_author: essentially making them empty calories. But we’ll get back to that.
the results were considerable: While weight was unaffected during this time
post_date: their metabolic health changed significantly.

post_author: metabolic health is how well you break down and utilize the nutrients and minerals found in foods and beverages. “Good” foods such as fruits and vegetables are easier to break down and provide numerous macro and micronutrients—in other words they offer more bang for your buck and help maintain your metabolism. “Bad” foods
post_date: typically those that are highly processed and refined

ID: But this is somewhat common knowledge. The truly shocking facet of this study is how quickly metabolic health was affected once added sugar was removed. From the article:

post_author: the subjects’ LDL cholesterol
post_date: the kind implicated in heart disease
post_date_gmt: fell by 10 points. Their diastolic blood pressure fell five points. Their triglycerides
post_content: a type of fat that travels in the blood and contributes to heart disease
post_title: dropped 33 points. And their fasting blood sugar and insulin levels – indicators of their diabetes risk – likewise markedly improved.”

ID: To further the point about how significant this is
post_author: the Centers of Disease Control and Prevention remark that as of 2012
post_date: “about half of all adults—117 million people—had one or more chronic health conditions.” These conditions
post_date_gmt: also known as lifestyle diseases (think about that)
post_content: include “heart disease
post_excerpt: cancer
ping_status: and arthritis—are among the most common
post_name: and preventable of all health problems.”

ID: So by know I think you know where I’m going with this: This study showed how quickly added sugar destroys the body and begins to set the foundation for chronic disease later on in life. Unhealthy individuals don’t just become unhealthy; they always were
post_author: since childhood.

ID: Refined sugars are stripped of all macro and micronutrients making them “empty calories.” But the misconception is that “empty calories” simply cause weight gain
post_author: when in realty they cause weight gain through the deterioration of one’s metabolism—which of course leads to other problems besides having a gut. And on the topic of guts
post_date: alcohol (such as the seemingly innocuous beer) contains refined sugars
post_content: and an addictive agent as a nice cherry on top.

ID: So what did we learn? The mountain of evidence tells us to cut out added sugars (and on a related note alcohol) from our diet. But the marketing for these products will encourage consumption. As always the choice will be yours…
MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: The information is not intended to constitute medical advice and is not a substitute for consultation with a physician or other health care provider.

post_author: The Secret to Good Health, Now With Even More Evidence!
post_date: Added sugar, or refined sugars, can destroy the body and begins to set the foundation for chronic disease later on in life. You have the choice to cut out added sugars from our diet, but the marketing for these products will encourage consumption.
post_content: open
CVS, the national pharmacy and convenience retail chain, announced it will no longer sell tobacco products in its 7
post_title: 600 stores. CVS’s bold announcement (relinquishing nearly $2 billion in sales) may not effect whether someone takes their first puff or their last.

post_author: when a national pharmacy and wellness retailer stops selling a product known to cause preventable diseases to its customers
post_date: there’s an implicit preventive health message.

ID: The health hazards of smoking are well documented (EHE first raised the alarm in 1939)
post_author: and the benefits of quitting – no matter your age or when you stop – are undeniable. After the first 24 hours of quitting
post_date: for instance
post_date_gmt: a smoker’s chance of a heart attack decreases. But this knowledge doesn’t make quitting any easier.

ID: The best way to stop smoking is to never start or quit as early as possible. We all struggle with forecasting risks when we make decisions about our health. Many smokers will tell you this is critical.

post_author: Star Trek Actor Leonard Nimoy announced that he is suffering from chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) brought on by smoking. Fans became concerned when photographs of him with an oxygen tank surfaced.
prevention is a mind-set we need to get into early. Thinking preventively may help as us navigate the array of health decisions we face every day. Smoking
post_date: in particular
post_date_gmt: is a behavior that can profoundly impact your health later in life.

ID: MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: The information is not intended to constitute medical advice and is not a substitute for consultation with a physician or other health care provider. Individuals with specific complaints should seek immediate consultation from their personal physicians.

post_author: Seeing Through the Smoke: Cigarettes and the Preventive Health Message
post_date: AS CVS and other retailer announce an end to cigarette sales, preventive health comes in to focus as a business decision.
post_content: open

Does meal frequency matter? If so, what is the healthiest eating pattern? Three square meals a day? Two big meals? Six small meals? Grazing throughout the day? No eating after 7 p.m.? The truth is that such eating patterns can have an impact on weight and overall health, but this impact is limited and is closely related to other dietary factors. According to EHE International’s Dietician Jeff Novick, in light of the toxic food environment in the U.S., the frequency and timing of an individual’s meals is not as important as the types of foods consumed. In fact, when an individual adheres to a nutrient-rich, lower-calorie-dense diet, eating patterns are not as important as there is little danger of over-eating. Conversely, if an individual is consuming processed foods that are calorie-dense and nutrient-poor, he or she is much more likely to gain weight regardless of eating pattern. The 2010 Dietary Guidelines for Americans recommend that we avoid processed and refined foods
post_title: and to replace them with lower calorie
post_excerpt: nutrient–dense foods such as vegetables
ping_status: legumes and fat–free dairy products. In addition to weight management
post_password: a healthy dietary pattern that focuses on these types of foods can prevent diseases related to nutrient deficiencies and may also reduce the risk of chronic diseases such as diabetes

ID: At the end of the day
post_author: the healthiest eating pattern is the one that works best for you – provided that you are consuming a healthy diet and performing regular physical activity. If you are eating mostly fruits
post_date: vegetables
post_content: you have very little risk of overeating
post_title: no matter how many times a day you eat. If you are eating processed
post_excerpt: calorie-dense foods
comment_status: you have a very high risk of overeating and excessive calorie intake
ping_status: no matter how many times a day you eat.

ID: MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: The information is not intended to constitute medical advice and is not a substitute for consultation with a physician or other health care provider.

post_author: Should You Change Your Eating Pattern?
post_date: At the end of the day, the healthiest eating pattern is the one that works best for you.
post_content: open

Just as there is a separation of business from pleasure, so is there a separation of emotions from decision-making, yet a person who is emotionally healthy is characteristically better suited to make decisions than an emotionally unhealthy person. So are emotions really a hindrance for decision-making, or are they the scapegoat for a person who is dealing with emotional issues? Helpguide.org describes emotionally healthy people as being in control of their emotions and behavior and “able to handle life's inevitable challenges
post_excerpt: and lead productive
post_status: fulfilling lives. They bounce back when bad things happen and can manage stress without falling apart.”

ID: Being in control of one’s emotions is distinct from not employing them at all. Indeed
post_author: a past article from Psychology Today states outright that emotions drive decisions and that it is up to the individual to practice emotional intelligence
post_date: which is the skill of using life experience and self awareness to best manage one’s emotions when faced with a problem.

ID: As humans are emotional beings from birth
post_author: and knowing that emotions play a significant role in the outcome of a given situation
post_date: it makes sense then to discard the belief that you must separate emotions from decisions and instead take on the idea that intelligently applying those emotions will enable you to not only trust that decision

ID: MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: The information is not intended to constitute medical advice and is not a substitute for consultation with a physician or other health care provider.

post_author: Should You Separate Your Emotions from a Decision?
post_date: Just as there is a separation of business from pleasure, so is there a separation of emotions from decision-making, yet a person who is emotionally healthy is characteristically better suited to make decisions than an emotionally unhealthy person. So are emotions really a hindrance for decision-making, or are they the scapegoat for a person who is dealing with emotional issues?
post_content: open

From the novelty of the season’s first storm to the seemingly endless onslaught of recent weeks, snow has been a looming presence in the lives of many Americans this winter. Of course, snow does have its perks. It is enjoyable to look at, ski on top of, sled through, and roll into snowmen and snowwomen. What is much less enjoyable is the fact that snow needs to be removed – from roads, driveways, sidewalks, stairs, and walkways. And, while snow removal is almost always a nuisance, it can also be very dangerous if performed incorrectly or without proper precaution. Here are some preventive health tips to keep in mind the next time you head outside to grab your shovel or start your snow blower: Overall Health – Snow removal injuries can range from aches and muscle pulls to fatal heart attacks. If you have a medical condition or do not exercise regularly, it is important to consult a physician before shoveling or snow blowing.   It may not be a bad idea to hire someone to complete the work. Clothing – According to the CDC
post_title: you should dress in several layers of loose-fitting wool
post_excerpt: silk
post_status: or polypropylene clothing; wear a hat
ping_status: and a scarf or mask that covers the face and mouth; and wear a tightly-woven
post_password: wind and water-resistant coat and water-resistant boots.  Additionally
post_name: go indoors if persistent shivering occurs. Shivering should not be ignored as it is an important first sign that the body is losing heat.

ID: Sun Safety – According to the Skin Cancer Foundation (SCF)
post_author: “snow reflects up to 80 percent of the UV light from the sun
post_date: meaning that you are often hit by the same rays twice.” Apply a broad–spectrum
post_date_gmt: water–resistant sunscreen of at least SPF 30 to all exposed areas 30 minutes before going outdoors. Reapply every two hours or as needed. You can protect your eyes and vision by wearing goggles or sunglasses that block 99 to 100 percent of both UVA and UVB rays.

ID: Snow Removal Technique –The American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons (AAOS) recommends the following precautions:
• Warm up muscles (especially the back
post_author: arm and leg muscles) by stretching for at least ten minutes before beginning snow removal.

ID: • Use a shovel that is appropriate for your height and strength.
<li>Hold the shovel close to the body and always try to push rather than lift the snow. If lifting the snow cannot be avoided
post_author: it is important to do it properly by squatting with feet apart and lifting with the legs while keeping the back straight.

ID: • Lift only small amounts of snow at one time. Snow should never be thrown over the shoulder or to the side as those motions require twisting of the back and can lead to injury.
• Remove snow early and often during a snowstorm when the snow is light and powdery.
• Read instructions and carefully follow precautions listed in the operations manual when using a snow blower.
<li>Never stick hands in a snow blower. If snow becomes too impacted
post_author: stop the engine and wait at least five seconds before using a solid object to clear wet snow or debris from the chute.

ID: <li>Take frequent breaks and drink plenty of fluids to avoid dehydration. For both men and women
post_author: the most common sign of a heart attack is chest pain
post_date: pressure
post_date_gmt: or discomfort. Anyone who experiences these or other symptoms of a heart attack should stop and seek emergency care immediately.

post_author: the next time you head outdoors to remove snow
post_date: do it safely - take some extra time and heed the recommendations listed above.

ID: MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: The information is not intended to constitute medical advice and is not a substitute for consultation with a physician or other health care provider. Individuals with specific complaints should seek immediate consultation from their personal physicians.

post_author: Snow Removal Safety
post_date: Snow removal can be very dangerous if performed without proper preventive health precautions
post_content: open

HIV and AIDS have a close association, but just because one is afflicted with HIV doesn’t necessarily mean that they will get AIDS. However, not knowing of a positive HIV infection increases the likelihood of developing AIDS by a considerable amount. This is reflected in the findings by a study published in 2002 titled, “Late diagnosis of HIV infection in the era of highly active antiretroviral therapy: consequences for AIDS incidence.”

ID: This study assessed the trends and repercussions in AIDS-positive individuals who discovered that they were HIV-positive within the month of their AIDS diagnosis or the preceding month (deemed late-testers by the study) and compared them with the remainder of the AIDS-positive individuals.
This study takes place during the timeframe of 1994 through 2000
post_author: with 1996 onwards being significant as it coincided with the spread of highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART).

ID: Some of the findings from the study showed that:
<li>“Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia and Kaposi’s sarcoma were more frequent among late testers
post_author: whereas pulmonary tuberculosis and recurrent pneumonia were more frequent among the remainder.”

ID: <li>“Of the 18 755 AIDS cases diagnosed in the period 1994–1996
post_author: 24.1% were late testers
post_date: whereas among the 7825 diagnosed in the period 1998–2000

ID: • “The results show that more than one-third of AIDS cases diagnosed in Spain between 1998 and 2000 had been unaware of their HIV infection until the month of diagnosis or the one immediately preceding it.”

While HAART has made HIV extremely manageable—to the point where it can be considered a chronic disease like diabetes—early detection remains the most important factor when treating it. Even as AIDS cases as a whole have gone down due to HAART
post_author: this study showed that HIV-positive individuals who don’t get tested are at an increased risk for developing AIDS.

ID: While HAART has made the HIV extremely manageable
post_author: early detection of the disease is still critical for treatment.

ID: MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: The information is not intended to constitute medical advice and is not a substitute for consultation with a physician or other health care provider.

post_author: Study Shows that Early Detection of HIV is Critical
post_date: Study Shows that Early Detection of HIV is Critical
post_content: open

By adhering to a healthy, nutrient-rich, plant-based diet, individuals can ensure that they are consuming the 13 essential vitamins needed to keep the body healthy and performing properly. These vitamins are...
  • Vitamin A: According to the National Institutes of Health (NIH)
post_title: vitamin A plays an important role in immune system function
post_excerpt: vision
post_status: reproduction and cellular communication. It is a fat-soluble vitamin that helps to form and maintain the health of skin
post_password: soft tissue and mucus membranes. Vitamin A also supports cell growth and differentiation and plays a critical role in the normal formation and maintenance of the heart

ID: • Vitamin C: Vitamin C (also known as “ascorbic acid”) is a water-soluble vitamin that is needed for the growth and repair of tissues in all parts of the body as well as the formation of collagen
post_author: an important protein used to create skin
post_date: bone
post_content: tendons
post_title: ligaments and blood vessels. Vitamin C plays an important role in the healing of wounds
post_excerpt: normal immune system function and the maintenance of bone and tooth health. Vitamin C also works as an antioxidant that protects cells from free-radical damage.

ID: • Vitamin D: Vitamin D is a fat-soluble vitamin that helps to maintain normal blood levels of calcium and phosphorus. It also helps to maintain bone health. It is naturally found in only a few foods but is produced naturally by the body as a result of sun exposure.
• Vitamin E: Vitamin E is a fat-soluble vitamin found in many foods
post_author: fats and oils. Vitamin E plays a role in the formation of red blood cells
post_date: helps to widen blood vessels and helps to prevent blood clots. It also acts as an antioxidant. Vitamin E exists in eight different forms; alpha-tocopherol is the most active form in humans.

ID: • Vitamin K: Vitamin K is a fat-soluble vitamin that plays an important role in bone health and is essential to the function of several proteins involved in blood clotting. Blood is not able to clot without vitamin K.
• Vitamin B6: Vitamin B6 is a member of the water-soluble family of B-complex vitamins. It is required for protein and glucose metabolism and is needed to make hemoglobin
post_author: the component of red blood cells that carries oxygen throughout the body. Vitamin B6 is also required for normal nervous system function and is essential for immune system function as it helps to maintain the health of the thymus
post_date: spleen and lymph nodes.

ID: • Vitamin B12: Vitamin B12 is a water-soluble vitamin that has the largest and most complex chemical structure of any vitamin. Vitamin B12 is essential for proper red blood cell formation
post_author: neurological function and DNA synthesis. It exists in several forms; mthylcobalamin and 5-deoxyadenosyl cobalamin are the active forms in the human body.

ID: • Biotin: Biotin (sometimes called “Vitamin H” or “Vitamin B7”) is a water-soluble vitamin that is generally classified as a B-complex vitamin. Biotin is essential for the formation of fatty acids and glucose
post_author: and allows the body to metabolize carbohydrates
post_date: fats and amino acids. Biotin is also important for normal embryonic growth
post_date_gmt: making it a critical nutrient during pregnancy.

ID: • Folate: Folate (also called “Vitamin B9” or “folic acid”) is a water-soluble B-complex vitamin. Folate is needed to create DNA and RNA
post_author: and helps to prevent changes to DNA that may lead to cancer. Folate is also essential for the metabolism of homocysteine. A healthy diet with adequate levels of folate may reduce a woman's risk of having a child with a brain or spinal cord defect. To reduce the risk of neural-tube defects in newborns
post_date: the U.S. Food and Drug Administration introduced mandatory folic acid fortification of enriched cereal grain products in 1998.

ID: • Niacin: Niacin (also known as “nicotinic acid” or “vitamin B3”) is a member of the water-soluble family of B-complex vitamins. Niacin plays a role in the function of the digestive system
post_author: skin and nerves. It is also helps the body to convert food to energy.

ID: • Pantothenic Acid: Pantothenic acid (also known as “vitamin B5”) is a member of the water-soluble family of B-complex vitamins. Pantothenic acid is needed for the breakdown of carbohydrates
post_author: proteins and fats. It also plays a role in the production of hormones and cholesterol
post_date: and influences normal growth and development.

ID: • Riboflavin: Riboflavin (also called “vitamin B2”) is a member of the water-soluble family of B-complex vitamins. Riboflavin is needed to help break down carbohydrates
post_author: proteins and fats. It plays a role in body growth and red blood cell production. Riboflavin also helps the body to release energy from carbohydrates and change vitamin B6 and folate into forms that the body can use.

ID: • Thiamine: Thiamine (also called “vitamin B1” and “aneurin”) is a water-soluble B-complex vitamin. It plays a crucial role in certain metabolic reactions and helps the body's cells to convert carbohydrates into energy. It is essential for the functioning of the heart
post_author: muscles and nervous system.

ID: By adhering to a diet with the elements listed above
post_author: you should achieve nutrient adequacy without the need for supplements while also benefiting from the many other nutritional elements found in these healthful foods.

ID: MEDICAL DISCLAIMER: The information is not intended to constitute medical advice and is not a substitute for consultation with a physician or other health care provider.

post_author: The 13 Essential Vitamins
post_date: By adhering to a healthy, nutrient-rich, plant-based diet, individuals can ensure that they are consuming the 13 essential vitamins needed to keep the body healthy and performing properly.
post_content: open
According to the National Digestive Diseases Information Clearinghouse, \more than 50 million Americans have heartburn at least once a month and approximately 15 million have it every single day.\"

post_author: heartburn is a relatively harmless discomfort that can be treated effectively with lifestyle changes and over–the–counter medication.

ID: Common causes or \"triggers\" of heartburn include:

post_author: the hormone progesterone can cause the lower esophageal sphincter (LES) to relax and allow stomach acid to back up into the esophagus
post_date: resulting in heartburn. Additionally
post_date_gmt: a pregnant woman’s enlarged uterus can crowd the abdomen and push stomach acids upward (this is especially common in the third trimester).

ID: • Certain foods and beverages: There are certain foods and beverages that commonly trigger heartburn including tomato–based foods
post_author: citrus fruits and juices
post_date: chocolate
post_content: fatty or fried foods
post_excerpt: garlic
ping_status: caffeinated beverages such as coffee and tea

ID: • Large meals: When an individual eats a large meal
post_author: his or her stomach becomes stretched. This stretching causes the individual to feel \"stuffed\" and also puts pressure on the LES that may cause stomach acid to back up into the esophagus. Any large meal can cause heartburn
post_date: even meals that do not contain foods and beverages that are known to trigger symptoms.

ID: • Pressure on the stomach: Heartburn can be triggered when an individual puts pressure on his or her stomach by lying down after a meal
post_author: wearing tight clothing
post_date: bending over frequently
post_date_gmt: exercising when full and/or being overweight or obese.

ID: • Smoking: Smoking weakens the LES which can exacerbate heartburn.
• Certain medications: Some medications cause heartburn by relaxing the LES. Such medications include drugs that are used to treat asthma and/or allergies
post_author: high blood pressure and urinary tract infections
post_date: as well as muscle relaxants

ID: Once an individual’s triggers are known
post_author: the avoidance of heartburn is often a simple matter of lifestyle modifications:
more frequent meals

ID: Most heartburn symptoms will dissipate with the modifications listed above. However
post_author: if your symptoms are persistent and become more severe and/or frequent
post_date: it is important that you consult a healthcare professional."
