post_content: Knowing the symptoms of stress is vitally important to preventive health, and learning good stress management skills is one of the hallmarks of a good preventative health care plan. While a little stress in life is normal, and can actually boost motivation and concentration, chronic stress contributes to lowered immune system function, addictive behaviors, and many chronic and degenerative illnesses. In our modern era, we are confronted with ongoing societal and workplace stress in ways we are not biologically designed to cope with. The fight or flight response is meant to be intense
post_excerpt: and then regulated as the body returns to homeostasis
post_status: but we are often exposed to a near constant stream of potential stressors that take their toll on our physical and mental health over time. Here are some of the top signs that stress is negatively impacting your health and well-being
comment_status: and what you can do about it.

post_author: anger
post_date: and / or irritability

ID: Managing stress well takes a two-pronged approach: we do what we can to structure our lives in such a way that we prevent stress where we can
post_author: and when confronted with stress we cannot control
post_date: we can develop skills that help ourselves process events in healthier ways. We are aiming to minimize the stress burden on our minds and bodies as much as possible. Here are five stress management techniques that will help:

ID: Diaphragmatic breathing helps to quickly reset your parasympathetic nervous system (the stress regulating part of your nervous system) after stress induced fight or flight mode. When we are under stress our breathing tends to be tight
post_author: shallow
post_date: and centered in the chest. By taking some conscious deep breaths from your diaphragm for a few minutes
post_date_gmt: you will reduce your stress hormone (cortisol) levels
post_content: and help your body regulate back to a state of calm.

ID: Meditation is one of the most efficient stress reduction techniques we know of. Regular mindfulness meditation reduces the amount of neurons in the amygdala
post_author: which is the area of the brain associated with fear
post_date: stress and anxiety. A regular meditation practice helps train you to release negative thought patterns while changing the brain on a structural level as well.

ID: Regular exercise releases endorphins which help you relax and feel good
post_author: it boosts your mood
post_date: and increases feelings of calm while lowering symptoms of anxiety
post_date_gmt: stress and depression. Regular exercise also improves sleep
post_content: which is key to good stress management.

ID: Practicing gratitude is shown to increase optimism and reduce the harmful effects of stress. A simple gratitude list or journal that you work with each day is a powerful way to boost your resilience against stress and hardship. In the face of life’s challenges
post_author: it is helpful to remember the things in our lives that are good
post_date: however simple they may be. Try this: each night before bed
post_date_gmt: jot down five to ten things you feel grateful for in your life. Take the time to feel
post_content: not just think about
post_title: why you are grateful for this person or aspect of your life. With time and practice the benefits to your mood and stress resilience will increase.

ID: Social support is key to good mental and emotional health. Being able to talk to a trusted friend or advisor about our troubles helps us feel connected to others
post_author: and reduces feelings of isolation. People with higher levels of social support report lower levels of depression and anxiety
post_date: higher self-esteem and are better able to cope with stress. Many people need more emotional support than they have access to
post_date_gmt: so it may be necessary to consciously work to build a better support network in your life. Reach out to a colleague or friend
post_content: take a new class where you will meet others with common interests
post_title: or seek professional therapy when needed. Community support groups can also be an invaluable resource for connecting with others for specific problems such as illness
post_excerpt: addiction recovery
post_status: or other stress related life events.

post_author: the demands placed on us in life can be overwhelming at times
post_date: but with practice we can develop greater stress resilience and problem solving skills. While we cannot avoid all the stressors that we encounter
post_date_gmt: we can develop healthier responses for coping with life’s inevitable hardships. Not only will skillful stress management increase your mental and emotional health
post_content: it is part of an overall preventative care lifestyle that will help you avoid many chronic and degenerative illnesses
post_title: and increase your longevity and quality of life for years to come.

ID: "
post_author: Top Ten Symptoms of Stress and Skills for Management
post_content: open
June is Men's Health Month. Many men take their health for granted until something happens that requires a trip to the doctor. According to MedlinePlus
post_excerpt: men are more likely to engage in unhealthy and risky behaviors including smoking
comment_status: and delaying regular check–ups and medical care. Men’s Health Month is celebrated each year to encourage men to make their health a priority in order to lead longer

post_author: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that men take the following important steps:

ID: Adequate sleep is vital to a man’s health and well-being. According to the CDC
post_author: inadequate sleep is associated with numerous chronic diseases including diabetes
post_date: cardiovascular disease
post_content: and depression. Poor sleep habits can cause many important aspects of life to suffer including work performance
post_excerpt: productivity
post_status: and safety. Sleep needs are largely individual
comment_status: and some men can thrive with less sleep than others; however
post_name: most adults need approximately seven to eight hours of sleep each night.

ID: The most important step that men can take to protect their health is to never start smoking. For men who already smoke
post_author: the healthiest thing to do is to stop smoking. According to the CDC
post_date: cigarette smoking is the leading cause of preventable and premature death in the United States
post_content: 000 deaths each year. According to the U.S. Surgeon General
post_title: \"10 times as many U.S. citizens have died prematurely from cigarette smoking than have died in all the wars fought by the United States during its history. Study after study has confirmed the magnitude of the harm caused to the human body by exposure to toxicants and carcinogens found in tobacco smoke.\" Smoking negatively affects nearly every organ in the body and impacts a man’s overall health tremendously. For smokers who want to quit
post_excerpt: there is a considerable amount of information and support available.

post_author: the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
post_date: the American Heart Association (AHA)
post_date_gmt: and the American Cancer Society (ACS) all agree that most adults should engage in a minimum of 150 minutes of moderate–intensity exercise each week. The performance of regular physical activity offers many benefits including weight management
post_content: stress relief
post_excerpt: a reduction in the risk of many diseases and conditions
post_status: improvement in the overall quality of one’s life
comment_status: and the maintenance of functional independence among older adults. According to the CDC
ping_status: \"Only a few lifestyle choices have as large an impact on your health as physical activity. People who are physically active for about 7 hours a week have a 40 percent lower risk of dying early than those who are active for less than 30 minutes a week.\" The ACSM concurs
post_password: reporting that most causes of death are delayed by regular performance of physical activity.

ID: A healthy eating pattern is fundamental to the maintenance of good health and wellbeing. According to the <a href=\"http://www.health.gov/dietaryguidelines/dga2010/dietaryguidelines2010.pdf\"><i>Dietary Guidelines for Americans
post_date: a diet that is considered to be healthy is one that limits the intake of salt
post_content: added sugars and sweeteners
post_excerpt: and refined grains. A healthy diet also emphasizes the consumption of plant–based foods that are low in calorie density and high in nutrient density (i.e.
post_name: and legumes) as well as lean proteins. Healthy eating that focuses on these nutrient–dense foods can help to control weight and reduce the risk of chronic diseases such as diabetes
pinged: and certain cancers. The specific amounts of each food group that a man should consume will depend upon his age and physical activity level
post_modified: but the overall recommendation is for men to follow the MyPlate recommendations.

ID: According to the latest Stress in America survey
post_author: the average stress level in men has decreased since 2007 (4.5 on a 10–point scale in 2014 versus 6.0 in 2007). However
post_date: this level remains significantly higher than the 3.7 stress rating considered to be healthy. While women report higher stress levels than men
post_date_gmt: men are less likely than women to engage in an activity to help relieve or manage stress. Research has shown that high levels of stress can exacerbate existing illnesses and contribute to the development of conditions such as heart disease
post_content: high blood pressure
post_excerpt: and obesity. Because stress can have such a negative impact on a man’s health
post_status: the importance of stress management cannot be overstated. Everyone experiences stress differently
comment_status: and there is no single method for managing or reducing stress that will work for everyone or in every situation. However
ping_status: men can manage stress by learning to identify their stressors and then find ways to cope with and reduce their exposure to these stressors. Often
post_password: a combination of stress management techniques works best.

ID: There are other important choices men can make each day that will lead to a safer
post_author: healthier life and that will protect them from disease and disability:
the moderate consumption of alcohol is safe and even beneficial for most men
post_date: while the excessive consumption of alcohol has no benefits whatsoever and can be damaging. Moderate alcohol consumption is defined by the Guidelines as the consumption of no more than two alcoholic drinks per day for men. Men who consume excessive amounts of alcohol can suffer both short– and long–term negative effects. According to the National Council on Alcoholism and Drug Dependence (NCADD)
post_date_gmt: excessive alcohol consumption can negatively impact a man’s finances
post_content: emotional stability
post_excerpt: family
comment_status: and can also lead to a variety of health problems including neurological problems; cardiovascular problems; psychiatric or psychological problems; unintentional injuries; increased risk of liver
post_modified: and colorectal cancers; liver diseases; and gastrointestinal problems. Any man who suspects he may have an alcohol use disorder should talk to a healthcare professional familiar with his circumstances to help determine whether or not a problem exists and to develop a treatment plan if a disorder does exist.

ID: Safety Habits: Some important everyday safety precautions include wearing a seat-belt whenever traveling in a motor vehicle
post_author: wearing a helmet when on a motorcycle or bicycle
post_date: wearing sunscreen
post_content: and following a healthcare professional’s advice for managing chronic conditions.

ID: Preventive medical screenings and exams are conducted to establish a physical health baseline. While there are general screening guidelines
post_author: it is important for all men to develop a partnership with a knowledgeable healthcare provider who can personalize screening recommendations according to each man’s unique needs. General screening guidelines are as follows:

ID: Blood pressure: The U.S. Preventive Services Task Force (USPSF) recommends that
post_author: beginning at age 18
post_date: men with normal blood pressure (lower than 120/80 millimeters of mercury [mmHg]) have their blood pressure checked at least once every two years; men with blood pressure between 120/80 and 139/89 should have their blood pressure checked annually. \"High\" blood pressure (HBP) is classified as 140/90 or higher
post_date_gmt: and men with HBP should consult with a physician for the appropriate screening schedule.

post_author: Lung and Blood Institute (NHLBI)
post_date: adults aged 20 and older should have their cholesterol tested at least once every five years. Adults who have risk factors such as diabetes
post_date_gmt: a body mass index (BMI) of 30 or higher
post_content: and/or a history of heart disease
post_excerpt: or high blood pressure should be tested more often. Optimal cholesterol levels are as follows:

ID: Diabetes: According to Standards of Medical Care in Diabetes—2014
post_author: men without risk factors should be tested for diabetes at age 45 with repeated testing at least every 3 years if results are normal. The American Diabetes Association (ADA) also recommends that men who are overweight (a BMI greater than 25) and have additional risk factors be screened for diabetes regardless of age
post_date: while the USPSTF recommends screening for men whose blood pressure is higher than 135/80.

ID: Depression: Depression is a serious mental health condition that can last for weeks
post_author: months
post_date: or even years and greatly impact a man’s daily functioning. According to the National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH)
post_date_gmt: men often experience depression differently than women. Men may be more likely to feel very tired and irritable
post_content: lose interest in their work
post_excerpt: or hobbies
post_status: and be more likely to have difficulty sleeping. Additionally
comment_status: while women who suffer from depression are more likely to attempt suicide
ping_status: men are more likely to die by suicide. Men who experience symptoms of depression should discuss screening options with a healthcare professional.

ID: Prostate Cancer: There are two tests that can be used for the early detection of prostate cancer:
• Prostate Specific Antigen (PSA): According to the National Cancer Institute (NCI)
post_author: the PSA test is a blood test that measures the level of prostate–specific antigen (a protein produced by the prostate) in the blood. The level of PSA in the blood can be higher in men who have prostate cancer
post_date: though the PSA level may also be elevated due to other conditions.

ID: • Digital Rectal Exam (DRE): A doctor or nurse will insert a gloved
post_author: lubricated finger into the rectum to feel the prostate
post_date: estimate its size
post_date_gmt: and to feel for lumps or other abnormalities.

ID: If the results of the PSA or DRE are abnormal
post_author: additional testing will be necessary to definitively diagnose prostate cancer. Based upon the findings of its medical advisory board
post_date: EHE considers PSA screening in all men aged 40 and over. Absolute PSA levels are measured
post_date_gmt: as is the rate of change across different measurements. EHE discusses all potential advantages and shortcomings of the PSA test with patients prior to screening.

ID: Quadrivalent Human Papillomavirus (HPV4) Vaccine: According to the CDC
post_author: the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP) recommends routine use of HPV4 among males who are 11 or 12 years of age
post_date: though boys as young as 9 may be immunized. Vaccination with HPV4 is also recommended for males between the ages of 13 and 21 who were never vaccinated previously or who did not complete the 3–dose series. Men aged 22 through 26 years may also be vaccinated.

post_author: this vaccination is especially important for men who: have sex with men; use street drugs; suffer from chronic liver disease; are being treated with clotting factor concentrates; work with hepatitis A–infected primates or who work with hepatitis A in research laboratories; or are in a household planning to adopt a child
post_date: or care for a newly–arriving adopted child from a country where hepatitis A is common. Two doses of the vaccine given at least six months apart are needed for lasting protection.

post_author: this vaccination is especially important for men who: are sex partners of people who are Hepatitis B–positive; are infected with HIV; have had multiple sex partners; have sex with men; are current or recent street drug users; are household contacts of people who are hepatitis B–positive; are residents and staff of facilities for the developmentally disabled; have chronic liver or kidney disease or who are on dialysis; are under age 60 with diabetes; travel to countries where hepatitis B is common; and work in occupations that expose them to human blood or other body fluids.
all men aged 13 to 64 should be tested at least once for HIV. Additionally
post_date: annual screening for HIV is recommended for men who have had unprotected sex with multiple partners; have used injected drugs or have had sex partners who have used injected drugs; have paid for sex or had sex partners who have paid for sex; have past or current sex partners who are infected with HIV; or are being treated for sexually–transmitted diseases. The frequency with which an individual is tested will depend on his activities and sexual contacts.

ID: Sexually–Transmitted Diseases: The CDC recommends that all men who have sex with men be screened at least once a year for syphilis
post_author: chlamydia
post_date: and gonorrhea. Additionally
post_date_gmt: all men who have sex with men and who have multiple or anonymous partners should be screened more frequently.

ID: Colorectal Cancer: While the ACS and the USPSTF recommend screening beginning at age 50
post_author: EHE International’s Medical Advisory Board recommends a screening (colonoscopy) beginning at age 40 and repeated every 5 to 10 years or as otherwise recommended by a gastroenterologist. The Board’s findings are based on extensive research which indicates that the incidence of polyps is as common between the ages of 40 and 49 as it is between the ages of 50 and 79. EHE also recommends that men with a family history or other risk factors consult a physician about beginning screenings at a younger age and/or being screened more frequently.

ID: Vascular Screening: EHE International strongly recommends vascular screening for all men over the age of 50 as well as men who have certain risk factors. Screening forms the first line of defense against vascular disease. Detection of disease while an individual is still asymptomatic allows for early disease management and the avoidance of potentially–devastating health events. EHE recommends the following vascular screening exams:
• Ultrasound study of the abdominal aorta: This screening exam looks for abdominal aortic aneurysms (AAA)
post_author: which are weaknesses or bulges in the wall of the abdominal aorta.

ID: • Ultrasound study of the carotid arteries: This screening exam looks for atherosclerosis of the carotid arteries
post_author: the two large blood vessels in the neck that supply oxygen–rich blood to the brain.

ID: • Ankle–brachial index (ABI) using Doppler blood pressure measurement: This screening exam is performed using a blood pressure cuff and a pencil–shaped ultrasound device called a \"Doppler.\" The test is used to check for peripheral artery disease (PAD). The ABI test can also be used to follow the improvement or worsening of leg circulation over time.
Many factors affect your health. Although some factors cannot be controlled such as one’s genetic makeup or age
post_author: there are important preventive steps that can be taken in order to live a longer
post_date: healthier life. Having regular physical exams
post_date_gmt: getting appropriate screenings throughout one’s lifespan
post_content: and leading a healthy lifestyle are three of the most important preventive measures that can be controlled. This year
post_title: celebrate Men’s Health Month by encouraging the men in your life to make their health a priority and to follow these simple steps for a longer
post_excerpt: healthier

post_content: National Safety Month is the time to think about safety and preparedness. If you have expired medications
post_excerpt: or safety lights due for replacing
post_status: now is the time to take action and finish up those projects. Injuries are the leading cause of death for people age 1 to 44
comment_status: and they are the leading cause of disability across all age groups. There are many things you can do to stay safe and reduce risks to you and your family; it is also important to report safety hazards in your workplace and communities
ping_status: and to encourage others to do the same.

ID: What is the Purpose of National Safety Month?
Each week of National Safety Month is dedicated to raising awareness about a different potential safety risk. Topics for discussion include:
• Medication Safety and Prescription Painkiller Abuse. Medications are required to manage some illnesses and health conditions
post_author: and are generally safe when prescribed and used correctly. That said
post_date: there are potential risks with any drug
post_date_gmt: including side effects; addiction to prescription painkillers is a risk with certain narcotic
post_content: and synthetic or semi-synthetic opiates
post_title: though other types of prescription drugs can be addictive as well. Learn to recognize the signs of prescription drug abuse
post_excerpt: and always talk to your doctor about potential risks and side effects before embarking on a new drug regimen.

ID: • Transportation Safety Tips. General safety tips for drivers include obeying all traffic laws
post_author: abiding by traffic lights
post_date: and speed limits. Slow down
post_date_gmt: stay alert and be ready to stop. Be aware of crosswalks
post_content: school bus flashing lights
post_title: and residential neighborhoods where children live and play. Avoid distractions when behind the wheel
post_excerpt: and be aware of the dangers of texting while driving: there is a 1 in 4 chance that a motor vehicle accident will involve a cell phone
post_status: so put the phone away when operating a vehicle.

ID: • First Aid and Preparedness. Preparedness means having supplies on hand
post_author: and readily transportable
post_date: that will help you in the event of an accident or disaster. Stored gallons of water
post_content: non-perishable foods
post_excerpt: and extra batteries are all items (among others) you will want included in your kit. Also consider taking a first-aid and CPR course that will train you to intervene in the case of certain injuries and / or life-threatening emergencies.

ID: • Preventing Slips and Falls. Tips for avoiding injuries through falls
post_author: especially at home
post_date: include wearing adequate footwear
post_date_gmt: as opposed to stocking feet or being barefoot. Athletic shoes decrease our risk of falls and slips
post_content: particularly as we age. Use non-skid rugs in the home
post_title: and be sure to store items you use frequently in easy-to-reach places. As always
post_excerpt: be sure to exercise: a conditioned body has better strength and balance
post_status: and is more resilient against injury in the case of a fall. Repair broken and damaged steps and stairways
post_password: mindful steps as you go about your day.

ID: • Workplace Safety. Creating a safety culture in the workplace includes everything from identifying potential environmental safety hazards
post_author: to health forums and preventative care and wellness programs. Employers who express care towards the health and safety of their employees see improved morale and productivity
post_date: lower costs
post_date_gmt: and fewer workplace injuries and absenteeism.

ID: Everyone can get involved in safety education for National Safety Month
post_author: and beyond. Applying our knowledge and sharing what we learn helps spread awareness within our communities and workplaces. Together we can share information about how we can all better protect ourselves
post_date: friends
post_date_gmt: and families from preventable accidents and injuries.

Summer is the perfect time to make good on your fitness goals, and adding outdoor sports to your workout regimen is a great way to increase exercise and fun. Outdoor sports are the perfect addition to your weekly yoga class or time at the gym, and fresh air and sunshine do wonders for your health and your mood. Whether you prefer the beach, a forest hike, or a river rafting trip, there are many diverse and amazing ways for you to break up your routine and get outside this summer. Here is our top ten list of <a href=\https://eheintl.com/join-adult-recreational-sports-team/\">sports to get you out of the house
post_excerpt: and having a great time this year.

ID: <li>One of the best forms of exercise
post_author: and a great way to get active in the water
post_date: outdoor swimming is the perfect summer activity. And <a href=\"http://www.arthritis.org/living-with-arthritis/exercise/arthritis-friendly/lap-swimming.php\">if you have arthritis or problems with your joints
post_content: no impact workout.

ID: <li>Tennis can be played year round if you have access to an indoor court
post_author: but a match outside in the fresh air is even better
post_date: so grab a buddy

post_author: or want to coordinate some family or friend time
post_date: biking in the warmer months is a great way to get some exercise outside; and if you can manage a biking commute to work when the weather allows

ID: • Frisbee Golf. Local parks often have Frisbee golf courses set up
post_author: so all you need to do is grab your friends and your Frisbees
post_date: and enjoy some time at the park.

ID: <li>If you have an adventurous streak and love the outdoors
post_author: kayaking is an exhilarating form of summer exercise. There is nothing like getting active in the water in a gorgeous
post_date: natural setting. If you are a first-time kayaker
post_date_gmt: take a lesson or get an experienced guide or friend to go with you
post_content: and show you the ins and outs of navigating the rapids.

ID: <li>Check in with your local archery club or organization
post_author: and see what outdoor events and classes are available throughout the warmer months.

ID: • Beach volleyball. If you enjoy focused competition and teamwork
post_author: beach volleyball is for you. Many beaches have nets set up for use; just grab your friends
post_date: your sunscreen
post_content: and enjoy a gorgeous day in the sun.

ID: • Run a 5k. A 5k is great for both experienced runners and newbies. If you are new to running you’ll need to start training in the spring to build strength
post_author: cardiovascular fitness
post_date: and endurance. Usually you will register in advance
post_date_gmt: so you have time to prepare in the months leading up to your race.

ID: <li>Basketball is one of the best full body workouts around
post_author: and it’s perfect for the summer months when the days are longer
post_date: so it’s easy to grab some friends and head to the park or court after work. Basketball will give you great overall muscle tone
post_date_gmt: while building cardiovascular strength and endurance.

ID: <li>Hiking gets you into nature while building muscle and cardiovascular strength. There are trails for just about every ability level
post_author: so if you like a challenge
post_date: go for steeper and rockier climbs
post_date_gmt: or find a nearby trail that fits your needs. Remember to keep a good pace to keep your heart rate up
post_content: and don’t forget to bring along a pack with your essentials: water
post_excerpt: wearable device

ID: There is no better time of year to combine your commitment to exercise with sheer fun. No matter your fitness level
post_author: or your range of athletic prowess
post_date: there is an outdoor activity for you. Even a simple run or brisk walk each day will get you up
post_content: and enjoying some fresh air and sun this summer.

post_content: Many people find the work-life balance challenging to navigate. In addition to heavy workloads we have families, friends, self-care, and personal interests to attend to, all of which are important to our overall happiness and well-being. Often, we are met with overwhelming demands in multiple areas of our lives, and it can be difficult to develop a strategy for balancing the various responsibilities we face. Once we are chronically overloaded our stress hormone levels spike, productivity and relationships suffer, and we become more vulnerable to lowered immunity and illness. With some structure and a bit of strategy, however, we can learn to manage stress
post_title: and achieve better balance and quality of life.

ID: • Boundaries: If you are in the habit of taking on every responsibility and project that comes your way it might be time to learn the art of saying no. Be realistic about how much you can take on at a given time. Depending on your profession
post_author: you may have more or less control over your workload
post_date: but wherever you do have a say
post_date_gmt: you can learn to draw a line when you need to. Learn to say no.

post_author: this is profession specific
post_date: but whenever possible ask for flexibility with your schedule. Even telecommuting one day a week from home can help alleviate stress. Many companies are becoming savvy to the importance of work / life balance
post_date_gmt: and are adopting policies to prevent workplace stress
post_content: so find out what your options are.

ID: • Take Breaks: Breaks are necessary throughout the day
post_author: and you are entitled to take a pause when needed. When you start to feel fatigued
post_date: frustrated
post_content: get up from your desk
post_excerpt: get some fresh air
post_status: and engage some deep breathing to reset. Apps like Accupedo can motivate you to track your daily activity and stay active.

ID: • Set Reasonable Expectations: Perfectionism in work and in life is linked to chronic stress and illness
post_author: so go a little easy on yourself. Bring your best to what you do
post_date: but understand that mistakes
post_date_gmt: or a less than perfect job performance at times
post_content: are normal. Remember that performance tends to suffer when we are pushed past capacity
post_title: so delegate where and when you can
post_excerpt: and ask for help when you need it.

ID: • Draft a Daily To-Do List: Set manageable goals each day and keep track of them. By drawing up a daily list of priorities and tasks to achieve
post_author: and staying on top of them as you complete them one by one
post_date: you will feel a sense of mastery over your workload which reduces stress and the feeling of being overwhelmed.

ID: • Practice Self-Care: Identify what you need to feel your best
post_author: be healthy
post_date: and regulate when you are stressed and upset. Self-care is for you: the more you are able to reset your energy and cope with stressors
post_date_gmt: the more you have to give to your relationships and other areas of your life. Exercise
post_content: meditation
post_excerpt: listening to music
ping_status: avoiding upsetting media during certain times
post_name: are all examples of ways to practice self-care. Think about the things you enjoy that recharge and help you feel renewed and refreshed on an ongoing basis. Good self-care is something you can learn to weave throughout your daily and weekly schedule. Self-care also makes you more stress resilient overall.

ID: • Delegate: Take steps to ensure that responsibilities at home are fairly distributed among household members so that no one person is carrying the majority of the weight. Draw up chore charts and lists
post_author: or clearly discuss who will be responsible for what on a daily and / or weekly basis.

ID: • More Boundaries: Carve out distraction free time with loved ones. Maybe you decide that work brought home is only done in a designated area (like an office) at set times
post_author: but devices and work at the dinner table are off limits. Maybe you commit to dinner as a couple / family four nights a week while leaving the other three open for other work and social commitments. Decide what works for you based on the needs of your household.

ID: • Eat Well: Do your best to keep your diet based on whole
post_author: fresh
post_date: and natural foods
post_date_gmt: and take the time to eat in a mindful way. Prepare your own meals as much as possible
post_content: and avoid stressful conversation at meal times.

ID: • Cultivate Friendships: Social support is key to a good work / life balance. Supportive friendships reduce stress
post_author: isolation
post_date: and strengthen the immune system. Have at least one or two people you can trust and confide in; social support is good for your mental and emotional health
post_date_gmt: and makes you more stress resilient in all areas of your life.

ID: Maybe you have a good balance in some areas of your life
post_author: but need to shore up others; perhaps you are starting from scratch. Begin from where you are and know that it is possible to improve no matter how daunting the process may seem. One powerful way to strengthen your work / life balance is to release time wasting activities and relationships. If someone or something is more of an energy and time drain than an asset
post_date: assess if you can afford the investment of your precious time. Figure out what your priorities are and make them your main focus.

post_author: and what are the risks? According to the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA)
post_date: distracted driving is any activity that takes our attention from the road and the task of driving. Any activity we engage in that diverts our focus from the road increases our risk of accidents and puts us and any passengers we may be transporting at risk. The NHTSA estimates that 10 percent of all fatal crashes
post_date_gmt: and 17 percent of all accidents that cause injuries
post_content: are due to distracted driving; nearly 1 in 5 of all crashes that result in injury are caused by some form of distracted driving. A list of what is considered distracted driving would include:

post_author: and using a cell or Smartphone
applying makeup
post_date: etc.

post_author: including maps

ID: • Adjusting temperature controls or a GPS navigational system

post_author: and How Serious are the Risks?

ID: Research conducted at the University of Utah shows that using a cell or Smartphone while driving quadruples your risk of an accident: about equivalent to the risk of driving while drunk. That risk doubles
post_author: yet again
post_date: if you are texting. The Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration reports that you are 23 times more likely to experience a car accident when texting while driving than if you did not engage in that distraction. According to the NHTSA
post_content: 331 people were killed
post_excerpt: 000 injured
post_status: in motor vehicle accidents related to distracted driving in 2015 alone.

ID: • Manual distractions occur when you remove your hands from the wheel for any length of time while driving. Reaching for a beverage or adjusting the radio station are examples of manual distractions.
<li>Visual distractions are those where you remove your focus from the road. If you were to glance down at an incoming message on your phone
post_author: for instance
post_date: that would be an example of a visual distraction.

ID: <li>A cognitive distraction occurs when your mind
post_author: your focus
post_date: wanders from paying attention to the road. When you are going over your to-do list for the day
post_date_gmt: or revisiting a quarrel with your spouse in your mind
post_content: these would be examples of cognitive distractions.

ID: Texting is especially dangerous while driving because it involves the three types of distraction combined: manual
post_author: visual
post_date: and cognitive. Sending or receiving a text message distracts a driver for approximately 5 full seconds each time; at highway speeds
post_date_gmt: this equates to a distance of about 300 feet per text.

ID: Research shows that teens are at the greatest risk for distracted driving. This may be due to inexperience
post_author: as younger drivers may be more prone to overestimating their ability to multitask. In 2009
post_date: the NHTSA reported that 16 percent of teen drivers killed in a car crash were distracted. Most adults are aware that distractions while driving
post_content: are dangerous
post_title: yet distracted drivers continue to cause a minimum of 3100 deaths
post_excerpt: and 400
post_status: 000 injuries each year in the United States alone. The statistics show us that distracted driving is a problem across all age groups
comment_status: and while adults may be more likely to understand the risks involved
ping_status: risk taking behavior while driving still occurs. Distracted driving is as dangerous
to_ping: but we have yet to socially condemn these behaviors in the same way. We all have a responsibility to commit to safety and driving distraction free
pinged: and to hold each other accountable to do the same.

Most of us know the importance of wearing sunscreen in the summer months to avoid sunburn and damage
post_title: but it really should be a year-round preventive health measure. Always wear sunscreen
post_excerpt: no matter your skin color or tone. Sunscreen dates back to ancient Egypt
post_status: where rice bran extract and jasmine were used to help shield skin from the sun. Chemists invented the first commercial sunscreen in 1936
comment_status: and it has been improved upon ever since. Modern sunscreens are water resistant
ping_status: and are included in many cosmetics and beauty products

post_author: Even on Cloudy Days

ID: Up to 80 percent of the sun’s rays can pass through clouds
post_author: so if you assume it’s OK to forgo protection on an overcast day
post_date: think again. Sunscreen is an important preventive health care habit that should be maintained all year
post_date_gmt: including the winter months. Snow can reflect up to 80 percent of ultraviolet (UV) rays
post_content: increasing your risk of exposure to sun damage. Also
post_excerpt: the greater the UV exposure
post_status: so sunscreen is crucial for family ski vacations
comment_status: too. When in doubt: always wear sunscreen!

ID: Here are the top five reasons why applying sunscreen should be a daily habit year round:
• It Protects Your Skin from UV Rays: The depletion of the ozone layer has increased our risk of sun damage from harmful UV rays. Sunscreen blocks these rays
post_author: greatly reducing the likelihood of sunburn. Look for products like those from Goddess Garden with an SPF (Sun Protection Factor) of at least 15 (some doctors recommend nothing below 30)
post_date: and use each and every day. For full body coverage you’ll want to apply about an ounce.

ID: • It Lowers Your Skin Cancer Risk: Skin cancer is the most common form of cancer in the United States. According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
post_date: 943 people were diagnosed with melanomas of the skin in 2013
post_content: 394 of these cases were fatal. By applying sunscreen each day
post_title: you cut your risk of contracting skin cancers in half.

ID: • It Prevents Premature Aging of the Skin: Sun damage from UV rays causes photoaging of the skin
post_author: which is characterized by a thick
post_date: leathery look; discoloration; and a breakdown of collagen
post_content: sagging and wrinkles. Studies show that those below age 55 who apply sunscreen regularly have 24 percent less chance of developing these signs of aging than those who don’t.

ID: • It Helps Maintain an Even Skin Tone: Sunscreen helps prevent discoloration and dark spots from sun damage
post_author: helping you maintain a smoother and more even skin tone.

ID: • Your Chances of Skin Cancer are Higher if Your Hair is Red: Scientists used to think the reason for this increased risk was due to the fair skin tone of redheads. In 2013
post_author: however
post_date: researchers discovered the MC1R gene mutation which creates red hair and fair skin. This mutation also creates a cancer causing pathway which
post_content: promotes a genetic propensity towards cancer.

ID: "
post_author: Top 5 Important Reasons You Should Always Wear Sunscreen

Summertime usually means lots of barbecues - typically filled with hot dogs, greasy chips, and burgers doused in cheese and mayonnaise. We've created this salmon burgers recipe as the perfect alternative to the standard barbecue menu. The salmon is juicy, flavorful and accompanied by a garlicky, creamy sauce. You won't miss any of the classic treats once you try this salmon burgers recipe, a fun way to get some great nutrition.

ID: Eat Salmon Burgers for DHA and EHA Content
We often hear that we should be eating more fish
post_author: but few of us actually get the 2-3 weekly servings recommended. We love these salmon burgers because you can easily freeze the patties and pop them into a pan for a quick dinner. Eating salmon adds a healthy dose of protein
post_date: which is the building block of our muscles and hormones. It also helps keep us satiated for longer. The fish is full of micronutrients like B vitamins and potassium. Most importantly
post_date_gmt: salmon is an excellent source of Omega-3s
post_content: which are typically under-consumed in the modern American diet.

ID: The Omega-3s found in salmon (and other oily fishes) are called eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA) and docosahexaenoic acid (DHA). You've probably seen supplements with these two names advertised - and for good reason
post_author: as they contribute to many functions throughout our body. Cultures in which the cuisine features regular fish consumption tend to have significantly lower rates of heart disease and high blood pressure. EHA and DHA are also crucial for brain function - improving memory
post_date: preventing depression
post_date_gmt: and lowering the risk for Alzheimer's disease.

ID: Traditional wheat products like white flour and breadcrumbs can trigger weight gain
post_author: blood sugar issues and inflammation throughout the body. For this salmon burger recipe
post_date: we've replaced breadcrumbs with almond flour
post_date_gmt: which is made by grinding almonds into a powder. Almonds add heart-healthy fats and additional protein as well. We've also suggested choosing sprouted or gluten-free buns. Sprouted wheat is healthier than whole wheat because it is more digestible. All grains contain phytic acid
post_content: which protects the plant but also inhibits our ability to absorb the nutrients. Sprouted bread products are less processed
post_title: so they also retain more of their nutrients. If you want an even lighter option
post_excerpt: these patties are just as delicious served in a lettuce wrap.

ID: • 5.3 ounces of Greek yogurt (a single serving cup)
Step 1: Make sauce. Remove stems from basil. Remove skin and pit from the avocado. Juice lemon. Add all ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth. If the sauce is too thick
post_author: you can add water slowly to thin it out. Set sauce aside.

ID: Step 2: Remove skin from the salmon and cut into smaller chunks. Peel the onion and cut in half
post_author: setting one half aside. Cut jalapeño in half lengthwise and remove seeds
post_date: setting one half aside. Add all burger ingredients to a food processor and pulse until fully minced and combined.

ID: Step 3: Divide salmon mixture into four equal portions. Mold each portion into a burger patty. Heat one tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat in a non-stick pan. Cook for 4-5 minutes on each side
post_author: or until golden brown and cooked through.

ID: Step 4: Serve salmon immediately with thick slices of red onion
post_author: your avocado sauce
post_date: and buns or butter lettuce to wrap.

A great way to supercharge your yoga practice
post_title: or try it for the first time
post_excerpt: is to visit an open air yoga center this summer. While outdoor yoga is often part of the offerings at idyllic destinations like The Retreat Costa Rica
post_status: it's increasingly available everywhere. Many cities offer classes in gorgeous parks
ping_status: and amid sunny natural settings. It is the perfect way to stretch your body and get healthier when the weather is warm. Here is a sampling of some open air yoga classes being offered across the country this summer. It's by no means an exhaustive list
post_password: so if you don’t see options for your city or state listed here
post_name: contact your local yoga studio and inquire about outdoor summer classes.

Summer is the perfect time to revel in gorgeous weather and enjoy as much time outdoors as possible. Picnics are one of the season’s greatest pleasures
post_title: whether you’re celebrating the Fourth of July or Labor Day
post_excerpt: or just spending a long
post_status: sunny day at the beach. Healthy picnic food can be delicious
comment_status: too. When planning what to pack for your next al fresco dining adventure
ping_status: think about forgoing the typical fried chicken
post_name: and hot dogs in favor of healthier

ID: Here are some ideas for healthy picnic food:
• Garlic Rosemary White Bean Dip - This creamy dip is perfect for whole grain crackers
post_author: baguettes or sliced raw veggies
post_date: and is easy to prepare and transport. This is also a great spread for layering in a (whole grain) sandwich or wrap.

ID: • Fresh Fruit Kabobs - Fruit kabobs are a fun
post_author: beautiful and healthy treat. Grab some skewers and layer up however you’d like: try a combination of strawberry
post_date: grape
post_content: or make your own with your favorite fruits.

ID: • Mango Avocado Quinoa and Black Bean Salad - This salad is a gorgeous
post_author: protein-packed alternative to the heavy
post_date: mayonnaise-laden standbys
post_date_gmt: and is perfect as a side dish or a vegetarian main course.

post_author: colorful and delicious
post_date: this noodle salad is another amazing example of how to build a better

ID: • Garlic Herb Turkey Burgers - Made with organic turkey and fresh garlic and herbs
post_author: this burger is an excellent grilling option. Pair with lots of veggies and your favorite toppings
post_date: and wrap in a romaine leaf or on a whole grain bun.

ID: • Spicy Party Mix - This mix is a great
post_author: healthy alternative to prepackaged snacks and chips.

ID: • Gooey Sweet Potato Brownies - These brownies are a great example of how to make whole food substitutions for your favorite treats and get a delicious and indulgent result. Bonus: kids would never guess that these are packed with nutrient-rich sweet potatoes.
• Better Beverages – You’ll definitely want to hydrate with a quality water bottle like the ones from Tervis
post_author: but what other drinks should you bring? Try to ditch the sodas (even diet versions); processed sugars and artificial sweeteners should be limited as much as possible. Instead
post_date: fill your cooler with pure filtered water
post_content: and lemonade sweetened with a little stevia or raw honey.

ID: Pack your picnic basket with fresh hummus and whole grain pita
post_author: a veggie tray with a healthy dip
post_date: fresh berries
post_content: and watermelon. Chopped vegetable salads you prepare early (without the lettuces) will taste even better the following day and are perfect for picnics. Lightly marinated grilled vegetables are wonderful as a side dish.

ID: As you continue to explore healthier
post_author: more plant-focused options
post_date: try to find whole foods bloggers and experiment with their recipes. We all have emotional attachments to less-than-ideal meals and snacks
post_date_gmt: especially those we grew up with. The transition to healthy eating can seem daunting at first. But whole
post_content: natural foods can be every bit as satisfying and flavorful
post_title: while providing incredible nutritional advantages compared to overly processed
post_excerpt: industrially produced foods. As you learn how to make healthier substitutions for your old favorites
post_status: you will feel and look better. And there’s no better way to start than by packing healthy picnic food on a beautiful day.

Everyone knows how important it is to protect yourself from the sun in order to prevent skin cancer. But are there harmful ingredients in sunscreen? In recent years
post_title: there’s been a lot of debate about whether certain chemicals in commercial sunscreens are safe. Health and wellness sites feature countless blog posts and articles warning against the dangers of allegedly harmful ingredients in sunscreen and questioning whether we actually need to use it. Let’s take a look at what the research says and separate what we know from what we don’t.

ID: There are two different types of sunscreen: scattering (or blocking)
post_author: and absorbent. Scattering sunscreens
post_date: which typically include zinc or titanium dioxide
post_date_gmt: block or deflect the ultraviolet (UV) rays of the sun from permeating your skin. Absorbent sunscreens
post_content: with ingredients like oxybenzone
post_title: work by triggering a chemical reaction that absorbs the rays
post_excerpt: thereby preventing damage to the skin. Some groups point to harmful ingredients in sunscreens of both kinds.

ID: Some scientists have raised concerns about the zinc or titanium dioxide nanoparticles that provide a blocking sunscreen’s scattering action
post_author: which is needed to deflect UV rays. Those who are concerned believe these nanoparticles are small enough to permeate the skin and go all the way to the bloodstream.

ID: A recent study showed that mice injected with titanium dioxide chemicals developed inflammation -- a marker for potential disease and cancer. But the relevance of this study is questionable
post_author: since sunscreen is obviously applied topically rather than injected. Toxicity concerns have not been raised with non-nanoparticle forms of zinc and titanium dioxide
post_date: but these sunscreens are not as widely available.

ID: The most common commercial sunscreens contain chemical filters like oxybenzone
post_author: avobenzone
post_date: homosalate
post_content: octisalate
post_title: and octocrylene. In sufficiently high amounts
post_excerpt: oxybenzone is thought to interact with the endocrine system and disrupt hormonal function. Worries about oxybenzone stem from a study showing reactions in rats that were given the chemical through their food. Researchers have since stated that the amount of oxybenzone exposure through topical use of sunscreen is not significant enough to cause problems in human beings.

ID: The Environmental Working Group asserts that some chemical sunscreen UV filters
post_author: like oxybenzone
post_date: have been shown to penetrate the skin’s barrier and mimic hormones
post_date_gmt: causing allergic reactions and other issues. The American Academy of Dermatology
post_content: however
post_title: continues to recommend sunscreens containing oxybenzone as safe.

post_author: a form of vitamin A often found in sunscreens
post_date: has limited data showing it may be linked to the development of certain skin tumors and cancers. More research is needed
post_date_gmt: but the Environmental Working Group recommends sunscreens and cosmetics that do not contain this ingredient.

ID: So Are There Harmful Ingredients in Sunscreen?
So are there harmful ingredients in sunscreen? In many ways
post_author: the jury is still out. But what's not debatable is the use of some type of sunscreen as an essential preventive health habit. Everyone agrees on this point
post_date: even those who have concerns about certain ingredients. If you are concerned about chemical exposure and want to avoid oxybenzone
post_date_gmt: opt for zinc and titanium dioxide forms of sunscreen
post_content: particularly the non-nano particle forms
post_title: as they are proven safe and effective. You can also easily avoid retinyl palmitate. While the debate rages as to which chemical sunscreens are the safest and most effective
post_excerpt: there’s no doubt it’s better to use sunscreen than not.

ID: Sunscreens need to be used correctly if they’re to be used at all as a preventive measure against sun damage and skin cancer. This means using products with a sufficiently high SPF value. Most experts recommend SPF 30 at an absolute minimum. Sunscreen should be reapplied throughout the day
post_author: particularly if exposed to sweat or water. It is also important to use broad spectrum sunscreens
post_date: which block the two types of ultraviolet rays: UVA and UVB
post_date_gmt: both of which are linked to melanoma and other skin cancers. If you want to ensure you’re getting the safest possible product
post_content: you can check out the Environmental Working Group’s 2017 Sunscreen Guide. Also remember that for effective
post_excerpt: you need to apply about an ounce.

post_author: Are There Harmful Ingredients in Sunscreen?
post_content: open

Sun damaged skin becomes more of a problem as we age. Excessive exposure to the sun’s ultraviolet (UV) rays can cause changes to the skin collectively known as photoaging. The dermatological development is characterized by a coarse and dry skin appearance; other features include freckling
post_excerpt: a leathery look
post_status: and deep wrinkles. Sun damaged skin can happen to anyone
comment_status: not just those who go tanning regularly or work outdoors. The right course of action for managing the effects of photoaging depends on its severity
ping_status: as well as factors such as your age and overall health
post_password: the specific type of damage sustained
post_name: and how well you tolerate certain therapies and treatments. You may also have an inclination toward the general type of treatment
to_ping: whether you prefer natural options or a more standard medical approach.

post_author: aging cannot be avoided entirely. But good skin care
post_date: combined with a healthy diet and lifestyle
post_date_gmt: will slow some of its physical impact and soften the effects of time and sun exposure. If you have sun damaged skin due to photoaging
post_content: you can improve its appearance and avoid further harm. Here are some options to prevent and reverse the effects of too much sun on your skin.

ID: • Aloe Vera - Aloe vera is one of the most effective natural remedies for sun damaged skin. It contains 150 trace elements and minerals such as calcium
post_author: magnesium
post_date: sodium
post_content: zinc
post_excerpt: potassium
comment_status: and amino acids. For best results
ping_status: go directly to the source and cut open an aloe vera leaf
post_password: extracting the gel. Apply the gel directly to your skin
to_ping: and then rinse with cool water. Reapply several times per day to heal and soothe your skin.

ID: • Honey - Honey is a natural antibiotic and helps trap moisture to the skin. It also contains natural antioxidants
post_author: which are found in particularly high amounts in the darker varieties of honey. These antioxidants help to heal and neutralize free-radical damage to the skin from the sun
post_date: pollution
post_date_gmt: and stress. At-home skin treatments made with raw
post_content: dark honey will help to improve the tone
post_excerpt: and moisture content of your skin.

ID: • Lemon Juice - Lemon juice contains natural alpha hydroxy and glycolic acids that gently exfoliate the skin to improve texture and uneven skin tone caused by sun damage. You can make a homemade toner by mixing one tablespoon of fresh lemon juice with a half cup of pure water. Apply to the skin with a cotton ball or pad
post_author: and let it dry for 30 to 60 minutes. You can then leave the preparation on your skin or rinse with cool water.

ID: • Vitamin A - Eat foods rich in vitamin A
post_author: such as eggs
post_date: fish
post_content: as part of a healthy overall diet featuring fresh
post_title: natural foods. Vitamin A is a natural antioxidant that promotes the healing and regeneration of sun damaged skin.

ID: • Prescription Retinoids - Retinoids help even skin tone
post_author: and increase the amount of collagen in your skin
post_date: facilitating a more youthful appearance. A doctor can prescribe a retinoid cream or serum
post_content: for a full-strength effect. You can also opt for the less potent

ID: • Microdermabrasion - Microdermabrasion gently sands and exfoliates the skin with small crystals
post_author: grains
post_date: or diamond tips. The process removes the outermost layer of skin
post_content: and improves hyperpigmentation due to sun damage.

post_author: concentrated light remove targeted layers or areas of the skin’s surface
post_date: reducing facial wrinkles
post_content: blemishes and uneven skin tone.

ID: • Chemical Peels - Chemical peels remove sun damaged skin from the upper layers. You can apply some peels
post_author: such as alpha-hydroxy or salicylic acid creams
post_date: yourself. A deeper peel is performed by a dermatologist.

ID: While some of the effects of photoaging can be reversed and significantly improved
post_author: prevention is your best bet. Wear a broad spectrum (containing UVA and UVB protection) sunscreen with SPF 15 or higher
post_date: every day
post_date_gmt: regardless of your skin color or tone
post_content: and whether it’s sunny or cloudy outside. Regularly wearing protection from the sun’s rays will
post_excerpt: help reduce the appearance of previous damage while also decreasing your chances of developing skin cancer and further problems.

It’s well established that playtime for children leads to better brain development
post_title: but did you know adults need breaks for their own improved cognitive function and wellbeing? Believe it or not
post_excerpt: recess for adults is incredibly valuable
post_status: in terms of both individual health and workplace performance.

ID: Our modern environment has made it very difficult to unplug. It can be a real challenge to take even a few moments away from work
post_author: let alone the constant stream of social media and news updates. That’s why planned recess for adults can be such an important release valve. Check out these strategies for creating a more balanced
post_date: recess-enhanced office culture that recharges employees

ID: Recess for Adults Starts with Lunch Outside the Office

This is perhaps the simplest way of rejuvenating employees. Researchers have found that workers who ate their lunches outside ranked higher in overall happiness than those who ate at their desks. The study applied a happiness index score (calculated using results from psychological tests and self-evaluation) to the various outside locations where employees had lunch. Those workers who ate at the beach experienced the biggest increase in happiness
post_author: followed by those eating lunch in a public green space or park
post_date: eating at home with loved ones
post_date_gmt: and eating at a restaurant. By contrast
post_content: workers who ate lunch at their desks were found to have the lowest levels of happiness.

ID: Considering how often people stay tethered to their cubicles
post_author: this is an issue. A survey conducted by Right Management found that fewer than half of employees take lunch away from their desks
post_date: while 14 percent of respondents reported taking almost no lunch breaks at all. Michael Haid
post_date_gmt: the firm’s Senior Vice President for Talent Management
post_content: warns that too many companies are creating cultures where employees feel uneasy spending even half an hour away from their desks for lunch.

ID: Skipping Lunch Breaks is Bad for Everyone
Such pressure does not help employee wellbeing
post_author: nor does it benefit the company’s bottom line. Research shows that forcing the brain to work without rest is detrimental to overall creativity and performance
post_date: and it harms long-term health. This kind of work strategy elevates the risks of burnout and fatigue
post_date_gmt: with workers’ enthusiasm and engagement steadily decreasing over time. Employers who cultivate a culture of wellness
post_content: from encouraging adequate lunch breaks to implementing preventative care programs
post_title: decrease their overall overhead in terms of employee medical costs and absenteeism. Such a culture also boosts productivity levels over time.

ID: There are any number of great ideas that fall under the umbrella of “recess for adults.” For instance
post_author: while many employees may schedule exercise or yoga routines for before or after work
post_date: allowing them to break up the day with a midday session could do wonders for overall energy levels and productivity. Other activities
post_content: keep the brain active while giving it a respite from job-related tasks. Recess could mean something as simple as going for a short walk or listening to music. It could also be a group activity with co-workers
post_title: such as sports or team-building games. There’s a huge range of options. What’s most important is to make sure employees have the opportunity to take some kind of mental and/or physical “recess” from their daily routine so that their focus remains high.

ID: Science shows us that incorporating playfulness and rest into the workplace leads to more adaptable
post_author: innovative
post_date: and creative workers. Playfully enriched work environments positively impact and shape the cerebral cortex
post_date_gmt: which is the part of the brain where the most complex and powerful cognitive processing occurs. The National Institute for Play offers consulting for corporations looking to revamp their operations into more enriched environments. The NIFP approach to cultivating more play-informed work cultures uses data to design enrichment programs best suited to a company’s specific needs. The benefits of recess for adults include breaking up outdated or ineffective cognitive patterns
post_content: increasing creativity and creative problem-solving skills
post_title: and stress reduction. It elevates cognitive function while improving community connections and team building in the workplace. In a variety of ways
post_excerpt: recess for adults can be a major advantage for any company and its workforce.

ID: "
post_author: Why Recess For Adults Is So Important
post_content: open

Science is proving what many have known for centuries: the benefits of meditation are exciting and profound. There are countless ways to meditate and innumerable advantages. Discover what works for you by exploring different approaches
post_title: and then be sure to invest the time in making it a routine part of your life.

ID: A regular meditation practice enhances creativity and productivity at work
post_author: and it improves long-term health outcomes in a variety of areas. As little as five minutes of meditation a day can quickly reduce stress and anxiety. But the benefits of meditation go beyond that. Spending 20 minutes to an hour each day meditating (even for just a few weeks) is scientifically demonstrated to:

ID: • Increase and enhance the body’s immune response.
Researchers from Harvard Medical School have shown that subjects who practice yoga and meditation have improved mitochondrial energy production and function
post_author: which results in increased immunity and resilience against stress.

ID: In a study conducted at the University of California
post_author: meditators showed a sharp increase in their ability to focus
post_date: particularly on boring or repetitive tasks. Subjects also improved their performance in tests of cognitive skill and information processing
post_date_gmt: and in some cases demonstrated ten times the ability of the non-meditating group. There is also evidence that regular meditators develop a thicker prefrontal cortex and right anterior insula
post_content: and that a consistent meditation practice can offset cognitive decline in old age.

ID: • Prevent and reduce addictive behaviors and emotional eating patterns.
Scientists have found that meditation reduces emotional eating
post_author: and increased mindfulness generally helps us avoid unhealthy indulgences. A healthy diet is a cornerstone of any good preventative health care plan
post_date: and the benefits of meditation include the facilitation of positive habits in this regard.

post_author: mood disorders
post_date: and depression.

ID: In a study conducted in Belgium with 400 students ranging from 13 to 20 years old
post_author: an in-school mindfulness meditation program decreased incidents of depression
post_date: stress
post_date_gmt: and anxiety. Students were also shown to be less vulnerable to pronounced and major symptoms of depression with regular meditation practice. Another study shows that mindfulness meditation practice helps those with a history of depression to decrease cognitive dysfunction
post_content: negative thinking patterns

ID: A healthy sense of self-esteem helps us commit to self-care
post_author: and make positive choices for ourselves in order to improve our health and our lives: all key components to a sound preventative health care plan. Meditation helps us learn to observe and question our thoughts as they arise. Instead of being swept up in an internal mental narrative
post_date: particularly a negative or overly critical one
post_date_gmt: we learn to create space around our thoughts and emotions in order to examine them. We also learn to release thoughts which harm us or hinder our sense of intrinsic self-worth. Authentic self-esteem is supported by an understanding of our inherent value and worth
post_content: and this is a sense of self we don’t have to prove. Mindfulness meditation is a powerful way to improve self-esteem
post_title: and as a result we tend to make healthier and more compassionate choices for ourselves.

ID: • Mindfulness Meditation – This technique aims to create a non-judgmental and relaxed ability to observe thoughts
post_author: sensations
post_date: and emotions as they arise on a moment by moment basis. The technique is as simple as setting aside time each day to sit
post_content: and experience these internal events as they unfold. Mindfulness trains us to declutter the mind
post_title: and become more present and observant of the world around us. Instead of operating on auto-pilot
post_excerpt: we learn to pay attention in each moment of our lives.

ID: • Headspace - A great app for people learning meditation for the first time
post_author: Headspace offers 10 free beginner-focused
post_date: mindfulness meditation sessions of 10 minutes apiece. Once you have completed this “Take 10” set
post_date_gmt: the app unlocks additional meditation sessions for purchase as you progress.

ID: • Smiling Mind - This app offers meditation sessions for all age groups
post_author: from children to adults. Educators can also use Smiling Mind to create meditation time in the classroom.
Breathe & Think - Offering 55 guided mindfulness meditation sessions
post_date: as well as a mood tracker and customizable chimes
post_content: Breathe & Think app has programs designed to assist with depression
post_excerpt: anxiety

ID: • Transcendental Meditation – This technique is taught for a fee by a certified teacher. Transcendental Meditation is a silent mantra style of meditation which does not involve the self-monitoring of mindfulness techniques. TM is considered helpful as a way to increase relaxation
post_author: stress relief
post_date: and personal development.

ID: • Vipassana Meditation – This technique is one of the most ancient
post_author: and has been taught in India for more than 2500 years. Vipassana is taught free of charge by trained instructors
post_date: with donations requested as able
post_date_gmt: during 10-day training sessions around the world. This training involves mental focus on the breath while contemplating the nature of impermanence
post_content: or change
post_title: in order to generate greater peace and self-understanding.

ID: Regardless of the meditation style you choose
post_author: consistency is key. In order to reap the myriad benefits of meditation
post_date: it is important to establish a regular practice. The more we meditate
post_date_gmt: the better we will feel. Meditation makes individuals happier
post_content: physically and mentally healthier
post_title: and better equipped to deal with stress. The benefits of meditation can no longer be ignored.

post_author: The Benefits of Meditation Are Amazing

Workplace stress is a huge problem for employees and companies alike. According to researchers
post_title: it costs U.S. businesses as much as $407 billion per year
post_excerpt: and is a major contributor to cardiovascular disease. This is a staggering health and financial crisis. At least half of all workers are believed to suffer from stress and tension
post_status: and 66 percent of all employees report that their work performance suffers as a result. Poorly managed stress is the main cause of long-term employee absenteeism
comment_status: and medical experts say that unmanaged stress is the primary cause of illnesses representing up to 70 percent of visits to primary care physicians.

ID: Research shows that chronic stress harms cognitive function and creativity
post_author: problem solving skills
post_date: decision making
post_content: planning
post_excerpt: morale
comment_status: and revenue. Chronic stress undermines employee wellbeing on multiple levels
ping_status: as well as any company goal that depends on a healthy workforce. Clearly
post_password: stress management should be an essential component to any company’s employee health care program. The long-term costs in terms of medical bills
pinged: and absenteeism are far more financially draining to businesses than the cost of good stress management and preventative health care programs.

post_author: and we mirror one another’s moods and emotions. Therefore
post_date: stress symptoms spread among people who work closely together. Employees are also impacted by the stress levels of disgruntled supervisors
post_content: and their organizing teams. The dynamics of employees’ various office interactions and interpersonal relationships all have a direct bearing on their stress levels.

ID: Employee Wellbeing Means More Than Physical Health
Maintaining good health requires attention to nutrition and exercise
post_author: of course
post_date: but physical care alone is insufficient in ensuring overall wellbeing. The management of workplace stress is essential to preventing chronic illness. Ample research shows that when employees experience stress from work
post_content: or family concerns
post_title: their health suffers and productivity declines.

ID: What is the Cost of Workplace Stress?
Health management company StayWell evaluated the costs of stress
post_author: comparing them to those associated with 10 other common health-risk factors. The analysis determined that while obesity
post_date: tobacco use
post_content: high cholesterol
post_title: and hypertension comprised 25 percent of companies’ overall healthcare expenditures
post_excerpt: stress was the single most costly risk to both employees’ health and an employer’s bottom line.

ID: How and Why Does Workplace Stress Cause Illness?

post_author: its fight or flight response is activated. Heightened levels of stress hormones – cortisol and norepinephrine – are released into the bloodstream. Over time
post_date: if this response becomes chronic
post_date_gmt: the body will start responding with symptoms linked to a person’s particular physical vulnerabilities. Some individuals will have panic attacks; others may begin having migraines
post_content: cardiovascular issues
post_title: or problems regulating blood sugar. Stress reactions can also be behavioral: poor eating habits
post_excerpt: reliance on tobacco
post_status: or alcohol dependency and drug abuse can be responses to chronic stress as well.

ID: Ideas and Solutions for Workplace Stress Management

post_author: tai chi
post_date: and/or gym memberships for employees

ID: • Allow employees the option of working from home one day per week
<li>Encourage a one hour lunch break taken away from the office
post_author: or at least a full half-hour break

ID: • Replace vending machine junk food with healthy snacks and pure water
• Encourage breaks away from the desk - particularly when stress hits
• Invest in stress management and preventative health care programs for employees

American work culture has become increasingly stressful in recent decades. Our healthcare system sometimes neglects the impact of psychological factors and how they influence our overall health. In order to prevent and manage chronic illnesses
post_author: thereby lowering healthcare costs
post_date: it is essential to create office environments that offer workplace stress relief and management to employees.

ID: "
post_author: How Workplace Stress Hurts the Bottom Line
post_content: open
Stress management techniques are central to a healthy lifestyle. Moderate stress can motivate us and increase concentration and clarity. But when life or workplace stress becomes chronic
post_title: we begin to experience detrimental symptoms as the pressure accumulates. Chronic stress harms our mental and physical wellbeing
post_excerpt: and learning to cope with stressors is vital to any preventative health strategy. Here are 10 stress management techniques to help you deal with stress before it becomes a big problem.

ID: • Exercise at least three times per week. When you exercise
post_author: your body releases endorphins
post_date: which help you relax and feel better amid stress. Some types of exercise
post_content: additionally stimulate the parasympathetic nervous system (the part of your nervous system which resets and calms your stress response). Regular exercise also improves sleep
post_title: giving you two stress management techniques in one.

ID: • Evidence shows that a regular mindfulness meditation practice decreases symptoms of stress and anxiety while increasing stress resilience and feelings of calm. Meditation is also good cognitive training – it leads us to recognize negative thought patterns and release them over time. Regular practice only intensifies these benefits
post_author: so find a method you enjoy and make it part of your self-care regimen.

ID: <li>Try progressive muscle relaxation (also known as deep muscle relaxation). Progressively tense each muscle group of your body
post_author: and then breathe deeply and release. This is particularly helpful to do before sleep as a way of releasing the day’s stress.

ID: <li>Make a to-do list of important work and personal tasks you need to accomplish each day. Working through your daily list will help you feel organized and on top of things
post_author: giving you a sense of mastery over your workload.

ID: <li>Eat a nutritious diet based on whole
post_author: natural foods. Make time to sit
post_date: rest
post_date_gmt: and eat your meals mindfully. Try to avoid eating under stress or in a rush. Mealtimes are break times. Avoid stressful and upsetting conversation while eating.

ID: • Practice good sleep hygiene. Structure your sleep so that you are going to bed and waking up at the same time each day. Lower the lights and turn off your phone and devices at least one hour before bedtime
post_author: and sleep in a well darkened room.

ID: <li>Try diaphragmatic breathing. When we are stressed
post_author: our breathing tends to be shallow and centered in the chest. Diaphragmatic breathing (deep breathing) helps to regulate the body’s stress response
post_date: and increases feelings of calm.

ID: <li>Seek support. Find at least one person you can confide in and with whom you can share concerns. <a href=\"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2921311/\">The more social support you have
post_author: the more stress resilience you will develop. If you find yourself isolated
post_date: you may have to take steps to create more community in your life. Seek out new activities
post_date_gmt: join an adult recreational sports team for camaraderie and exercise
post_content: or take a new class to connect with others who have common interests.

post_author: it’s as simple as that. Watch funny movies or stand-up comedians you like. Find amusing YouTube videos or a hilarious book. Regular laughter is one of the easiest and most reliable stress management techniques. It lowers stress hormones in the body
post_date: relaxes muscles

ID: • Learn to say no. Set boundaries around your life demands and workload as much as possible to avoid becoming overwhelmed. Delegate responsibilities when possible and as needed
post_author: and give yourself permission to set limits in terms of how much you take on at any given time. You may encounter some friction with others as they adjust to the new boundaries you set
post_date: but you are ensuring healthier relationships with them – and improved long-term mental and physical health for yourself – by learning to say no.

post_author: cultivating a set of stress management techniques that work for you is a key component of preventative health care. Stress is a major contributing factor to the development of many mental and physical illnesses. Making time for self-care is important to staying healthy in the long term. It may take some effort to carve out the time for exercise and meditation
post_date: for instance
post_date_gmt: but your wellbeing is worth the investment.

post_excerpt: normalized blood sugar

post_author: ranging from smoking to exercising

post_status: and are also helpful in detoxifying our system.

post_author: which facilitates digestion. It also helps lower cholesterol and slows the rate at which sugars enter the blood stream. Coconut palm sugar is also known for having a milder impact on blood sugar levels. It is important to choose foods that don't cause spikes in our blood sugar in order to create more stable hunger levels
post_date: mood

post_content: pasta
post_title: and sugary desserts — we also risk insulin resistance and eventually Type 2 diabetes.

lightly beaten

post_author: add all ingredients except blueberries to the blender. Blend until a smooth batter is achieved.
