There’s real value in great staycation ideas. While vacations away are crucial for rest and family bonding
post_title: the financial cost of journeys far from home can be steep. Or you may simply prefer to spend quality time with loved ones and friends who live near you. Either way
post_excerpt: a staycation can be a great opportunity to explore aspects of your home city that you may be too busy to enjoy when work and school schedules are in full swing. And beyond the importance of family togetherness
post_status: individual rest and relaxation are vital to good mental and physical health.

ID: Here are some staycation ideas to help you decide whether to stay close to home for R&R the next chance you get:
• Be a tourist in your home town - A staycation is the perfect chance to visit museums and galleries and to attend live theater or musical performances. See sites unique to your hometown
post_author: taking a look through fresh eyes. Check out some restaurants you’ve been too busy to try. You work hard to make a home where you do
post_date: so take this opportunity to appreciate it.

ID: • Host a family game night - Whether you prefer board games or cards
post_author: make game night extra fun with special prizes for the winners.

ID: • Play laser tag or paintball - There are laser tag and paintball locations everywhere
post_author: so find one nearby and engage in some friendly competition.

ID: • Book a night or two at a hotel - Order room service
post_author: and enjoy a couple of days off with no laundry
post_date: no chores

ID: • Plan a picnic at a nearby national park - Find a national park in your area
post_author: and take advantage of some fresh air and scenic beauty. Many parks have family friendly activities
post_date: from hiking and biking trails to sports facilities
post_date_gmt: so pack a picnic and enjoy the day.

ID: • Visit a local water or amusement park - Check out this list of theme parks for one in your area
post_author: and enjoy a great family outing at a fraction of the cost of Disney World.

ID: • Camp out in the backyard - Pitch a tent
post_author: grill up some dinner
post_date: roast marshmallows
post_content: and enjoy sleeping out under the stars.

ID: • Visit the local library - Libraries have lots of options for family friendly events
post_author: starting with story times for young children year-round. Activities are particularly plentiful on the weekends and during spring and summer breaks. Check your local library’s website for details.
paddle boarding
post_date: or kayaking - If there is a river or body of water nearby
post_content: kayaking
post_excerpt: or paddle boarding excursions. Get outside
post_status: enjoy the water and fresh air

ID: • Enjoy local food and art festivals - Many cities host seasonal bazaars
post_author: art and food festivals
post_date: and carnivals. Check out your local community events calendar for more information.

ID: • Plan a family arts and crafts day - Find your local arts and crafts center or paint-your-own ceramics studio
post_author: and create some beautiful new artwork for your household.
GPS-directed global treasure hunt. Players navigate a set of GPS coordinates
post_date: trying to find the geocache (hidden container) at a certain location. You can also find local Geocaching groups in your area.

ID: Make Sure Staycation Ideas Are Turned Into Action

post_author: the biggest challenge of taking a staycation is letting go of the routine responsibilities we feel pressured to abide when we’re at home
post_date: in our “regular” environment. Be sure your staycation ideas allow you to institute boundaries around your time off. Let the heavy housework go for a week. Don’t cook at home (unless you find it fun and relaxing). Shut off phones and devices. Give yourself permission to rest
post_content: and just be.

A sunny day at the beach is the perfect time to get some exercise with outdoor sports and activities. What are some of the best games to play at the beach? The following suggestions are all great ways for the whole family to have fun while staying active in the surf and the sand.

ID: Five Fun Games to Play at the Beach:

post_author: volleyball is perfect for groups of all sizes
post_date: ages
post_date_gmt: and ability levels. Many beaches will have nets set up already
post_content: so all you need is a ball and a crew of people ready for some friendly competition.

post_author: Ladder Ball is easy to play and appropriate for players of all ages. It is particularly great for the beach
post_date: because it’s easy to stick the ladders into the sand and remove them when you’re done. The game is played with at least two players or teams. Each player gets 3 bolas
post_date_gmt: which are balls linked by a nylon cord. The goal is to score points by wrapping the bola around one of the ladder rungs. Kits can be purchased at your local sporting goods store or online.

ID: • Bocce - This classic Italian bowling game dates back to ancient Rome
post_author: but has become even more popular in recent times as a beach game. A bocce set includes 8 large balls
post_date: and one small ball called the pallino (or “pill”)
post_date_gmt: which is tossed first and serves as the target. Everyone takes turns trying to get the larger balls closest to the pallino.

ID: • Sharks and Minnows - This game can be played on the beach
post_author: or in gentle
post_date: shallow waters. One player is the shark
post_date_gmt: and the others are the minnows. The shark tries to tag the minnows
post_content: and as minnows are tagged
post_title: they become part of the shark’s team
post_excerpt: and try to tag the other minnows to gain members for the shark’s team. To make the game more challenging

ID: • Beach Darts - The simplest way to play beach darts is to draw concentric circles in the sand until you have what resembles a dartboard. Players then stand at a distance
post_author: throwing shells or pebbles as “darts
post_date: ” trying to get as close as possible to the bull’s eye.

ID: We understand that beach days are also for watching the waves
post_author: laying in the sand (maybe even using it to preserve memories via Dune Jewelry)
post_date: and generally relaxing. But these games to play at the beach are easy
post_date_gmt: fun ways to promote family fitness. It’s important to encourage loved ones
post_content: particularly children who are forming healthy habits
post_title: to seek out exercise whenever possible. If you take advantage of the opportunities summer offers in this regard
post_excerpt: it’s far easier to stay motivated to stay in shape once the warmer months draw to a close. These games to play at the beach are just a start. After all
post_status: the ultimate goal is to make fitness a lifestyle choice year-round!

Summer is barbecue season, but that doesn’t mean you have to stick to steaks and hot dogs. We love seafood as an alternative
post_title: and shrimp has many healthy advantages. This recipe for grilled shrimp skewers adds a nutritious
post_excerpt: delicious option to your menu. It’s easy to cook
post_status: and the flavorful sauce can be stored in the fridge for a week
comment_status: making it simple to prepare in advance. See how to make these incredible grilled shrimp skewers with pesto sauce below!

ID: Shrimp is an excellent low-calorie source of protein. A dozen shrimp can total just 85-100 calories while packing 15 grams of protein! Protein is a crucial macronutrient to include at every meal. Aiming for at least 15-20 grams per meal is a good general goal in order to increase satiety
post_author: keep you full longer
post_date: and maintain muscle mass.

ID: Muscle burns more calories than other forms of tissue
post_author: so maintaining muscle is a great way to improve metabolic function
post_date: boost energy
post_date_gmt: and strengthen overall health. A useful guideline is that each meal should keep you full for 4-6 hours
post_content: which helps to prevent mindless snacking or impulsive food choices. If you're hungry much sooner than 4 hours after a meal
post_title: it may mean you ate too little
post_excerpt: had simple carbohydrates which caused a blood sugar spike and quick drop
post_status: or didn't include enough protein. Besides keeping you full
comment_status: protein slows the rate at which food is digested and absorbed. This helps to steady blood sugar levels

ID: Shrimp is also rich in selenium
post_author: a mineral that helps to counter free radicals and oxidation throughout the body. It's also been shown to prevent certain types of cancers. Selenium's anti-inflammation and -oxidation properties also decrease the risk of heart disease. Additionally
post_date: good thyroid health necessitates adequate selenium since it's required for the production of thyroid hormone. The thyroid regulates metabolism
post_date_gmt: which affects weight and energy levels. Selenium also boosts immunity
post_content: helping ward off common colds and the flu.

ID: The pesto sauce in this recipe comes with many of its own health benefits. Mint is incredible for digestion
post_author: helping to fight inflammation in the gut and keeping things moving smoothly. Spinach is high in fiber
post_date: meaning it's also good for digestion
post_date_gmt: and because it's served raw it retains full micronutrient advantages. Garlic is incredible for immunity; it's antibacterial and antiviral
post_content: helping to ward off bad bacteria in the digestive tract. It also contains allicin
post_title: which stimulates immunity cells and keeps your immune system at peak performance. Overall
post_excerpt: these grilled shrimp skewers offer a lot in the way of both nutrition and taste.

post_date: peeled shrimp

post_author: peel
post_date: and dry shrimp. Thread shrimp onto 4-5 skewers. Brush with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Set aside.

ID: Step 2: Make sauce. Add all sauce ingredients except olive oil to food processor. Pulse until roughly chopped
post_author: then continue to pulse as you slowly add olive oil
post_date: until desired texture is reached. If using cheese
post_date_gmt: fold in finely grates cheese once done processing.

ID: Step 3: Heat BBQ to medium high. Once hot

A Mediterranean diet wards off disease, promotes wellness, and keeps weight healthy and stable. But what characterizes this approach to nutrition? Well
post_title: you'll find people in the Mediterranean region eating lots of fresh vegetables and fruits
post_excerpt: unprocessed grains
to_ping: olive oil. If you're looking to eat this way
pinged: most of your grocery shopping can be done around the perimeter of the store (think proteins and tons of produce)
post_modified: with limited trips to center aisles for certain grains
post_content_filtered: and legumes. While you may not be changing your whole diet just yet
post_parent: we encourage you to try this flavorful Mediterranean quinoa salad as a delicious gateway to Mediterranean cuisine.

ID: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad: An Excellent Source of Protein
Quinoa is one of the only plant protein sources that is a \"complete\" protein. The body produces many amino acids on its own
post_author: but there are nine amino acids we must consume in food
post_date: and they are crucial for survival. These are called essential amino acids
post_date_gmt: and quinoa contains all nine of them. Just one cup of this heart-healthy grain has eight grams of protein
post_content: meaning regularly including it in your diet can shave off the number of animal products you need as protein sources. Lowering your overall consumption of animal products is great for the environment and lowers your risk of diseases like cancer and heart disease. This Mediterranean quinoa salad is the perfect way to get protein.

ID: Olive oil is rich in monounsaturated fats
post_author: which are often missing in the modern American diet. The fatty acids in olive oil are called oleic acid. Oleic acid has been shown to reduce inflammation throughout the body
post_date: which promotes health and helps to prevent a slew of diseases. In addition to the health benefits of its type of fat
post_date_gmt: olive oil also contains a concentration of antioxidants shown to fight free radicals
post_content: improve skin health
post_title: and prevent cancer. The antioxidants can be damaged by exposure to light and heat
post_excerpt: so always store olive oil in a dark and cool spot.

ID: Every ingredient in this Mediterranean quinoa salad was chosen to promote health. Each vegetable is rich in antioxidants
post_author: which are important for counteracting the damaging pollutants
post_date: poor food choices
post_date_gmt: and stress we face each day. But it's not just the veggies that improve our wellness - both garlic and parsley come with their own benefits
post_content: too. Garlic in its raw form will not only add bite to the dish
post_title: but also stimulate the immune system and help fight off illness.

ID: Parsley is an herb you'll find in many Mediterranean dishes. It has long been used in the region to help diabetic patients
post_author: as parsley has been shown to keep blood sugar levels stable. Adding it to your dishes can help prevent insulin resistance
post_date: maintain energy levels
post_date_gmt: and even fight irritability. It's a great way to top this Mediterranean quinoa salad.

post_author: uncooked

ID: Step 1: Cook quinoa according to packaging. Once it's cooked
post_author: let cool to room temperature.

ID: Step 2: Prepare vegetables. Cut cucumber in half length-wise
post_author: then into slices. Slice tomatoes in half. Slice lemon in half. Cut red onion into thin slices. Cut olives in half. Remove stems and mince parsley. Mince garlic.

ID: Step 3: Add all vegetables and herbs (reserving 1/4 of parsley) to quinoa. Pour over olive oil and squeeze the juice of the entire lemon onto the salad. Add feta cheese if using. Toss to combine
post_author: then top with remaining parsley.

ID: This recipe can be served immediately or stored in the refrigerator for a week.

Do you make good use of outdoor space at work? It’s more important than you may think. Spending too much time indoors creates what health experts call a “nature deficit disorder”: increased depression and anxiety rooted in disconnection from the natural world. And while enjoying outdoor sports and recreation during your time off is always a great idea
post_title: so too is making a habit of going outside during the workday. It helps to reduce stress
post_excerpt: improve immunity

ID: Taking outdoor breaks refreshes our perspectives (and bodies) so we can return to work recharged. It also gives the brain some rest
post_author: which boosts focus
post_date: creativity
post_date_gmt: and productivity. Nature has a way of giving us a clearer
post_content: calmer state of mind. Here are some tips for utilizing outdoor space at work for a healthier

post_author: where your team can walk and talk
post_date: creating a great opportunity to incorporate outdoor activity into the workday while still being productive. Stepping out of the office and into the fresh air can help reinvigorate workers. It triggers creativity and brainstorming while also offering immediate stress relief.

ID: • Provide Adequate Breaks – Allow time for employees to take an unrushed lunch break of at least half an hour
post_author: although a full hour is even better. Taking lunches outside
post_date: whether at a nearby park or outdoor cafe
post_date_gmt: is a great way to boost moods and morale. It’s excellent for productivity and overall wellbeing. Besides lunch
post_content: 10- or 15-minute walk breaks
post_excerpt: also do wonders for stress relief.

ID: • Incorporate Fitness Opportunities – It’s always a good idea to encourage exercise
post_author: and it’s even more beneficial when there are outdoor opportunities for fitness. Some suggestions:

ID: • Provide an area where workers can store bikes to support cycling commutes.
• Schedule after-work employee kickball games in the parking lot.
• Offer outdoor yoga classes at a local park in the summer months.
• Bring Greenery into the Office – Fill the office with (real) plants
post_author: and try to set up a business space with as many windows – and as much light – as possible.

ID: • Encourage Outdoor Workspaces – Employees who can work on laptops can do work outside when possible. Time out of the office can boost mood and energy
post_author: making employees healthier and more productive.

ID: Outdoor Space at Work: The Many Benefits of Nature

A recent University of Rochester study shows that spending time in nature increases feelings of vitality and joy. Being outside manages both to energize and calm; it is restorative to physical and psychological wellbeing alike. Research demonstrates that a daily walk outdoors
post_author: particularly with a group or partner
post_date: reduces depression and increases feelings of happiness. Getting outdoors is good for our mental and emotional health
post_content: and helps relieve stress. Making opportunities to use outdoor space at work during the week fosters employee wellness and helps business. People are more productive when they take intermittent time away from their desks to enjoy nature. It’s a win-win for workers and employers.

Travel medicine is an important topic that is often overlooked or misunderstood. Whether you’re traveling for business or pleasure
post_title: any international journey should be planned with your health taken into consideration. When you’re in unfamiliar places
post_excerpt: far from the comforts of home or your regular physician
post_status: it’s always wise to have prepared for the trip with a comprehensive travel medicine plan. Check out these tips below to make sure you’re ready.

ID: • See your doctor before you travel. You may require vaccinations
post_author: whether routine or specific to the region where you are traveling. Your doctor will be able to assess if you need any vaccinations for safe travel to your destinations. If you have been ill recently
post_date: your physician can also determine whether you are well enough to travel and which precautions to take. Additionally
post_date_gmt: seeing a doctor can be important in case you have a preexisting medical condition and need to incorporate it into travel insurance coverage before embarking on your journey.

ID: • Assess your overall health. Consider any recent illnesses
post_author: injuries
post_date: or surgeries you’ve had
post_date_gmt: and determine whether you are currently well enough to travel. Do you have any specific health needs that may require special attention in the context of travel? Are you pregnant or planning to make the trip with an infant or child whose own needs (such as an inhaler for asthma) are relevant to an international travel plan?

ID: • Research your destination. Learn about the place where you’re going and any associated health risks. For more information
post_author: check out the Center for Disease Control (CDC) and their destination page.

ID: • Check for Travel Health Notices. The CDC and World Health Organization (WHO) regularly post and update destination-specific travel notices and warnings on their websites. It is wise to be aware of any health or weather alerts before you leave. Some areas are more prone to extreme weather or natural disasters
post_author: or may be experiencing an illness outbreak
post_date: so be sure to check. Refer to the CDC’s Natural Disasters and Severe Weather Page for more information.

ID: • Pack smart. In addition to your other essentials
post_author: be sure to include a travel health kit for your carry-on luggage. Include prescribed and over-the-counter medications you can’t do without
post_date: as well as copies of your prescriptions and the drugs’ generic names. You will need a note on letterhead stationery from your prescribing physician for all drugs and injectable medications
post_date_gmt: and you should leave an extra copy at home with someone you can reach. Be sure to check with the American embassy or consulate in your to ensure your specific medications are permitted entry into the country. Also
post_content: pack a first aid kit
post_excerpt: and any over health-related products you may need.

ID: • Purchase travel medical insurance. Unpredictable illnesses and accidents can happen while traveling
post_author: and the amount of travel coverage provided by your domestic insurance provider may be limited or non-existent. Depending on where you are traveling
post_date: foreign visitors without travel health insurance may have to pay out of pocket for any medical care required. Those costs can be considerable
post_date_gmt: especially if you sustain serious injury or illness. Make sure you and your family are covered.

ID: • Take care of your health during your trip. Some travel medicine simply comes down to using common sense and acting even more cautiously than you might at home. Use sunscreen and insect repellent when necessary. Be careful to get food and water from clean sources. Don’t overindulge in alcohol. Be sure to wear your seatbelt when in a car and protective equipment when enjoying adventure activities. Always respect your host country’s local laws
post_author: customs
post_date: and etiquette. In essence
post_date_gmt: limit opportunities for threats to your health or wellbeing.

ID: • Pay attention to your health when you get home. If you begin feeling ill upon your return
post_author: monitor your symptoms carefully and see your doctor.

ID: Whether you are traveling abroad for the first time or regularly jet around the globe
post_author: remember to attend to your travel medicine needs before you embark on your journey. Your trip will be all the more enjoyable (and safe) if you are informed
post_date: protected
post_date_gmt: and well prepared before you leave home.

post_content: We encourage a whole foods-oriented, natural diet for your health and longevity. However
post_title: anti-aging tips at any age go beyond just what’s on your plate. To reverse the aging process
post_excerpt: it makes sense to embrace healthy lifestyle choices in a number of areas. Using these anti-aging tips at any age will help keep you feeling and looking great for years to come.

post_author: keeps your weight in check
post_date: and maintains strong
post_date_gmt: toned muscles. Regular workouts help you look and feel younger than your years. Research shows that older adults who stay in shape with an exercise regimen have fewer visible signs of aging
post_content: and their physiological functioning more closely mirrors that of younger adults.

ID: Stress and stress-related hormones have a considerable aging effect on the body. Research suggests that this process begins at the cellular level. Stress and psychological distress contribute to physiological wear and strain on the body. It’s yet another good reason to manage stress in your life by utilizing some of these tools:
One of the most overlooked anti-aging tips? Adequate rest. Deep sleep on a regular schedule is essential to feeling great and staying youthful. Sleep allows your body (and your skin) to regenerate
post_author: repair
post_date: and heal. <a href=\"http://www.health.com/health/gallery/0
post_title: 00.html\">Certain foods can help you sleep more deeply
post_excerpt: and learning proper sleep hygiene is also important. Aim to get a solid eight hours of sleep each night
post_status: turn off your devices and lower the lights at least one hour before bedtime
comment_status: and sleep in a well-darkened room or with a sleeping mask.

ID: Your dermatologist is up to date on the best and latest anti-aging treatments for your skin
post_author: and may suggest treatments that will produce more dramatic results than you can achieve at home. Dermatologists offer various options to reverse the signs of premature aging from sun damage
post_date: and can also provide deeper exfoliating peels than what you can find over the counter or from your aesthetician. Consult with your doctor about treatment alternatives.

ID: Daily use of sunscreen not only helps prevent various forms of skin cancer
post_author: it also lessens the signs of accelerated aging. Applying a good sunscreen with an SPF of 30 or higher
post_date: each and every day
post_date_gmt: will protect against sun damage and reduce associated effects like wrinkles
post_content: lines
post_title: and hyperpigmentation. It's one of the easiest anti-aging tips to follow.

post_author: filtered water throughout the day. Water is how skin cells receive essential nutrients
post_date: and staying hydrated means you’ll be less susceptible to cracks and wrinkles. Depending on your activity level and body type
post_date_gmt: recommended amounts of daily water consumption vary. That said
post_content: it’s typically wise to try to drink about a liter each day.

ID: Retinoids function as an excellent topical anti-aging treatment for the skin. Retinoids are compounds derived from vitamin A which have been shown to accelerate cell turnover
post_author: boost collagen
post_date: and unclog pores. They reduce oil and acne breakouts
post_date_gmt: while smoothing skin and brightening its appearance . For strong formulations
post_content: see your dermatologist for a prescription. Over-the-counter versions
post_excerpt: are still effective in many cases.

post_author: anti-aging tips tend to have many general health benefits. While aging is inevitable
post_date: adjusting your routines to slow its effects can do wonders for your overall wellness.

post_author: Anti-Aging Tips at Any Age: How to Stop Time

Everyone wants to look and feel younger, but which anti-aging foods help? A diet of whole, natural foods with an emphasis on fresh fruits and vegetables can do wonders for your health and longevity. Eating right also helps to keep your skin smooth
post_excerpt: and youthful. Making good decisions about what you eat goes a long way toward maximizing wellness and preventing signs of premature aging. Here are 10 of the best anti-aging foods to add to your regular snack and meal rotation.

ID: • Blueberries - This super fruit contains more antioxidants than almost any other food. Eating half a cup per day helps to prevent free radical damage to the skin from excessive sun exposure
post_author: stress
post_date: and environmental pollution. Blueberries are among the best and most delicious anti-aging foods.

ID: • Leafy Greens - Greens like spinach and kale are great for keeping the skin firm and supple. These powerful veggies contain vital phytonutrient and antioxidant compounds that help reduce sun-related skin damage. Spinach is also high in lutein and beta-carotene
post_author: which are proven to preserve skin elasticity.

ID: • Cold Pressed Olive Oil - The beneficial fats in olive oil (omega-3s) are excellent for circulation and cardiovascular health
post_author: and additionally promote a healthy glow to the skin.
nuts are rich in valuable unsaturated fats. They also provide concentrated amounts of antioxidants
post_date: vitamins
post_content: and phytochemicals.

ID: • Salmon - Cold water fish like salmon are rich in omega-3s
post_author: which help prevent cholesterol accumulation in the arteries and are excellent for heart health and circulation. Omega-3s also keep skin smooth
post_date: youthful

post_author: squash
post_date: and sweet potatoes are high in vitamin A (retinol)
post_date_gmt: which helps skin appearance. Vitamin A is a powerful tool for cellular renewal and skin health. Carrots also contain vitamin K
post_content: vitamin B6
post_excerpt: and potassium
post_status: which together support the immune system and reduce cardiovascular risk.

ID: • Avocados - These increasingly ubiquitous fruits have a number of healthy benefits
post_author: and they are prime anti-aging foods. Containing omega-3s and vitamin E
post_date: avocados can be valuable in fighting free radicals and stopping much of the damage associated with aging.

post_author: which help maintain healthy blood vessel function
post_date: thereby lowering the risk of kidney disease
post_content: hypertension (high blood pressure)
post_title: and type 2 diabetes. In order to keep your intake of added sugars to a minimum
post_excerpt: opt for dark chocolate varieties of 70 percent cacao or higher.

ID: • Green Tea - This traditional tea is high in catechins
post_author: which are powerful compounds for preventing hyperpigmentation from sun damage. Green tea is also a great source of polyphenols (antioxidants)
post_date: which combat sun-related free radical damage and help reverse the effects of aging.

post_author: citrus fruits such as oranges
post_date: grapefruits
post_content: and limes help the amino acids lysine and proline convert to collagen in the skin
post_excerpt: supple
post_status: and youthful complexion. They have much to offer as anti-aging foods.

ID: A diet heavy on refined sugars
post_author: starches
post_date: and processed and synthetic foods will lead to inflammation
post_date_gmt: accelerating those changes to the body we associate with “aging.” Anti-aging foods counter this process. The benefits of good nutrition include increased energy
post_content: better sleep
post_excerpt: improved skin texture (and appearance)
post_status: and longevity. The more you pivot toward whole and natural foods
comment_status: especially fruits and vegetables like those mentioned above
ping_status: the more likely you’ll be to look and feel great for years to come.

Meal Prep Sunday is just what it sounds like: planning and preparing a series of meals all at once. It's not a new idea, but it's recently become a fixation among people who seek good nutrition despite tight budgets and busy schedules. Not only is it an efficient (and cost-effective!) way to cook, but it lends itself to healthy eating.

ID: Food \"prep\" can mean a variety of things — from fully preparing each meal so it's ready to eat
post_author: to simply washing and chopping ingredients in order to streamline the cooking process. The ultimate goal on Meal Prep Sunday is to invest effort early to ensure <a href=\"https://eheintl.com/mindful-eating/\">thoughtful
post_date: healthy eating later. When you prepare food for the week ahead
post_date_gmt: it's easier to preserve good eating habits even after the chaos of the week begins.

ID: We have a few general guidelines for becoming a Meal Prep Sunday master
post_author: as well as an incredibly easy and delicious mini frittata recipe for healthy grab-and-go breakfasts you can make ahead of a week's worth of hectic mornings. Enjoy!

ID: Tip #1: The Slow Cooker Is Your Meal Prep Sunday Friend
The slow cooker is the absolute perfect tool for food prep and easy dinners throughout the week. There are a few ways you can use it. The first is to find one recipe you love (like a soup or chili)
post_author: press start on Sunday
post_date: and by Monday morning you'll have five lunches magically ready to go. If you don't need a ton of variety over the course of your week
post_date_gmt: this is a great way to get all of your lunches done at once.

post_author: we recommend creating \"slow cooker packs\" for dinner. Each Sunday
post_date: choose three to five slow cooker recipes that sound good to you. Simply put all of the ingredients into large freezer bags
post_date_gmt: mark the meal and the date you want it
post_content: and store in the fridge. Each morning
post_excerpt: pour it into the slow cooker
post_status: and press start. By the time you're home from work
comment_status: dinner is served! The great thing with these meal packs is that you can make a dozen or more at a time.

ID: If your cooking style is more spontaneous
post_author: there's no need to make full meals all at once. Simply cleaning and chopping your herbs
post_date: vegetables
post_date_gmt: and fruits can make the week ahead a breeze. Cleaning meat and prepping your seasoning ahead of time only add to the convenience. We also recommend cooking grains like quinoa and rice
post_content: or steaming starchy vegetables like sweet potatoes
post_title: in large quantities before the week begins.

ID: One-pan dinners are the perfect way to utilize this type of prep. Since veggies will already be chopped and meats already marinated
post_author: simply spread them on a sheet pan with avocado or olive oil
post_date: and bake at 400 degrees for 20-30 minutes
post_date_gmt: depending on the specific ingredients you're using. Because your grains will already be cooked as well
post_content: simply scoop a portion onto everyone's plate and heat. Voila! Another option is to create \"stir fry bags\" out of your chopped veggies and meats. Just pour them into a wok for a quick

ID: Tip #3: Try to Get Your Vegetables at Lunch

Creating a week's worth of salads each Sunday is an excellent way to integrate a larger (and more diverse) set of vegetables and fruits into your diet. Every plant comes with its own unique composition of micronutrients; \"eating the rainbow\" throughout the week will help you cover your nutrient bases. Choose 6-12 varieties each week (or more!). On Sunday
post_author: pick a few varieties for each salad container and build interesting combinations as your base. Next
post_date: top each container with a different fat
post_date_gmt: like raw nuts or avocado. Last
post_content: choose a protein like chickpeas
post_excerpt: chicken
post_status: or hard boiled eggs to make your salads satiating. Half of a lemon and a tablespoon of olive oil is the perfect dressing. You can keep oil at work
comment_status: or bring in mini containers to dress right before you eat so your salad doesn't get soggy.

ID: We've all heard it before: Breakfast is the most important meal of the day. But you may find it is also the most challenging meal to find time to prepare
post_author: given how rushed we tend to be before work or school. We recommend getting 15-20 grams of protein within two hours of waking up to kick start your metabolism. One favorite Meal Prep Sunday option for breakfast is a smoothie pack. For smoothie packs
post_date: combine greens
post_content: and booster foods like chia or flax seeds in bags; then
post_title: store them in the freezer. Each morning
post_excerpt: simply pour the contents into a blender with protein powder and your preferred liquid. Breakfast is served.

ID: Meal Prep Sunday Recipe for Mini Frittatas
Another great option is this recipe! Any vegetables and meats can be substituted here
post_author: so feel free to create your own perfect combination.

ID: <strong>Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Blend or whisk whole eggs
post_author: egg whites
post_date: salt

ID: Step 2: Grease muffin tins. Slice onions and basil. Cut tomatoes in half. Wash and dry spinach. Evenly distribute vegetables in 12 muffin tins.

post_author: until 3/4 full. Top with cheese (if using).
or until lightly browned and cooked through.

ID: Step 5: Muffins can be stored in the fridge and reheated in a toaster oven throughout the week for a quick grab-and-go option in the morning. So make them a part of your next (or first) Meal Prep Sunday!

We are excited to appoint Susan Fanciullo as EHE’s Vice President of Client Success. Susan joins EHE where she will deliver best-in-class client experience to our portfolio of strategic, enterprise and mid-market clientele across North America.

Susan is a consummate professional with immense knowledge of client success. With over 28 years of extensive experience in the healthcare arena, Susan has dedicated her career to providing exceptional service and strategic thought leadership to national, complex clientele. Prior to joining EHE, Ms. Fanciullo led client management teams in both consultant and carrier communities. In the consulting world, Susan was responsible for $11 million in revenue at USI and $22 million at Gallagher. She was accountable to clients ranging from two to 45,000 employees. Additionally, Susan worked for Cigna, United Healthcare, Aetna, and Blue Cross Blue Shield in their respective National Accounts segments.

Ms. Fanciullo’s knowledge of the competitive landscape, industry trends, and product innovation has enabled her to develop outstanding custom solutions that have successfully supported her clients’ vision, aspirations, and goals.

Susan is poised to make an immediate impact on EHE’s business plans. She will work on influencing future lifetime value through higher product adoption, client satisfaction, and overall health scores while driving new business growth through greater advocacy and reference-ability.
post_title: EHE Welcomes Susan Fanciullo as Our Vice President of Client Success

post_content:
EHE, North America’s largest healthcare management company, announced today the appointment of Tania Elliott M.D., FAAAAI, FACAAI, as Chief Medical Officer. Dr. Elliott takes her post this month and joins EHE in its mission in improving patient health care through preventive medicine and wellness programs.

“We conducted an extensive search to identify our new Chief Medical Officer and are pleased to welcome Dr. Elliott to EHE,” said Shaun Francis, Chairman & CEO. “Her extensive experience and accomplishments are impressive, and she shares EHE’s philosophy and commitment of improving patient’s lives through the empowerment of healthy lifestyle choices.”

Board-certified Allergist and Internist, Dr. Elliott is a nationally recognized leader in telemedicine, technology, and innovation. Dr. Elliott received the American College of Allergy, Asthma and Immunology’s prestigious 1<sup>st</sup> place Von Pirquet award for her research on the role of IL-33 in cholesterol transport and atherogenicity.

As Medical Director at Doctor on Demand, Dr. Elliott displayed extraordinary achievements, where she served as a telemedicine physician seeing thousands of patients through real-time face-to-face video consultations while recruiting and training top quality physicians from across the country. Dr. Elliott also took on the responsibility of overseeing management of the physician workforce and created numerous specialist engagement programs, as well as clinical protocols.

The national media recognizes Dr. Elliott as an expert in the medical field and often calls on her for professional advice. She was featured on “Dr. Oz,” “The Rachael Ray Show,” “Live! With Kelly and Michael,” “Dr. Phil,” and as a co-host of the Emmy Award winning show “The Doctors.”

“I have always admired EHE and its commitment to helping patients lead a healthier and happier lifestyle,” said Dr. Elliott. “I value the opportunity to work with my new colleagues and add to the success of the company in providing quality clinical preventive services that lead to healthier communities.”

With the appointment of Dr. Tania Elliott, EHE continues to be future-focused, placing emphasis on preventative medicine and wellbeing programs while promoting patient outcomes and lowering healthcare costs.

Dr. Elliott is a graduate of Jefferson Medical College and completed her Internal Medicine Residency at Mount Sinai Hospital, and fellowship in Allergy and Clinical Immunology at Winthrop University Hospital.
post_title: Tania Elliott M.D., FAAAAI, FACAAI, Named Chief Medical Officer at EHE

post_content: We all know physical activity is good for us
post_title: but the health benefits of exercise are truly amazing. If you need to start a new fitness regimen
post_excerpt: now is the time. Whether you want to slim down
comment_status: or enhance your overall quality of life
ping_status: there is almost nothing that exercise can’t improve. Check out these great benefits of exercise for inspiration as you kick your efforts up a notch.

ID: • Boost Your Happiness and Self-Esteem - Finishing your morning walk
post_author: workout
post_date: or yoga class is an immediate psychological lift. Not only will your physical appearance
post_content: and energy improve
post_title: but the feeling of accomplishment is itself empowering and boosts self-esteem. Research shows that people who exercise regularly have higher levels of happiness and better overall moods than those who don’t.

ID: • Keep Your Brain Sharp - As we age
post_author: exercise is key to keeping our brains sharp
post_date: healthy
post_date_gmt: and youthful. Studies are finding that older people who exercise regularly have significantly better cognitive health than those who do not. Regular exercise increases blood flow to the brain
post_content: and increases beneficial chemicals known as brain-derived nerve growth factors
post_title: which support brain health and prevent cognitive decline.

ID: • Reduce Your Risk of Heart Disease - Regular exercise is a natural way to reduce your risk of heart disease. In fact
post_author: a meta review study with more than 339
post_date: 000 participants showed no statistically measurable differences between those individuals given medications to prevent coronary heart disease and prediabetes
post_date_gmt: and those individuals who exercised regularly. For those who had already suffered a stroke
post_content: exercise and physical activity was actually more effective for recovery than drug interventions.

ID: • Sleep More Deeply  - If you are prone to insomnia or sleep disturbances
post_author: exercise can help you sleep better. Regular exercise strengthens your circadian rhythms
post_date: which gives you more energy during the daylight hours
post_date_gmt: and better quality sleep at night. That said
post_content: it can take a few months for those people just beginning an exercise routine to see a positive impact on sleep. It's important to stick with any regimen long enough to reap the benefits of exercise
post_title: when it comes to improved sleep or otherwise.

post_author: low-intensity exercise
post_date: such as a walk around the park
post_date_gmt: can boost energy levels up to 20 percent while decreasing exhaustion. It is important to get adequate rest on a regular basis
post_content: but a consistent exercise program also helps to improve overall energy levels.

ID: • Fortify Your Immune System - Regular exercise helps protect your body from developing various cancers. There are several ways that exercise may contribute to this boost in immune system function
post_author: including the decrease of stress hormones in the body
post_date: the action of bacteria being flushed out of the upper respiratory system
post_date_gmt: and changes in antibodies and white blood cells which causes them to circulate more rapidly throughout the body.

ID: • Improve Strength and Flexibility - One of the most consequential benefits of exercise is
post_author: of course
post_date: the way it builds muscles and helps your body composition. Strength training like lifting weights
post_date_gmt: and weight-bearing exercises including some kinds of yoga
post_content: help improve muscle mass and overall strength. Such workouts also <a href=\"https://www.verywell.com/bone-density-and-exercise-3120770\">help prevent osteoporosis
post_title: and keep bones healthy and strong.

ID: These are only some of the great benefits of exercise. But you also shouldn't feel the need to overdo it when it comes to fitness. Try to incorporate a combination of vigorous and moderate aerobic exercise activities (like running
post_author: walking
post_date: cycling
post_content: with strength training about twice per week. If your goal is to lose weight
post_title: you may need to increase your efforts at first
post_excerpt: and then you can scale back a bit to maintain results. Always remember to check in with your doctor before beginning a new exercise program
post_status: especially if you have existing health concerns like diabetes
post_password: or if you haven’t exercised in a long time.

ID: "
post_author: Enjoy the Remarkable Benefits of Exercise
post_content: open
Common vaccines help to prevent a variety of diseases
post_title: and serve as a key preventive health care measure. Vaccination protects children and adults alike from a host of potentially serious
post_excerpt: communicable illnesses. Vaccines work with your body’s immune system to help develop resistance. Your vaccination requirements and recommendations may depend on your stage of life
post_status: whether you travel to various parts of the world

ID: Common vaccines help to prevent illness by mimicking an infection without causing the actual disease. The immune system responds as though it were an illness
post_author: learning to recognize and fight the specific disease while it's still in a manageable form. This is what's meant by developing immunity. After receiving a vaccination
post_date: you or your child may experience minor symptoms such as fever; this is a completely normal part of the immune response. As children grow older
post_date_gmt: they may require additional doses of vaccines for further protection. Check with your primary care physician and/or pediatrician for the schedule they recommend.

ID: • Varicella (Chickenpox) - Chickenpox is caused by the varicella-zoster virus (VZV)
post_author: which causes a blister-like rash accompanied by itching
post_date: fever

ID: • Rubella (German Measles) - Rubella is a virus which often presents as a mild illness with rash
post_author: fever and sore throat
post_date: but can cause miscarriage or severe birth defects if contracted by a pregnant woman.

ID: • Tetanus (Lockjaw) - Tetanus is not a human-to-human communicable disease; it is contracted through soil
post_author: manure or dust through a skin wound or puncture.

ID: • Rotavirus - Rotavirus is a contagious virus that can cause gastroenteritis
post_author: which is inflammation of the stomach and intestines. Rotavirus can cause extreme dehydration and sometimes death.

ID: • Pertussis (Whooping Cough) - Pertussis presents with cold-like symptoms
post_author: such as a runny nose
post_date: mild fever or cough. But it is also characterized by apnea
post_content: and is particularly dangerous for babies under a year old.

ID: • Polio - Polio is a crippling and often life-threatening disease. It is spread between people
post_author: and infects an individual’s brain and spinal cord
post_date: causing paralysis.

ID: • Pneumococcal - Pneumococcal is an infectious disease which causes blood infections and bacterial meningitis.
• Mumps - Mumps is an infectious virus characterized by swollen salivary glands
post_author: fever
post_date: muscle aches
post_content: and loss of appetite.

ID: • Meningococcal - Meningococcal diseases cause infections of the brain and spinal column and can be fatal.
• Human Papillomavirus (HPV) - HPV is a strain of herpes related viruses which is a major cause of cervical and other cancers.
• Influenza (Flu) - The flu is a contagious respiratory illness caused by viruses that infect the lungs and upper respiratory tract. Cases can be mild or severe
post_author: with the worst cases potentially leading to death.

ID: • Measles - Measles is a potentially life-threatening illness characterized by rash and high fever
post_author: as well as complications such as pneumonia
post_date: bronchitis

ID: • Hepatitis A - Hepatitis A is a viral
post_author: contagious liver disease which can cause mild to severe illness. It is transmitted through contact with an infected person
post_date: or through exposure to contaminated food or water.

ID: • Hepatitis B - Hepatitis B is a potentially life-threatening virus which attacks the liver
post_author: and can cause both acute and chronic illness.

ID: • Diphtheria - Diphtheria is a severe bacterial infection of the nose and throat.
• Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib disease) - Hib disease is a bacterial illness which can lead to bacterial meningitis (inflammation of the brain or spinal column). It may also cause pneumonia
post_author: arthritis
post_date: or blood infections.

ID: As with any medical treatment or intervention
post_author: common vaccines carry possible risks or side effects. The most frequent side effects present as mild and uncomplicated
post_date: and subside within a few days. More severe allergic reactions can occur
post_content: so pay close attention for the first few days after a vaccination and contact your doctor immediately if any concerns arise.

ID: "
post_author: These Are the Common Vaccines You Need to Know
post_content: open

Measles is an endemic illness, meaning it is present within a population on an ongoing basis, but individuals can develop resistance to it through exposure. Vaccination prevents many potential cases of measles worldwide. Meanwhile
post_title: each year approximately 2.6 million people who have not had the vaccine die from the disease
post_excerpt: also known as morbilli or rubeola. Measles symptoms tend to appear within 10 to 14 days of exposure to the virus. So what are these measles symptoms?

ID: Signs of measles include (but are not limited to):

post_author: inflamed
post_date: and watery eyes)

post_author: which are tiny grayish-white markings on a red
post_date: inflamed background
post_date_gmt: found inside the mouth or the lining of the cheeks. These spots tend to develop two to three days after symptoms start.

post_author: blotchy skin rash which develops three to four days after symptoms start. This rash usually starts behind the ears
post_date: spreading across the head and neck
post_date_gmt: and then to the rest of the body. As the rash grows
post_content: the blotches tend to join together.

ID: Measles symptoms characteristically develop in stages over a period of about three weeks:

post_author: Infection and Incubation - During the first 10 to 14 days after infection there are no symptoms as the virus incubates.

ID: • Second Stage: Symptoms Begin - For the first two to three days after symptoms start
post_author: measles will look like a mild illness with a low to moderate fever
post_date: runny nose
post_content: sore throat and persistent cough.

ID: • Third Stage: Acute Stage with Rash - The face will break out first
post_author: specifically around the ears and hairline. The rash will appear as clusters of small
post_date: red spots
post_content: giving an overall splotchy appearance. Over the next two to three days
post_title: the rash will spread across the rest of the body and to the legs. The fever will spike
post_excerpt: sometimes as high as 104 to 105 F.

post_author: meaning the infected person is contagious for about eight days — from four days before the rash appears to four days after the rash has presented. The virus remains viable on an object
post_date: like a surface or a doorknob
post_date_gmt: for about two hours. Measles is contracted through physical contact with an infected person
post_content: being near infected people who sneeze or cough
post_title: or by touching an infected surface and then rubbing the eyes or nose
post_excerpt: or putting fingers into the mouth. People who have not been infected before or vaccinated are at risk of infection if exposed to measles.

ID: It's important to recognize measles symptoms early in order to limit exposure to other people and receive treatment. If there are no complications
post_author: a doctor will usually prescribe bed rest with plenty of fluids to prevent dehydration. Symptoms will usually subside within a week to 10 days. Keep the ill person away from school or work.
however
post_date: and most often develop in those individuals who have weakened immune systems or vitamin deficiencies. Young children under two years old are also more vulnerable to complications. Pregnant women who become infected are at risk of miscarriage
post_date_gmt: premature delivery and low birth weight. If complications such as vomiting
post_content: difficulty breathing
post_excerpt: ear or eye infections

ID: "
post_author: Measles Symptoms: How to Recognize the Illness
post_content: open

The measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR) vaccine is a well-known vaccination recommended for all children and typically administered in two parts. It can also be given to adults if they were not vaccinated during childhood. The MMR vaccine protects against the three diseases
post_excerpt: and each potentially dangerous if contracted.

post_author: Mumps
post_date: and Rubella: What to Know

post_author: measles
post_date: mumps
post_date_gmt: and rubella were common diseases. Their consequences could be life-altering and even deadly.

post_author: Koplik’s spots (white spots in the mouth)
post_date: runny nose
post_content: and fever. Complications range from ear infections to incredibly serious conditions like pneumonia and encephalitis

ID: Mumps most conspicuously causes swollen glands
post_author: as well as painful swallowing or chewing
post_date: headache
post_date_gmt: and fever. The infection’s more damaging potential complications include meningitis and deafness.

post_author: also called German measles
post_date: can produce symptoms such as rash
post_content: red and inflamed eyes
post_title: and swollen lymph nodes at the back of the neck. It can cause severe complications for pregnant women
post_excerpt: including birth defects and miscarriage.

ID: According to the recommendations of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
post_author: the MMR vaccine is best administered as follows:

ID: • The first dose for children aged 12 to 15 months.
• The second dose at four to six years old.

post_author: and born after 1956
post_date: should receive one dose of the vaccine
post_date_gmt: unless they have had all three illnesses previously
post_content: or have already been vaccinated.

ID: Who Should Not Get the MMR Vaccine (or Wait)?
• Individuals who have had previous allergic reactions to the MMR vaccine.
• Individuals who are allergic to the antibiotic neomycin or another component of the MMR vaccine.

post_author: including HIV/AIDS.
and those undergoing cancer treatment.

ID: <li>Individuals taking medications that interfere with the immune system
post_author: such as steroids.
you should consider delaying the MMR vaccine if you are pregnant
post_date: currently experiencing an illness
post_date_gmt: have recently received a blood transfusion
post_content: or have already received a vaccine within the last four weeks.

post_author: the MMR vaccine is “much safer than getting measles
post_date: mumps
post_content: you should be aware of possible side effects

post_author: low platelet count
post_date: or seizure (moderate)

ID: The CDC reports that approximately one in six children develops a fever following the MMR vaccination
post_author: while febrile seizures take place at a rate of roughly one in 3
post_date: 000 doses. Doctors emphasize that the benefits of immunization outweigh the potential risks
post_date_gmt: as vaccinations are safe for most people and critical to the prevention of measles
post_content: mumps

ID: The MMR vaccine was introduced in the United States in 1971. Some people have raised concerns that the vaccine may precipitate severe health risks in children
post_author: including autism and inflammatory bowel disease. Research has shown
post_date: however
post_date_gmt: no link between these conditions and the MMR vaccine. Much of the controversy was fueled by a study published in The Lancet in 1998 but subsequently retracted.

post_author: but
post_date: as with any medical intervention
post_date_gmt: reactions or side effects are possible. Always discuss your specific medical concerns and history with your doctor
post_content: and be sure to ask about potential risks for any treatment under consideration.

High-quality serums, creams, and lotions can do great things for your skin
post_title: but nothing compares to the glow-inducing power of good nutrition. Of course
post_excerpt: major lifestyle factors like tanning and smoking will sabotage your skin (and your health) no matter what you eat
post_status: so kick those habits to the curb first. But when you upgrade your diet
post_password: and have improved structural integrity. What are the best foods for skin that glows?

ID: • Carrots - Carrots are little powerhouses full of vitamin A and beta-carotene
post_author: which help clear up acne and breakouts. Vitamin A is an antioxidant which inhibits overproduction of skin cells
post_date: which can lead to clogged pores and blemishes. The vitamin also plays a role in preventing the development of skin cancer
post_content: promoting healthy skin and a youthful complexion. While carrots are perhaps best-known as a good food for eyesight
post_title: they're also among the best foods for skin.

ID: • Walnuts - Consuming just five grams of polyunsaturated fats each day lowers your risk of skin cancer. One daily serving of walnuts provides more than twice that amount. Alpha-linolenic acid
post_author: an omega-3 fat found in walnuts
post_date: is a powerful component of the lubricating layer of the skin

post_author: one of the most important antioxidants for skin health. It also keeps skin moisturized
post_date: helps repair damaged cells
post_date_gmt: and protects against sun damage. Almonds are also one of the best sources for dairy-free calcium.

ID: • Green Tea - Green tea is a powerful source of catechins
post_author: which have antioxidant
post_date: anti-inflammatory
post_date_gmt: and anti-cancer properties. Drinking two cups of green tea per day helps prevent skin cancer and reduces signs of sun damage. Just be aware that too much caffeine has a dehydrating effect on the skin
post_content: so moderate your consumption.

ID: • Kale - This cruciferous veggie is a super-rich source of vitamins A
post_author: C
post_date: and E
post_date_gmt: and also vitamin K — all key antioxidants for skin health and radiance. Vitamin K also helps with proper blood clotting and faster healing. For easy ways to get one of the best foods for skin
post_content: you can simply throw some kale into a fruit smoothie
post_title: or try some roasted kale chips as an alternative to potato chips.

ID: • Papaya - This tropical fruit is full of active enzymes
post_author: such as chymopapain
post_date: which are powerful tools for the prevention and relief of inflammation. Another enzyme in papaya is papain
post_date_gmt: which heals blemishes and treats acne when applied topically
post_content: as it helps clear pores and cleanse the skin. Just one cup of ripe papaya provides you with 140 percent of your daily recommended amount of collagen-supporting vitamin C.

post_author: curcumin
post_date: has been shown to be one of the most powerful anti-inflammatory and free radical-fighting compounds. Turmeric is also protective against cancer
post_date_gmt: and facilitates pain reduction. Topical applications of turmeric can also help lighten scars and hyperpigmentation. Try this easy
post_content: homemade
post_title: and healing turmeric facial mask to promote a more even skin tone.

post_author: tomatoes are amazing for helping to prevent sun damage and premature aging. Research shows that lycopene is a powerful protectant against sunburn. It also promotes and strengthens collagen
post_date: and reduces fine lines and wrinkles. Tomatoes are a versatile addition to any diet of the best foods for skin.

post_author: phytonutrients
post_date: and antioxidants that fight free radicals and support collagen production
post_date_gmt: berries are amazing and delicious skin-positive foods. Blueberries are especially high in antioxidants
post_content: while strawberries are particularly rich in vitamin C. Regular consumption of berries helps keep your skin smooth
post_excerpt: and firm.

ID: • Eggs - Studies show that zeaxanthin and lutein
post_author: two antioxidants found in eggs
post_date: can more than quadruple protection against ultraviolet (UV) damage leading to hyperpigmentation
post_content: and skin cancer. These antioxidants also promote firm
post_excerpt: and hydrated skin.

ID: The best foods for skin are foods with a wealth of overall nutritional value. There is no substitute for the right diet in maintaining beautiful and radiant skin. Topical approaches to skin care can do a lot of good
post_author: but the most powerful transformation comes from what you put into your body. Stay hydrated with pure water
post_date: apply sunscreen daily
post_date_gmt: and incorporate these glow-promoting foods into your regular meal and snack rotation.

post_content: September is National Prostate Cancer Awareness Month. Prostate cancer is the second-most common cancer in American men
post_title: and is the most common non-skin cancer. While there are more aggressive forms
post_excerpt: most prostate cancers progress slowly and respond to treatment. This means early detection is key. Being aware of the risk factors for prostate cancer
comment_status: and relevant lifestyle adjustments and treatments
ping_status: is crucial to avoiding the illness or mitigating its severity.

ID: There is no way to know for sure if you will get prostate cancer
post_author: but awareness of potential risks is important. Notable risk factors include:

ID: • Genetic mutations and family history — A family history of prostate cancer
post_author: particularly if a father or brother had the disease
post_date: may indicate a genetic vulnerability. Men whose families have the BRCA1 and BRCA2 gene mutations may be at increased risk.

ID: • Diet and lifestyle — A sedentary lifestyle may contribute to the risk for developing prostate cancer
post_author: as may a diet high in dairy products and red meat. These factors also have an effect on outcomes once the illness has already developed.

ID: • Chemical exposures — Men who have been exposed to a range of chemicals
post_author: including Agent Orange during the Vietnam war
post_date: substances associated with firefighting
post_date_gmt: and the Bisphenol A (BPA) found in many consumer goods
post_content: may be at an elevated risk.

ID: • Advanced age — The disease is most common in men over the age of 65.
• Ethnicity — African-American men develop prostate cancer at a higher rate than other U.S. sub-populations. Also
post_author: the illness is most commonly found in North America
post_date: Australia
post_content: and the Caribbean.

ID: Men can present with different symptoms of prostate cancer; some have none at all. But the most common signs of the illness include:

post_author: particularly at night.
or a weak or interrupted flow.
pelvis
post_date: or back.

ID: There are two tests typically used to detect the cancer:
<li>Prostate-specific antigen (PSA) test — This screening method measures the amount of PSA (a substance produced by the prostate) in the blood
post_author: as these levels tend to be higher in men with prostate cancer. These levels can also be elevated due to other prostate conditions. The PSA can detect cancer earlier than no screening at all
post_date: but false positive and negative results do occur with this test. Your doctor can help you determine if this method is right for you.

ID: <li>Digital rectal examination (DRE) — A nurse or physician gently inserts a gloved
post_author: lubricated finger into the rectum to check the prostate gland for abnormalities
post_date: lumps
post_date_gmt: or growths. The clinician may also gently press down on the lower abdomen or pelvic area during the exam.

post_author: Diet
post_date: and Lifestyle Recommendations

ID: Approaching your prostate health with a preventive mindset is the best way to reduce your risk for cancer. Here are some things to consider:
• Exercise and maintain a healthy weight — Having a regular fitness routine
post_author: even if it's just going for brisk walks
post_date: is a great way to optimize your health. Obesity has a negative impact on survival outcomes for those diagnosed with prostate cancer. Keeping your weight in a healthy range is an important component of preventive prostate care.

ID: • Manage stress — Proper stress management is a powerful preventive measure for a range of medical issues
post_author: and studies have shown that men who practice stress management techniques before and after prostate cancer treatment have a higher quality of life while recovering. Meditate
post_date: practice deep belly breathing
post_date_gmt: and find ways to do what you love. Work and hobbies that promote serenity and relaxation are key. Also be mindful of your stress load at work
post_content: and reduce and manage it as much as possible.

ID: • Maintain a healthy diet — Choose a plant-based diet low in red meat and dairy
post_author: and high in leafy greens
post_date: fruits and vegetables
post_content: and antioxidants. Some foods particularly helpful for prostate cancer prevention and recovery may be fatty fish
post_excerpt: green tea
post_status: and cruciferous vegetables like broccoli and cabbage.

ID: September is a great time to talk with your doctor and preventive care providers about prostate cancer. The more informed you are
post_author: the better you'll be able to make the best decisions for your prostate health. When detected early
post_date: the illness is treatable and survivable. Understanding the disease and taking a proactive approach will make all the difference. See the following resources for additional information:

post_author: 85215_VA\">The Veterans Health Library

ID: "
post_author: Prostate Cancer: What You Need to Know
post_content: open

Prostate cancer risk factors increase your chances of developing the illness. While simply having one or more of the factors does not guarantee you will get prostate cancer, you can reduce the risk by understanding the disease and then adjusting your lifestyle to take some measure of control over your vulnerability.

ID: The prostate is part of the male reproductive system
post_author: and prostate cancer is the most common non-skin cancer for men. One in eight men will be diagnosed in his lifetime. While only one in 10
post_date: 000 will be diagnosed with prostate cancer before age 40
post_date_gmt: one in 39 will be diagnosed between the ages of 40 and 59
post_content: and one in 14 will be diagnosed between the ages of 60 and 69. About 60 percent of all prostate cancers are diagnosed in men over the age of 65. The disease is treatable if it's detected early
post_title: so consult with your physician about proper screening. Researchers have identified a number of prostate cancer risk factors that may affect a man’s chances of developing the illness:

post_author: prostate cancer occurs at higher rates as men get older; while the disease can affect men in their twenties and thirties
post_date: it is far more likely to develop in those who have reached middle age.

ID: • Family History — While most prostate cancers occur in men with no family history of the illness
post_author: heredity does play a role. Having a father or a brother with prostate cancer more than doubles a man’s chances of developing the illness. The risk increases if several relatives have had the illness.

ID: • Geography — Prostate cancer is most common in North America
post_author: northwestern Europe
post_date: the Caribbean
post_date_gmt: and Australia. Lifestyle and dietary factors may contribute to the risks being higher in these regions
post_content: but more research is needed.

post_author: prostate cancer risk factors include a genetic component. Men with Lynch syndrome
post_date: which is a form of hereditary colorectal cancer
post_date_gmt: may have a slightly raised risk for prostate cancer. The BRCA1 or BRCA2 gene mutations (which raise the risk of breast and ovarian cancers for women) may also increase the chances of developing prostate cancer in men.

ID: • Chemical Exposures — Studies suggest that exposure to different chemicals (ranging from those used in firefighting and warfare to the BPA found in many plastic consumer products) my increase the risk of developing prostate and other cancers.
• Ethnicity — Prostate cancer occurs more often in men of African descent than in men of other ethnic groups
post_author: and it occurs less often in Latino and Asian-American men than in non-Hispanic whites.

ID: Other prostate cancer risk factors are related to social and environmental considerations
post_author: particularly diet and lifestyle. While there is no conclusive evidence that obesity is a causative factor
post_date: it does have a negative impact on prostate cancer outcomes. The same is true of smoking. There is also evidence that men whose diets are high in red meat and dairy — and low in fresh fruits and vegetables
post_date_gmt: particularly cruciferous vegetables like broccoli and cabbage — are at higher risk for developing prostate cancer.

ID: There are some additional prostate cancer risk factors related to the more aggressive form of the disease. These include: sedentary lifestyle and lack of exercise
post_author: excessive calcium intake
post_date: and tall height.

ID: Lifestyle Adjustments to Reduce Your Prostate Cancer Risk

Lifestyle choices that boost your overall health are helpful in preventing many chronic conditions and cancers. Targeted adjustments that increase your chances of avoiding or recovering from prostate cancer include:

post_author: along with exercise (walking is particularly good)
post_date: and maintaining a healthy weight.

ID: • Eating a plant-based diet that emphasizes fresh fruits and vegetables
post_author: and minimizes animal products (especially red meat and dairy). Particularly helpful foods include cooked tomatoes
post_date: olive oil
post_content: green tea
post_excerpt: and cruciferous vegetables.

ID: • Limiting your intake of simple and refined sugars.

post_author: and limiting or eliminating alcohol intake.

ID: • Reducing and managing your stress at home and at work. Seek treatment for depression
post_author: hypertension
post_date: and diabetes.

ID: Lifestyle factors such as diet and stress management are important
post_author: but it is also crucial to receive proper screenings to detect the illness early when it is easiest to treat. There are competing medical recommendations about when (and how often) to get screened. Be sure to talk to your doctor
post_date: who can advise you regarding the risks and benefits of prostate screening procedures based on your specific profile and can help guide any preventive lifestyle adjustments you may need to make.

ID: "
post_author: Prostate Cancer Risk Factors: What You Should Know
post_content: open

Tropical Storm Harvey continues to devastate the Gulf Coast, with record rainfall still pounding the region. Millions of Americans in Houston and countless small towns across Texas and Louisiana are now facing destructive, deadly flooding. EHE's thoughts are with everyone affected by the storm and its aftermath. We have a clinic and affiliated physicians in Houston, as well as family, friends, colleagues, and clients throughout the area. While a catastrophe like Harvey creates emergencies that make personal care incredibly difficult, it's never more important than during a disaster to follow basic medical protocols to ensure your safety. Please read the following EHE recommendations for staying healthy in the wake of the storm. Hygiene and Drinking Water While basic hygiene is always important, it's especially vital during floods when floodwaters can carry sewage, pesticides, and other highly dangerous substances. Be sure to wash your hands and face with water that's been boiled or disinfected to reduce your exposure to germs. Similarly, if your community's tap water has been contaminated or compromised, only use properly cleaned water to drink, prepare food, or brush your teeth. See the Centers for Disease Control's (CDC) recommendations for making water safe in an emergency.

ID: While new outbreaks of diseases not common in the United States (such as cholera or typhoid) will not occur after Harvey or similar storms
post_author: other communicable illnesses like diarrhea and respiratory illnesses may spread due to compromised public sanitation
post_date: crowding in shelters
post_date_gmt: and other factors. Pay attention to specific alerts from local and state health departments. Most importantly
post_content: do everything possible to maintain personal hygiene and the integrity of your food and water. The CDC also advises people in post-hurricane flood zones to be careful to protect against mosquitoes since the insects can carry a number of diseases and thrive in standing water. Here is additional information on specific infectious diseases associated with natural disasters.

ID: Floodwaters can contain debris that may cause cuts or puncture wounds and those same waters could be contaminated with bacteria which is why there is a heightened media focus on the risk of contracting tetanus however
post_author: infectious disease experts caution against public panic regarding tetanus. While tetanus infection is serious
post_date: mere exposure to floodwaters is NOT in and of itself a reason to get an immediate tetanus booster shot
post_date_gmt: despite certain reports. If you sustain a wound during a flood
post_content: it should be evaluated for possible tetanus treatment no differently than it would be in a non-disaster situation. If you've already been vaccinated on the CDC-recommended schedule (a booster shot every 10 years for adults)
post_title: no additional vaccination is necessary. In most cases
post_excerpt: properly treating wounds and consulting with a doctor if you are not sure of your tetanus vaccination history should be the guiding protocol.

post_author: it is imperative to take extreme caution when you return. All utilities — electricity
post_date: natural gas
post_content: etc. — must be shut off to avoid potential electrocution or explosion. Depending on the extent of the flooding
post_title: dangerous downed power lines may be obscured
post_excerpt: sewage or metal debris could be in the water
post_status: ventilation of carbon monoxide could be blocked
comment_status: and other hazards could be present. Always consult with the police and fire departments
ping_status: as well as local utility providers
post_password: to determine whether it's safe to enter the house. For more information
post_name: see CDC guidelines on reentering flooded homes and additional cleanup recommendations.

ID: A major health risk in the coming weeks and months will be the mold in buildings hit by rain and flooding. Experts say that any structure flooded during an event on this scale should be presumed to contain mold if not thoroughly dried within 48 hours. Given the prolonged nature of this storm
post_author: the mold issue could be particularly widespread. The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has recommendations for residential flood cleanup
post_date: and the CDC has a checklist of the first and most important steps to take to combat flood-related mold. A comprehensive and more detailed guide to mold from both agencies can be seen here.

ID: Natural disasters trigger spikes in stress and anxiety
post_author: can worsen existing mental health problems
post_date: and often impede standard mental health care delivery. If you are experiencing emotional distress due to the storm and need help
post_date_gmt: contact the National Disaster Distress Helpline. It is multilingual
post_content: critical crisis support
post_title: available toll-free and 24 hours a day via phone (1-800-985-5990) and SMS (text ‘TalkWithUs’ to 66746). For more help in coping with the trauma caused by emergencies like Harvey
post_excerpt: see these mental health resources at the Department of Health and Human Services.

ID: With floodwaters disrupting the environment and displacing species of every kind
post_author: there are widespread reports (and social media documentation) of fire ants
post_date: snakes
post_date_gmt: alligators surfacing in areas in and around Houston where they’re usually not spotted. Wildlife experts advise people to exercise the same common sense they would in normal circumstances: Stay clear
post_content: even if the animals don’t seem dangerous. Be especially vigilant
post_title: given how floodwaters can keep animals hidden until they’re very close. And
post_excerpt: when reentering your home after it’s safe
post_status: be sure to check for any animals that may have taken up residence amid the storm.

ID: For anyone hoping to assist those in the disaster zone
post_author: here are some ways to help:

ID: The American Red Cross is accepting donations online (click here) and via text (you can give $10 by texting HARVEY to 90999).

Local organizations like the South Texas Blood & Tissue Center are facing desperate blood shortages. Donors nationwide can help — visit America's Blood Centers or the American Red Cross or the Armed Services Blood Program to find a donation site close to you.
Americares is facilitating the delivery of emergency medicine
post_author: water
post_date: and supplies to those affected by Harvey; visit the site to donate.

ID: You can also donate to local groups
post_author: including:
established by the Greater Houston Community Foundation.
