Lung cancer can result from genetic factors, lifestyle choices
post_excerpt: and other factors. November is Lung Cancer Awareness Month
post_status: and it's important to learn what you can do to reduce your risk and stay healthy.

ID: The disease refers to uncontrolled abnormal cell growth on one or both lungs. These cells don't carry out the functions of healthy lung tissue. Instead
post_author: as they grow
post_date: these abnormalities form tumors
post_date_gmt: which interfere with the lungs’ ability to supply oxygen to the body through the bloodstream.

ID: There are three types of lung cancer.
• Small cell lung cancer - Also called oat cell cancer
post_author: small cell lung cancer tends to spread rapidly
post_date: and comprises about 10 to 15 percent of all lung cancers diagnosed.

ID: • Non-small cell lung cancer - This is the most common type of lung cancer
post_author: with about 85 percent of all diagnosed lung cancers being the non-small cell variation. Large cell carcinoma
post_date: adenocarcinoma
post_date_gmt: and squamous cell carcinoma are subtypes of this form of lung cancer.

ID: • Lung carcinoid tumor - This is a rare form of lung cancer. Only about 5 percent of lung cancers are lung carcinoid tumors; these are also known as neuroendocrine tumors. They tend to grow slowly
post_author: and do not usually spread.

ID: Treatment options for the different types of lung cancer vary
post_author: with each kind requiring a different approach. Each type is often treated using a combination of modalities
post_date: and palliative care treatments are frequently used to decrease discomfort.

ID: For small cell lung cancer include
post_author: treatments include:

ID: Multiple types of treatments may be used to manage small cell lung cancer
post_author: with chemotherapy and radiation being the most common. Surgery is sometimes used
post_date: but is more rare with this type of cancer.

ID: Treatment for non-small cell lung cancer includes:
Lung carcinoid tumors are treated with:

post_author: Risk Factors
post_date: and Prevention

ID: Lung cancer is the leading cause of death in the United States. Most cases are caused by smoking and exposure to secondhand smoke. About 80 percent of all lung cancers are caused by tobacco smoke
post_author: and secondhand smoke alone causes about 7
post_date: 000 deaths each year. Prevention includes steps you can take to lower your risk. Avoiding risk factors and increasing protective factors helps reduce your risk of developing chronic illness and disease.

post_author: pipe
post_date: and cigar smoking

ID: • Environmental risk factors like pollution or asbestos
The following protective measures can help reduce your risk:

post_author: quit

ID: • Avoid or lower exposure to environmental risk factors
• Reduce or avoid exposure to radon and radiation
Not all lung cancers can be prevented
post_author: per se
post_date: but you can reduce your chances of developing these illnesses by decreasing your exposure to controllable risk factors. The most important thing you can do is avoid smoking or breathing in other people’s smoke. If you stop smoking before you develop lung cancer
post_date_gmt: your lung tissue gradually repairs itself
post_content: and you lower your risk of becoming sick. No matter your age or how long you’ve smoked
post_excerpt: and help you live a longer
post_status: healthier life overall. Radon is also a major cause of lung cancers
comment_status: so have your home tested and treated (if needed).

post_author: plant-centered diet with lots of fresh fruits and vegetables may also help you avoid lung cancer. Studies suggest that plant-based diets (especially when combined with exercise) are protective in both smokers and non-smokers
post_date: though not smoking
post_content: is still crucial for preventing illness and vulnerability to chronic diseases. A focus on creating wellness
post_excerpt: is the best investment you can make in your health. Giving up poor habits and dietary choices
post_status: and establishing new and better habits
ping_status: but it is always worth your efforts.

post_author: What You Should Know About Lung Cancer
post_content: open
What is Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)? In addition to lung cancer
post_title: November is National Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Awareness Month. COPD is an inflammatory lung disease that impairs airflow. When we breathe
post_excerpt: the air travels through tubes (called airways) to millions of tiny air sacs in our lungs. In healthy lungs
post_status: these passages are open and unobstructed
comment_status: allowing air to flow in and out quickly. COPD impedes this process. Emphysema and bronchitis are the two conditions most commonly associated with COPD.

ID: • Bronchitis - An inflammation of the lining of the bronchial tubes
post_author: which carry air to and from the alveoli
post_date: or air sacs
post_date_gmt: of the lungs. It is characterized by daily
post_content: chronic coughing and mucus production.

ID: • Emphysema - An inflammatory condition in which the air sacs of the lungs are destroyed as a result of damaging exposure to cigarette smoke
post_author: industrial pollutants
post_date: and other irritating gases and substances. With emphysema
post_date_gmt: the smallest breathing tubes in the lungs may also collapse
post_content: in addition to the damage done to the alveoli.

ID: Cigarette smoking causes about 80 to 90 percent of all cases. Habitual smoking inflames the lining of the airways of the lungs
post_author: and destroys their elasticity. Other risk factors include exposure to secondhand smoke
post_date: environmental pollutants
post_date_gmt: and occupational dust or contaminants/chemicals. If you have asthma and smoke
post_content: this further increases your chances of developing these diseases. Heredity may also play a role. Researchers have identified what is known as an alpha-1-antitrypsin deficiency
post_title: but this genetic disorder contributes to only a small number of COPD cases (about one percent).

post_author: or with exertion
ankles
post_date: and feet

ID: <li>A chronic cough that produces sputum (mucus) that may be clear
post_author: white
post_date: greenish

post_author: which is blueness of the lips or fingernail beds

ID: COPD is often characterized by exacerbations
post_author: or periods of several days when symptoms become worse than usual. It is a progressive disease
post_date: tending to worsen over time. That is why it is vitally important to seek treatment quickly
post_date_gmt: so the illness can be managed and addressed as soon as possible. Lifestyle adjustments are a key component to any COPD treatment plan.

ID: <li>Respiratory infections. Those with COPD are more likely to catch colds
post_author: flu
post_date: and pneumonia.

ID: • Heart problems. COPD can increase your risk of heart disease and heart attacks.
<li>High blood pressure in lung arteries. COPD may cause pulmonary hypertension
post_author: or high blood pressure in the arteries that bring blood to the lungs.
combined with restricted activities due to illness
post_date: can contribute to depression. Seek help if you begin to experience feelings of prolonged helplessness or sadness.

ID: • Lung cancer. People with COPD have a higher risk for lung cancer.
The best thing you can do to prevent COPD is to never smoke. If you do smoke
post_author: quit. Quitting can improve your health
post_date: no matter how long you’ve smoked. When you quit smoking
post_date_gmt: you slow down the damage being done to your lungs
post_content: and they begin to repair themselves. For people who quit smoking
post_excerpt: and over time is on par with those who do not smoke. It is also important to avoid contaminated air

Banana bread is classic comfort food (especially when you have overripe bananas you don't want to waste). Gluten-free banana bread is just as tasty, while also letting people on low- or no-gluten diets enjoy the treat. And the version we make is even healthier, since we've removed the processed sugar and refined ingredients included in traditional recipes. The result is a wholesome gluten-free banana bread you'll love!

Bananas are the perfect base for baked goods
post_title: since they keep bread moist without needing excessive amounts of oil or butter. They also contain many important nutrients. Additionally
post_excerpt: they're full of fiber
post_status: which helps slow the digestion of sugar into the bloodstream. One banana also contains more than a third of our daily vitamin B6 requirement. B vitamins are crucial for metabolism
post_modified: and is good for healthy immune function. It also helps to maintain a positive mood
post_modified_gmt: since it factors in the production of serotonin.

post_author: we've chosen ghee (with the option of using coconut oil if you're vegan). Ghee is a form of clarified butter — meaning the milk proteins are removed
post_date: but the vitamins stay intact (unlike commercially produced butter). Ghee is full of Omega-3 and Omega-9 fatty acids; it's also one of the best sources of conjugated linoleic acid
post_date_gmt: which has anti-cancer properties. Since the milk proteins are removed from ghee
post_content: many individuals with dairy sensitivities find that they can tolerate it well
post_title: making it the perfect substitute for our gluten-free banana bread recipe!

ID: We've created a slight twist by adding raw cacao to the mix. This gives our gluten-free banana bread a rich chocolate flavor
post_author: so you'll feel like you're eating dessert! The antioxidant levels in cacao are incredibly high — 40 times higher than blueberries
post_date: in fact. It's also rich in iron
post_date_gmt: making it an excellent dietary addition for vegans and vegetarians who don't consume iron-rich animal products. You'll find more calcium in cacao than in dairy milk
post_content: which is good for preventing osteoporosis and helpful for growing children and teens. And cacao also has calming properties
post_title: since it's so rich in magnesium
post_excerpt: which is often touted as the \"relaxation mineral\" since it helps steady nerves
comment_status: and may help people with insomnia.

ID: 1/2 cup coconut palm sugar or maple syrup

Peanut allergy has become a more widespread and serious health issue in recent years. In fact
post_title: the incidence of peanut allergy among American children has increased 21 percent in the last seven years
post_excerpt: according to a new report.

post_author: Dr. Tania Elliott
post_date: recently appeared on \"Good Morning America\" to discuss the spike in peanut allergy diagnoses and how new research indicates that the best way to prevent peanut allergy may be to introduce peanuts to children at a younger age.

post_author: \"Parents were told not to introduce peanuts to kids until they were over the age of two. So when you wait that long
post_date: and all of a sudden the immune system is exposed to something brand new
post_content: 'This is something foreign
post_title: ' and it develops an allergic response to it.\"

ID: She then referred to a compelling new study of children at high risk for developing peanut allergy. In the study
post_author: half of the subjects were exposed to peanuts at an earlier age
post_date: while the other half were first given peanuts after the traditional two-year delay. It turned out that while 17 percent of the children in the delayed group developed a peanut allergy
post_date_gmt: only 2 percent of the children in the early exposure group did.

post_author: new medical guidelines support the \"early introduction\" approach with children and peanuts. And while nothing fully guarantees peanut allergy prevention
post_date: it does appear to lower the chances of developing the common allergy.

ID: Watch the video of Dr. Elliott on \"Good Morning America\" below:

Gluten-free stuffing is becoming more mainstream as more people give up gluten. Some individuals (like those with celiac disease) can get very sick if they eat it. Other people may have more mild intolerances or sensitivities to gluten. Others go gluten-free because they find it keeps their skin more clear
post_excerpt: gives them more energy
post_status: and is otherwise a positive for their health.

ID: Gluten refers to the glutenin and gliadin proteins found in any wheat
post_author: rye
post_date: or barley products. It's responsible for the sticky texture of wheat-based dough
post_date_gmt: and gives bread the chewy texture that we all love. People with celiac disease can't process gluten
post_content: which activates their immune response. This leads the body to attack not only the gluten
post_excerpt: causing horrible stomach cramping and longer-term consequences.

ID: Some without celiac disease experience intolerance on a milder scale
post_author: with bloating
post_date: stomach aches
post_content: breakouts
post_excerpt: and energy slumps. If you suspect you have an intolerance to gluten
post_status: doing an elimination diet (removing all allergins for 2-3 weeks
comment_status: then slowly adding suspected allergins one at a time) can be helpful in determining your personal response to gluten and other foods like dairy.

ID: Even if your body does tolerate gluten
post_author: try to choose organic

post_content: which makes the nutrients found in grains more accessible to the human body.

How to Practice Mindful Eating In a broad sense, mindfulness is simply taking notice of your thoughts
post_excerpt: and habits. Mindful eating means we take our time to eat
post_status: observe when we are hungry and when we feel full
comment_status: and pay attention to what we eat and where it comes from. Mindful eating means we understand that how we eat is an important consideration

ID: Here are five ways to establish mindful eating habits:
• Listen to your body. In our frenetically paced culture
post_author: we often lose track of the fundamentals of eating. Pay attention to your physical hunger signals
post_date: and observe when your body feels full. Often
post_date_gmt: we eat too rapidly and ignore when our bodies say it's time to stop. Slowing down is the best way to ensure our bodies have the chance to express nutritional needs
post_content: and it also makes eating more enjoyable.

ID: • Turn off the phone and TV. Make your personal and family meals as distraction-free as possible. Try to eat at the same established times each day. Make space for some quiet time at the dinner table. Keep conversation as gentle
post_author: joyful
post_date: and stress-free as you can. If you do decide to have movie nights with dinner in front of the TV
post_content: and perhaps only on weekends.

ID: • Savor your food. Pay attention to all the things you love about your meal — the textures
post_author: colors
post_date: and flavors. Allow yourself to focus t0tally on the experience. Slow down
post_content: and give yourself the time to fully enjoy your food. Not only will your pleasure in eating increase
post_title: you will digest and assimilate your meal better

ID: • Know your food and where it comes from. Choose the highest quality fresh and natural foods you can afford. Engage yourself in the meal-making process. Do you know who grew your food and where it originated? Maybe you can find a local market or bakery where you interact with the people who supply your ingredients. A simple appreciation for the food you eat can increase your enjoyment exponentially. And the more mindful you are about the quality of foods you and your family eat (and where they come from)
post_author: the more likely you are to make better choices.

ID: • Balance food as comfort with nutritional needs. Sometimes we eat to fulfill emotional needs
post_author: rather than considering the quality or nutritional value of our meal. Healthy
post_date: natural foods can be prepared in ways that provide plenty of enjoyment and comfort without sacrificing nutrition. Mindful eating leads you to eat what you want
post_date_gmt: but in a higher quality and cleaner way. The more fresh foods you eat
post_content: the better they will taste to you.

post_author: we train ourselves to pay closer attention to our bodies' real needs. The process of cooking and eating should be a pleasure — but it also needs to be nourishing. The more deliberate and conscious we are
post_date: the more we get out of it.

Overeating is a persistent, year-round problem for many people, but it's particularly dangerous as we enter the holiday season and winter months, when our lives tend to get more sedentary and comfort food is more prevalent. We may find our cravings for carbohydrate-rich foods and sweets increasing
post_title: and if we struggle with seasonal affective disorder (SAD)
post_excerpt: those impulses can intensify.

ID: As the days darken and the holidays approach
post_author: how can we keep our eating under control? Here are some tips for navigating the temptation to binge.

ID: Overeating taxes the body and digestive system. It can thwart efforts to keep weight within a healthy range. With the all-too-pervasive trend of the “super-sized” meal
post_author: all-you-can-eat buffets
post_date: and exaggerated “single serving” portions of chips
post_content: and candy bars
post_title: we tend to lose sight of what healthy eating actually looks like. Portion control is about eating the right amount for your body at a given time in order to optimize digestion and keep healthy.

ID: By learning to listen to our bodies and adopting a mindful approach to eating
post_author: we can more accurately assess signals of hunger and satiation. Overeating is often tied to unmet emotional needs
post_date: too much stress
post_date_gmt: or other moments when we seek comfort. Typically
post_content: these foods are high in salt
post_excerpt: and sugar
post_status: which tend to trigger the urge to overeat.

ID: Indulging every now and then is fine. After all
post_author: eating delicious food is a pleasure. But regularly eating to excess
post_date: especially with nutritionally empty food
post_date_gmt: is a short-term solution to unresolved stress or distress. This is especially common during the holidays
post_content: when family and financial tensions may be high. Learn to slow down
post_excerpt: and pay attention to how you feel when you eat.

ID: What Does a Healthy Portion Look Like?
Be (very) wary of the super-sizing trend. Even the muffins and bagels at your local coffee shop may be surprisingly high in calories and sugar
post_author: and super-sized sodas and fast food meals are
post_date: quite simply
post_date_gmt: dangerous for your health. Consider that you may need to reorient your idea of what a normal
post_content: healthy portion of food looks like:

ID: • medium potato — the size of a computer mouse

post_author: whole grains
post_date: or mashed potatoes — the size of half a baseball

ID: • whole grain muffin — the size of a tennis ball
• 8 oz portion of meat — the size of a thin paperback book
• 3 oz portion of meat — the size of a deck of cards (this is the recommended portion for one meal)
One rule of thumb for creating a balanced plate is to fill half of it with leafy greens and vegetables
post_author: a quarter with your protein of choice
post_date: and the remaining quarter with a starchy carbohydrate. (Of course

ID: Whether you have a family party
post_author: office gathering
post_date: or holiday dinner to attend
post_date_gmt: make it a point to curb your hunger beforehand with a light snack. That way
post_content: you can enjoy the festivities and indulge (a little)
post_title: without overdoing things. Healthy snacks include things like half of a cup of almonds and one piece of fruit
post_excerpt: one sliced apple with two tablespoons of your favorite nut butter
post_status: or a few slices of organic cheese.

ID: Remember that when you eat out
post_author: you are typically being served at least twice as much as your body needs for any given meal. If possible
post_date: avoid large or super-sized portions. Opt for a salad at your favorite restaurant
post_date_gmt: and share an entree with a friend. Or you can eat half your meal
post_content: and take the remaining portion home for lunch the next day. Also
post_title: drink pure or sparkling water instead of sodas. Limit your intake of alcoholic beverages — or better yet
post_excerpt: avoid them entirely.

post_author: Don’t Overdo it

ID: Taking care of your body and watching your portions means you can enjoy some dark chocolate
post_author: a glass of wine
post_date: or a scoop of your favorite ice cream now and then. If you make treats totally off limits
post_date_gmt: or adhere to overly strict dieting standards (especially during the holidays)
post_content: you run the risk of a deprivation-induced binge. The holiday season tends to add to our already heavy stress loads
post_excerpt: but make your health a priority. Stick to a fitness program
post_status: and load up on healthy foods
ping_status: and fresh fruits and vegetables every day.

ID: If health cultivation and maintenance is your default personal setting
post_author: you have leeway to enjoy yourself with friends and family
post_date: without overeating and hindering your health and fitness efforts. So have a homemade cookie
post_date_gmt: or share a small dessert with your dinner companion. Savor it
post_content: enjoy it

You’ve probably heard that sleepiness after Thanksgiving dinner is the result of something called tryptophan in turkey. But what is tryptophan, and what effects, if any, does it really have on your body? What is Tryptophan? It's an essential amino acid found in many foods. Amino acids are the building blocks of proteins. The body can’t manufacture tryptophan
post_title: so we need to get it from our diets. Turkey is among those foods high in tryptophan
post_excerpt: although it's also found in other poultry
to_ping: and yogurt. Foods that are naturally high in protein also tend to contain the highest levels of tryptophan.

ID: But there's a bit of a myth at work when it comes to the turkey-tryptophan connection. Chicken actually contains more tryptophan than turkey
post_author: and even though Americans consume chicken in far greater quantities over the course of the year
post_date: most people only associate it with Thanksgiving turkey.

ID: Tryptophan is used by the body to create niacin
post_author: a B vitamin which plays a key role in the production of serotonin
post_date: a neurotransmitter associated with healthy sleep and feelings of wellbeing
post_content: a hormone that regulates your sleep/wake cycles. In and of itself
post_excerpt: tryptophan doesn’t immediately impact serotonin levels; it is just one of many amino acids competing for transport across the blood-brain barrier. Being a bulkier amino acid
post_status: it doesn’t so easily make it to the brain without help.

ID: The key lies in carbohydrates. When we eat them
post_author: our bodies release a surge of insulin
post_date: which clears the bloodstream of all amino acids — except tryptophan. When competing amino acids are removed from the bloodstream
post_date_gmt: tryptophan gets a straight shot to the brain
post_content: which boosts serotonin levels.

ID: So why do people feel tired after their Thanksgiving meal? It probably has more to do with the heavy carbohydrate load than the turkey itself. Thanksgiving is also a time when many of us tend to overeat
post_author: and when we do
post_date: the digestive process is overtaxed
post_date_gmt: which also contributes to sleepiness. Throw a glass of wine or some alcohol into the mix
post_content: and we are definitely ready to nap once the family feast concludes.

ID: Is Too Much Tryptophan Bad for You?
While we need it to live
post_author: consuming too much can have negative effects. Foods high in tryptophan are also high in protein
post_date: and many Americans already eat too much protein — especially from animal sources. Studies show that low-tryptophan diets lead to longer lifespans in rats
post_date_gmt: while too much causes insulin resistance and organ damage in pigs. Tryptophan supplements and medications are available as potential sleep aids (though their effectiveness is unclear) and antidepressants
post_content: but more research into their health benefits and risks is needed. It would be advisable to discuss the use of these supplements with your physician.

EHE's Chief Medical Officer, Dr. Tania Elliott
post_title: is the lead author of new guidelines on the use of telemedicine for allergists

ID: As technology facilitates the rise of virtual visits
post_author: allowing doctors to connect with patients remotely
post_date: the way they communicate in this new context is vitally important. As Dr. Elliott explains
post_date_gmt: \"We are looking for ways to leverage technology to improve access to top quality medical care and maximize the patient experience. We want to preserve the doctor-patient relationship while translating bedside manner to 'webside manner.'\"

ID: Telemedicine is an incredible development in terms of access and convenience. As Dr. Elliott notes
post_author: it will also be a critical tool in offsetting an expected shortage of physicians in the coming years. The key is to ensure that allergists (and all physicians) give patients the same high level of care they would in a traditional setting. These new guidelines will help to update high standards of bedside manner for new modes of doctor-patient interaction.

ID: Forbes has a full report on Dr. Elliott's ACAAI presentation."

Sleep hygiene is a topic that comes up often because it's so important. It essentially refers to a set of strategies or habits that promote good sleep. Getting a full night’s sleep
post_excerpt: is one of the most powerful ways to reduce stress and improve your health. Poor sleep can dramatically diminish your quality of life
post_status: and if you regularly skimp on rest
comment_status: you are at risk for a host of physical and mental health conditions

ID: Sleep disturbances and mental health issues are closely linked. Dysfunctional sleep patterns are particularly common in patients with depression
post_author: bipolar disorder
post_date: anxiety
post_date_gmt: and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). Clinicians have traditionally viewed sleep problems like insomnia and hypersomnia as symptoms of mental health disorders.; But research now suggests that disrupted sleep may directly contribute to — and certainly exacerbates — the development of mental illnesses. That's why good sleep hygiene is critical.

ID: • Maintain a regular sleep/wake cycle: Aim to keep your schedule the same each night of the week. Sleep regularity is a huge part of sleep hygiene. Go to bed and wake up at the same time
post_author: every day
post_date: give or take 20 minutes.

post_author: caffeine
post_date: and nicotine: Stimulants should be avoided for four to six hours before bedtime. Alcohol may make you feel sleepy at first
post_date_gmt: but it acts as a stimulant after your body metabolizes it.

ID: • Get regular exercise: Regular exercise reduces stress
post_author: depression
post_date: and anxiety
post_date_gmt: and can help you sleep more soundly. Physical activity helps us feel tired
post_content: making sleep easier. That said
post_title: exercising too close to bedtime is not recommended. Get your workout in at least three hours before trying to sleep. Better yet
post_excerpt: exercise earlier in the day
comment_status: especially if you're able to do so at the same time daily.

ID: • Eat healthy foods that promote good sleep: Refined and processed carbs
post_author: poor quality fats
post_date: and spicy foods tend to contribute to indigestion and acid reflux
post_date_gmt: and often interfere with a good night’s rest. Eat a balanced
post_content: whole foods diet with an emphasis on high quality protein
post_excerpt: complex carbohydrates
comment_status: avoid heavy meals close to bedtime.

ID: • Balance your liquid intake: Be sure to stay well hydrated during the day
post_author: and drink plenty of pure water. Limit fluids before bed
post_date: though
post_date_gmt: so you’re not losing sleep to middle-of-the-night bathroom trips.

ID: • Establish a comforting pre-sleep routine: Make it a habit to wind down and relax before bed. Give yourself at least an hour before turning in
post_author: and engage in soothing activities: meditate
post_date: read a book
post_content: or engage in relaxation exercises. Avoid stressful news
post_excerpt: intense conversations

ID: • Get exposure to natural light: Natural light helps set our circadian clocks to a healthy sleep schedule. Let light in first thing in the morning
post_author: and spend some time outdoors each day.
comfortable bedroom: Keep work materials
post_date: televisions
post_content: and devices out of the bedroom as much as possible. Create an atmosphere that is peaceful and conducive to rest. A cool
post_excerpt: dark environment is best for quality sleep. Invest in a quality mattress
post_status: as well as blankets and pillows. Install blackout curtains
ping_status: and utilize ear plugs or a white noise machine as needed.

ID: Sleep hygiene is more important to overall health than many people realize. Make sure you're getting sufficient quality rest for your mind and body
post_author: every night.

It's important to recognize flu symptoms during this time of year. We're deep into flu season, in the midst of holidays that have us traveling, and spending more time than usual (perhaps) with the small children and elderly in our extended families. Of course, it's recommended to be vaccinated against influenza to improve your chances of avoiding flu symptoms altogether. Influenza is a communicable virus which causes mild to severe illness
post_title: and it can affect both the upper and lower respiratory tracts. Many people mistake the flu for a severe cold. But while they share some symptoms
post_excerpt: the flu is usually more serious and enduring. Detecting flu symptoms early can help prevent the spread of the virus. Additionally
post_status: prompt treatment can keep the illness from becoming worse.

ID: Early signs of the flu include:
• Vomiting or gastrointestinal distress (more common in children)
Children may present with the above symptoms
post_author: but they sometimes have additional complications that may require medical treatment. These include:
a cold and flu can look similar. But if a fever is present
post_date: and symptoms are severe
post_date_gmt: it is probably the flu. If you have any concerns about your child’s symptoms
post_content: or if they worsen

ID: Flu symptoms sometimes worsen before they improve
post_author: and the severity of the illness depends on the overall state of your health. People respond differently to a virus
post_date: with some fighting it off more efficiently. If the following symptoms appear

ID: Recovery from the flu usually occurs in one to two weeks — but complications can happen. Certain populations tend to be more vulnerable to these complications
post_author: including children
post_date: those over age 65
post_content: and individuals with certain chronic medical conditions or lowered immunity. Sinus infections
post_excerpt: and bronchitis are examples of flu-related complications. The flu can also exacerbate existing health problems
ping_status: and chronic lung disease. For those at high risk of complications
post_password: medical treatment and hospitalization may be necessary.

ID: If you have been diagnosed with the flu
post_author: it is important to allow yourself an adequate recovery period. You should not return to work or school until you have been fever-free for at least 24 hours
post_date: without medication. If your fever has broken but other symptoms persist
post_date_gmt: it is best to stay home until these symptoms also improve. Once you can resume normal activities without exhaustion
post_content: you can return to work and your typical routine. After recovery
post_title: a lingering cough or some fatigue may persist for a few weeks; see your doctor if you begin to relapse
post_excerpt: or if symptoms worsen again after your initial recovery.

post_author: while not guaranteed to prevent the illness
post_date: is by far the best preventive course of action. The flu spreads through saliva droplets when an infected person coughs or sneezes. These droplets can reach people and surfaces up to 6 feet away. It is important to take steps to protect yourself and those you love from infection during virus season. In terms of other basic recommendations to avoid contracting — or further spreading — the flu
post_date_gmt: be sure to follow this protocol:

post_author: especially if fever is present

ID: <li>Covering your cough the right way (cough into the crook of your elbow
post_author: and not your hands)

ID: • Touching your mouth and nose as little as possible
"
post_author: Flu Symptoms You Need to Know
post_content: open
Why the Flu Shot Matters The flu shot is the most effective preventive measure when it comes to avoiding influenza, which has unpleasant symptoms and can present serious complications. The virus
post_excerpt: can infect a person’s lungs
comment_status: and throat. Gastrointestinal symptoms may also occur

post_author: peaks during the winter months
post_date: and ends around May. The flu is highly contagious
post_date_gmt: and it can be severe. Even healthy people sometimes develop complications
post_content: such as pneumonia or bronchitis. Certain populations are especially vulnerable
post_title: and medical care and hospitalization are necessary in some cases.

ID: That's why the flu shot is so critical for both individual and communal prevention. The CDC recommends an annual vaccination for everyone six months of age or older. There are certain exceptions for individuals with allergies to the vaccine or its components. If you have ever had Guillain-Barre Syndrome (GBS)
post_author: your doctor may advise against the flu shot. If your immunity is compromised or you are not feeling well
post_date: speak to your doctor before receiving the flu vaccine. Also note that different flu shots have specific age indications; speak with your doctor about which shot is your best choice.

ID: It's best to have the flu shot administered when flu season begins in October. Obviously
post_author: the sooner
post_date: the better. But people who have not been vaccinated often forget about it once the initial media and workplace attention to flu shots dies down. It's not too late to receive a flu shot in November
post_content: and beyond. It's only \"too late\" once you contract the flu. Just know that after vaccination
post_title: it takes about two weeks for protective antibodies to develop in the body.

ID: Types of Flu Vaccination and Possible Side Effects
The flu vaccine will not give you the flu
post_author: contrary to a popular myth. But side effects can occur.

ID: Flu shot: The viruses in the flu shot are inactivated (killed)
post_author: so you cannot get the flu from the flu shot. Potential side effects include:
soreness
post_date: and/or swelling at the site of the shot

ID: Nasal spray: The viruses in the nasal spray are not inactivated
post_author: but they are sufficiently weakened to ensure you can’t develop the flu from it. Side effects in children may include:

ID: Side effects in adults can include:
The flu vaccine is primarily recommended as an injection
post_author: as it is more effective. The shot is usually given through a muscle in the arm. For those between 18 and 64 years of age
post_date: an intradermal (in-the-skin) vaccine is an option
post_date_gmt: or a jet injector device is also available
post_content: in which the vaccine is delivered via a high-pressure
post_title: narrow stream of fluid instead of a needle.

post_author: it is usually soon after the vaccination. Symptoms are mild and brief. Occasionally
post_date: individuals do have more severe reactions
post_date_gmt: particularly if they are allergic. If you are concerned about your reactions
post_content: contact your doctor immediately.

Holiday gifts can be hard to choose, but presents that support a healthy lifestyle are never a bad choice. Whether you're looking for gifts to give your family, friends, coworkers, or anyone on your \Secret Santa\" list
post_title: there are a number of great
post_excerpt: affordable ideas that promote wellness. We're all about building healthy habits here
post_status: so we've mostly selected holiday gifts that can become part of your daily routine all year long.

ID: • Sunlight desk lamp - As the days get shorter
post_author: seasonal affective disorder and other types of depression may become pronounced. By mimicking natural sunlight
post_date: these lamps can help banish the blues all winter. They're stylish
post_content: and can even boost production of serotonin and vitamin D during the months when you're missing healthy sun exposure.

ID: • Portable blender - Blenders are critical for lots of healthy recipes
post_author: but they're perhaps most useful when it comes to making quick-and-easy
post_date: nutritious smoothies with a variety of greens
post_content: and veggies. Single serving portable blenders with their own to-go cups make blending up your favorite concoctions before work or the gym a breeze.

post_author: filtered water bottles - Staying hydrated (with pure water) is vitally important
post_date: whether you're working out or just going through your day. Having a stainless steel bottle by your side winds up helping in a variety of ways. It reminds you to keep drinking (roughly 64 ounces per day for the average adult)
post_date_gmt: avoids the waste of disposable plastic bottles
post_content: restricts exposure to BPA. Plus

ID: • CSA membership - Community supported agriculture (delivered to your door) is a fantastic way to help local farms and eat a variety of fresh produce. Subscriptions vary but can be a lot more affordable than you may think!
• Healthy cookbooks - While cookbooks may seem like a boring and obvious choice
post_author: there's never been a more exciting variety of options
post_date: no matter your recipient's dietary restrictions
post_content: or specific food interests. Cookbooks are great for inspiration
post_title: and for guiding new home cooks who lack skills or confidence in the kitchen. For the experienced healthy foodie
post_excerpt: a new cookbook can offer fresh ideas - keeping nutritious meals appealing and exciting.

post_author: floor exercises
post_date: or physical therapy
post_date_gmt: these comfortable and easy-to-clean rollers are excellent and versatile accessories for wellness.

post_author: for anyone in your life who's either a hardcore practitioner or just getting into it
post_date: yoga mats are a wonderful gift. They come in all types of styles
post_content: and are great for the yogi-on-the-go.

ID: • Herb mill - Great for easily adding fresh flavors to foods when cutting back on added salt and cooking fats
post_author: this handy kitchen gadget minces fresh herbs with the flick of a wrist.

ID: • Healthy gift baskets - Instead of giving sugar-rich candies or cakes as gifts
post_author: try gift baskets filled with fresh and dried fruits
post_date: herbal teas
post_content: air-popped popcorn
post_excerpt: and low-sugar dark chocolate.

post_author: health club
post_date: or yoga class memberships - You can also give gift certificates or memberships for a local pilates studio
post_content: or massages.

ID: • Adult lunch boxes - Meal prep isn't just a cost-saver — it also helps to keep people on track nutritionally
post_author: all week long. And with a cool-looking lunch box
post_date: who wouldn't want to bring in their own meals from home? (Plus
post_date_gmt: brown bagging is so wasteful!) There are plenty of sleek designs in bright colors that keep food healthy and fun
post_content: even for the grownups in your life.

ID: • Sleeping mask - We're passionate advocates for proper sleep hygiene
post_author: and a major part of sleeping well is creating a dark environment. If someone in your life has trouble getting the bedroom sufficiently dark
post_date: a quality mask can be a game-changer.

ID: • Food steamer - Steaming vegetables is a great way to cook them without sacrificing any of their nutrients. You can get a handy digital food steamer for anyone in need of a simpler
post_author: more healthy cooking regimen.
stress-reducing gift sure to delight the recipient
post_date: get a simple scent diffuser and a set of essential oils.

ID: • Wearables - Fitness tracking devices (especially Fitbits or Apple Watches) are going to be pricier than most of the holiday gifts on this list... but they're well worth the investment if you know someone who needs daily (or even hourly) encouragement and monitoring to meet health goals.
Holiday gifts that promote healthy lifestyles are available for nearly any budget. Fun
post_author: frivolous things can be great holiday gifts
post_date: too! But these wellness-oriented suggestions (and many others) are designed to support the long-term health of the people you care about most. Here's to ending the year with what everyone needs for an even healthier 2018!

Holiday stress is real. After all, the season can be a complicated time. While we may look forward to winter vacations, beloved family traditions, fun parties, and extended visits with close friends, the holidays can also be a period of increased anxiety and depression. You may face family tensions. You may find your budget overextended or your schedule overloaded. Any number of factors could make the time feel more frenzied than festive.

post_author: meditation
post_date: relaxation therapy
post_date_gmt: and proper sleep hygiene can all be excellent stress reducers. But there are also ways to minimize holiday stress
post_content: specifically. Here are some of them.

ID: • Relax your expectations. The holidays don’t have to be perfect. You don't have to be perfect during them. Focus on the quality of the time you spend with friends and family. Don’t overemphasize materials
post_author: whether presents or decorations. Exchanging gifts should be pleasurable; try to keep things simple
post_date: meaningful
post_date_gmt: and affordable. Prioritize what matters most!

ID: • Avoid overspending. Set a budget for your holiday expenses and gift giving... and then stick to it! A lot of holiday stress has to do with financial pressure
post_author: and while you may want to be generous
post_date: you can still control your spending. Take a look at your bills
post_date_gmt: and set a realistic amount you can afford. Your holiday expenditures should not interfere with your ability to pay for essentials
post_content: and they should not result in overwhelming credit card debt that will haunt you as soon as the new year begins.

ID: • Don’t overextend. Keep your commitments realistic. What can you do without sacrificing adequate rest
post_author: exercise
post_date: and self-care? Fatigue from undersleeping and overexertion can contribute to depression and anxiety. Don’t take on such a burden that you are unable to enjoy the most important part of the season: time with loved ones and family.

ID: • Take in the good. Psychologist and author Rick Hanson calls noticing and absorbing good experiences “taking in the good
post_author: \" and it's an approach we often don't take when things get hectic. When you have a positive thought
post_date: experience
post_content: take the time to savor it. Learn to dwell on the positive. Negative emotions and experiences are unavoidable
post_title: but by learning to emphasize the good in your life
post_excerpt: you train your brain to reinforce more positive thinking patterns. In doing so

ID: • Eat healthy foods and stay active. It’s normal to want to rest and indulge in treats during the holidays. Don’t overdo it
post_author: though! Take a brisk walk either before or after a big meal
post_date: and make time for exercise. Stay hydrated with pure water
post_date_gmt: and emphasize fresh fruits and vegetables. Too many sweets and rich foods can negatively impact the immune system
post_content: so stay focused on eating well as much as possible and indulging with some moderation. Better yet
post_title: learn to upgrade your traditional favorites with healthier versions: check out some truly amazing whole foods recipes here.

ID: • Take breaks. Family relationships can be complicated. If tensions arise
post_author: or if a particular family member makes things challenging
post_date: take some time for yourself. Go get some exercise
post_content: or meditate. We can’t control the behaviors of others
post_title: but we can control how we respond to stress.

ID: • Acknowledge your feelings. If you have experienced past trauma
post_author: recently lost someone you love
post_date: or are feeling isolated during the holidays
post_date_gmt: it is normal to experience sadness or grief -- especially during the holiday season. You are not alone if you aren’t feeling so great during the festive season. It’s OK to cry
post_content: grieve
post_title: or opt out altogether. Take care of yourself. If you need support
post_excerpt: reach out. Call a trusted friend
comment_status: or even a crisis hotline if depression sets in. If you are feeling alone
ping_status: try volunteering your time to connect with others in a positive way. You can also join a support group or take a new class to meet others with common interests and life experiences.

ID: Unchecked holiday stress could lead to physical ailments that put a real damper on the season. The most important thing is to be mindful of how you feel so you can regulate your stress response as quickly and fully as possible. Learn to say no to anything that puts too much pressure on you. Eat well
post_author: get adequate sleep
post_date: and keep exercising. Simplify where you need to
post_content: and instead focus on what's most meaningful: family connectedness
post_excerpt: self-care
post_status: and creating positive memories to carry with you into the new year. It may sound hokey
comment_status: but it's an excellent way of avoiding holiday stress and preserving emotional wellness!

The holidays are a time to eat
post_excerpt: and be merry. But that doesn't mean you have to sacrifice all of the healthy habits you're trying to keep! Holiday cocktails can be healthy (or
ping_status: as long as you give some thought to the ingredients ahead of time.

ID: We've come up with a few modified recipes for holiday cocktails (including one that's easily turned into an alcohol-free \"mocktail\")
post_author: each of which offers some nice health benefits along with the usual seasonal cheer.
healthy holiday cocktails apiece unless otherwise indicated.
of course
post_date: please drink responsibly!

ID: Want to add some lush color to your cocktail offerings? How about some critical nutrients and powerful preventive health benefits? Pomegranate juice has anti-inflammatory properties
post_author: comes packed with antioxidants
post_date: and contains polyphenols shown to counteract prostate and breast cancers. The fruit is also good for your heart
post_date_gmt: with research showing that it can help lower blood pressure and reduce plaque in the carotid artery. (How's that for a holiday gift?) Pomegranate juice is also a good source of vitamins C and E
post_content: as well as potassium. That all makes these sparkling holiday cocktails an exciting option for you and your loved ones.

ID: eight ounces of pomegranate juice (be sure to get 100% juice with no added sugar)
four ounces of fruit liqueur (such as Curacao or Grand Marnier)
four teaspoons of lime juice (or lime wedges)
several sprigs of mint (if so desired)
Sprinkle pomegranate seeds into Champagne flutes
post_author: followed by the pomegranate juice and your chosen liqueur. Add lime and then pour the chilled sparkling wine. Top off with mint and enjoy!

ID: Eggnog is among the most polarizing holiday drinks
post_author: so even if it's not your favorite
post_date: there's a good chance someone at your party may ask
post_content: where's the nog?\" One major problem with traditional eggnog in modern times? Lots of people are going off dairy. Fortunately
post_title: we have a solution. This dairy-free eggnog recipe is just as delicious as the standard version
post_excerpt: but substitutes almond milk and coconut milk for the cow milk your guests may be trying to avoid. And it couldn't be any simpler to make!

ID: one cup of pure maple syrup
two teaspoons of pure vanilla extract
Combine all ingredients (except nutmeg) in a blender. Blend for approximately two minutes. Egg yolks should be fully processed. Chill in refrigerator until ready to serve
post_author: then pour and top with nutmeg.

ID: It's hard to find anything more comforting on a chilly winter's night than this classic drink
post_author: whether you include alcohol or not! In fact
post_date: one of the best things about a hot toddy is that it can be tailored for almost any taste — since the tea and cider varieties are up to you — and still be great. This version includes ginger
post_content: boosts immune function
post_title: and has been shown to have a positive impact on everything from cholesterol to respiration to reducing nausea. If you make yours with green tea
post_excerpt: you'll also get the benefit of polyphenols.

ID: two cups of warm apple cider
one shot of your preferred whiskey (optional)
Heat mug of cider and steep tea bag for five minutes. Mix in ginger and honey. Add booze. Stir with cinnamon stick. Top with slice of lemon. Enjoy!

post_author: fruit-filled crowdpleaser features the many health benefits of apples (they help in the fight against cardiovascular disease
post_date: contain antioxidants and soluble fiber)
post_content: flavonoids
post_excerpt: and the often overlooked nutritional advantages of white wine.

ID: two cups of preferred citrus fruit
one cup of frozen tropical fruit (like mango)
This one is especially easy. Just cut up the fruit
post_author: add to a pitcher of white wine
post_date: refrigerate overnight

Hydration is essential to good health. It's also something a lot of people overlook. If you're not paying attention and keeping good hydration habits
post_title: you may not be drinking sufficient water. If so
post_excerpt: dehydration symptoms could sneak up on you.

ID: An individual's personal water requirements vary due to a range of factors
post_author: but adults are typically advised to aim for about two liters (or 64 ounces) of daily consumption. Once your body signals thirst
post_date: you are already mildly dehydrated. Other low-level dehydration symptoms can include fatigue
post_content: crankiness
post_title: and headaches. The body and brain are both susceptible to dehydration symptoms.

ID: Our brains depend on adequate hydration to function well. Even minimal dehydration can create problems as brain tissue loses fluid
post_author: reducing brain volume and affecting cell activity. This negatively impacts your mood
post_date: memory
post_date_gmt: and attention span. Dehydration can also affect both short-term and long-term memory recall. Simple math becomes more difficult
post_content: and you may experience headaches
post_excerpt: and grogginess. The brain is sensitive to even small changes in the body’s water content.

ID: • Dehydration means extra work for your heart. Blood volume decreases during dehydration
post_author: but the heart must maintain adequate blood flow to your organs and muscles. To maintain stable blood pressure with less blood
post_date: your heart exerts more and vessels constrict. This could lead you to experience aches and pains.

ID: • Your skin dries out. Dehydrated skin becomes parched and sometimes looks flushed. It may “tent up” when pinched
post_author: indicating a loss in hydration and elasticity.

ID: • You may get migraines and headaches. Just as dehydration causes body aches
post_author: so too does it contribute to headaches and even migraines. Sometimes the simplest remedy is a full glass of water.
especially cravings for sweets
post_date: may kick in. When dehydrated
post_date_gmt: you may have hunger cravings when the body actually needs is water. All of your organs rely on hydration for optimal function. They may struggle to release adequate energy stores such as glucose (glycogen) when you are dehydrated. This can result in intense cravings for food
post_content: and sweets in particular
post_title: which will not satisfy your immediate water needs.

ID: • You may get a fever and chills. If your level of dehydration becomes severe
post_author: fever and chills may set in (fever can also exacerbate existing dehydration). The higher your fever
post_date: the higher the risk for more severe systemic dehydration. In infants and children
post_content: especially if vomiting or diarrhea are occurring. Be sure to seek medical attention if you are dehydrated and experiencing a fever over 103 degrees.

ID: Hydration starts with drinking pure water throughout the day. Hydrating foods help
post_author: but you still need to drink enough water. Check out this daily water intake calculator here to see more personalized guidelines.

ID: • Drink a large glass of water first thing in the morning.
• Keep a water bottle with you throughout the day.

post_author: lime
post_date: or a little juice to your water if you don’t love the taste.

post_author: during
post_date: and after exercise.

ID: • Eat plentiful amounts of fresh fruits and vegetables.
Remember to listen to your body to detect dehydration symptoms. If you are feeling thirsty
post_author: or if you have been exercising and sweating profusely
post_date: be sure to drink more water. Make it a habit to stay well-hydrated throughout the day
post_date_gmt: and maintain a consistent intake of hydrating foods such as fresh fruits
post_content: vegetables

Stress relief is critical. In our frenetic modern world, stress is a near constant fact of life for many. Between the demands of work life, personal life, and distressing world events, the need for stress relief products and methods is at an all-time high. Learning to manage stress effectively is vital to positive long-term health outcomes
post_title: both mental and physical. That's why it's so important to find a few tools to weave into your daily routine
post_excerpt: so you can mitigate the impact of stress on your body and mind.

ID: Stress relief toys and gadgets come in a variety of styles
post_author: and are designed to calm your mind and nervous system by distracting you from stressful situations.

ID: • Fidget Toys - Fidgets are tactile self-regulation toys like slime balls
post_author: spinner toys
post_date: and squishy cubes and balls. These increase sensory awareness of your fingers
post_content: and promote better concentration.

ID: • Stress Balls - These are small balls made of gel or soft clay that fit comfortably in the palm of your hand. Stress balls encourage good blood circulation
post_author: and as you repetitively squeeze them
post_date: stress
post_content: and other negative emotions decrease or subside. Manipulating stress balls stimulates the brain to release feel-good endorphins
post_title: which are natural sedatives and pain relievers. Stress balls also stimulate nerves in your hand which connect to the brain’s limbic region (the area of the brain associated with emotions)
post_excerpt: promoting feelings of calm and relaxation.

ID: • Dammit Dolls - This doll for grownups is designed to vent your frustrations and will withstand endless banging on your desk. Dammit dolls are great for a laugh
post_author: and lightening things up at work.

ID: • Magnetic Sculpture Desk Toys - These tactile sculptures sit on your desk
post_author: allowing you to fidget in order to relieve stress and think more creatively.

ID: • Desktop Zen Garden - These small replicas of traditional Japanese meditative gardens come with small rakes and brooms to drag through the sand. Making patterns calms your mind
post_author: and helps reduce stress and anxiety.

ID: In addition to stress relieving toys
post_author: there are many simple and easy ways to self-regulate throughout the day.

ID: • Learn to meditate - Meditation is a powerful way to relieve the physical and mental strain of cumulative and chronic stress. Meditation offers many benefits
post_author: and even five minutes a day can reduce anxiety and stress.
camomile
post_date: passion flower
post_content: rose
post_title: and green tea (among others) all contain stress relief compounds that will help soothe and calm your system.

ID: • Check out some apps - Apps are a great tool for accessing meditations and stress-reducing exercises. Calm
post_author: Mindfulness
post_date: Headspace

ID: • Practice good sleep hygiene - Sleep hygiene is a set of habits and practices conducive to a good night’s sleep. Quality sleep on a regular basis is a cornerstone of maintaining sound mental and physical health. Stress resilience decreases dramatically when sleep is compromised. Sleep hygiene helps us sync up with our natural circadian rhythms
post_author: so we rest deeply at night
post_date: and have ample energy during the day.

post_author: vigorous exercise is one of the best ways to relieve stress
post_date: shore up our overall health
post_date_gmt: and sleep more deeply at night. Pick a routine
post_content: workout plan
post_excerpt: and commit to it.

ID: Remember that while stress is normal
post_author: and can even be useful when moderate
post_date: chronic stress wears us down. Stress relief is part of basic wellness. We must regulate our stress in order to keep our mental and physical health in balance. The more you commit to your health by eating well
post_content: and choosing activities and tools that help you manage your stress response
post_title: the stronger your daily health will be.

Giving up sugar can leave us feeling deprived and as though we'll never eat dessert again. But this recipe for sugar-free peanut butter cookies is proof that cutting out most sugar doesn't mean needing to give up treats altogether! These cookies taste great
post_title: and you'll feel like you're indulging... but without wrecking havoc on your system.

ID: Processed sugar adds unnecessary calories to your diet without giving you the nutrients you need. The body is not particularly interested in calories themselves. Its primary focus is getting specific nutrients. Everything from fluid balance
post_author: nerve function
post_date: metabolism
post_content: bone structure
post_title: and proper digestion all require specific macronutrients and micronutrients. When we fill our diet with nutritionally empty calories — such as sugar
post_excerpt: processed wheat
post_status: and poor quality dairy — our body continues to give us hunger signals
comment_status: since it hasn't received what it needs. This can lead to overeating and weight gain over time.

post_author: when consumed through fruit
post_date: where the micronutrients and fiber slow the release of sugar into the bloodstream
post_content: when consumed in excess in the form of processed and packaged sugars
post_excerpt: and desserts
post_status: it will be converted into glycogen and stored by the liver. For individuals who chronically overeat these foods
comment_status: the liver becomes too full of glycogen and begin to turn fructose into fat. This can lead to a condition called fatty liver and

ID: Organic stevia has been used for centuries. It is a plant with naturally sweet leaves. While the stevia plant can be grown and used in its natural form
post_author: more conveniently it has also been turned into a powder which can be found in most grocery stores. Be sure to choose 100% organic stevia to avoid other additives and chemicals some brands use in their formulas. Since it does not affect the blood sugar
post_date: stevia can be a great option for preventing metabolic syndrome
post_content: and creating steady hunger levels. Stevia also contains antioxidant properties
post_title: which helps fight inflammation in the body (whereas regular sugar actually causes inflammation in the body).

ID: *If you prefer the taste of sugar over stevia
post_author: you can replace with 1/2 cup of coconut palm sugar.

ID: How to Make Sugar-Free Peanut Butter Cookies:
Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Add all ingredients to an electric mixer and mix on high until fully combined.
<strong>Step 2: Scoop dough out in heaping tablespoons
post_author: and roll into smooth balls.

ID: Step 3: Lay balls onto parchment lined baking sheet. Use a fork to smash dough flat (the cookies will not spread while baking).
Step 4: Bake for 7-10 minutes depending on desired crispiness. Enjoy your sugar-free peanut butter cookies!

A power nap is like a reboot for your body and brain. The key is to <a href=\https://eheintl.com/how_much_sleep_is_enough/\">sleep at the right times
post_title: for the right length of time
post_excerpt: in order to optimize energy and alertness. Growing research shows that napping is a smart thing to do. In our increasingly sleep-deprived culture
post_status: napping is actually a good way to maximize rest time each day.

post_author: or if you struggle with insomnia
post_date: a well-orchestrated daytime power nap can help regulate your sleep rhythms
post_date_gmt: without compromising your quality of nighttime sleep. 85 percent of mammals are polyphasic
post_content: meaning their sleep and wakeful times cycle throughout both day and night. Most humans tend to sleep in monophasic cycles
post_title: due to centuries of social norms regarding how we organize our days. But scientists aren’t clear if such a schedule is really the best thing for our health.

ID: Many cultures still value afternoon naps
post_author: and young children and the elderly are likelier to have something closer to polyphasic rest. Regardless of whether our reliance on nighttime sleep is wise
post_date: we are a sleep-deprived world
post_content: a power nap can provide some significant health benefits.

ID: • 90 Minutes: This provides a full cycle of sleep
post_author: allowing you to reach deep sleep and REM (rapid eye movement) states. A full sleep cycle improves procedural and emotional memory
post_date: as well as creativity and overall performance. Sleeping for this length of time also helps prevent sleep inertia
post_date_gmt: making it easier to wake up.

post_author: slow wave sleep
post_date: but may not allow you to finish a full cycle
post_date_gmt: meaning that some grogginess can occur upon waking. But napping for an hour is still beneficial for restoring your muscles and refreshing your mind.

ID: • 30 Minutes: Studies show that a half-hour nap is most likely to cause grogginess
post_author: or sleep inertia
post_date: which can last up to 30 minutes after you wake. This nap’s restorative benefits can be felt after this initial transition passes.

ID: • 10 to 20 Minutes: This is the quintessential power nap
post_author: and is excellent for a boost in alertness and energy. This brief window limits you to lighter sleep states
post_date: thereby bypassing sleep inertia
post_date_gmt: and making it easier to wake up energized and ready to go.

post_author: and for how long
post_date: is key to maximizing energy while still being conducive to great nighttime sleep. If you find yourself dreaming during power naps
post_date_gmt: it can mean you are sleep-deprived and need to increase your sleeping hours at night. If you sit slightly upright during a nap
post_content: you can usually avoid too-deep sleep. Another suggestion is to rest on top of your covers with a light blanket if needed; sleeping under the covers only at nighttime is good sleep hygiene. Remember that your sleep environment counts. Try to get rest in a quiet
post_excerpt: with little light filtering in
post_status: and keep the room at a comfortable temperature.

ID: A 2008 study showed that power naps surpass caffeine when it comes to recharging motor skills
post_author: memory
post_date: and perceptual learning. Many modern companies are catching on to the impact of strategic rest by creating sleep and rest spaces in the workplace. Google
post_content: and other employers have specially designed sleep pods for their workers to catch some zzzs during the day. It makes for healthier employees
post_title: period. Naps lessen the stress response
post_excerpt: and can help regulate blood pressure and cardiovascular recovery after periods of psychological stress.

ID: Remember that timing your naps well is important to promoting great rest at night
post_author: so don’t nap for at least three to four hours before your usual bedtime. Syncing up your waking
post_date: nap
post_date_gmt: and bedtime schedules so that you are optimizing energy and alertness
post_content: while also ensuring restorative sleep at night

Energy foods are just what they sound like. These are the foods that keep you alert and active without needing to resort to caffeine or less nutritionally sound artificial boosters. The best energy foods don't just fight morning fatigue; they also keep us moving all day. In addition to practicing good sleep hygiene
post_title: one of the best and simplest ways to raise your energy levels is to mix healthy energy foods into your daily diet. Whether you suffer from a chronic fatigue condition
post_excerpt: or simply want to beat that afternoon slump
comment_status: energizing options to add to your weekly meal and snack rotation.

ID: • Peppermint increases mental alertness and lessens fatigue. Waking up to a morning cup of peppermint tea is a fantastic alternative to coffee
post_author: and is great for an afternoon energy boost. Peppermint is also a powerful digestive aid
post_date: and may even help headaches.

ID: • Water may seem like an obvious choice
post_author: but even mild dehydration can cause major energy slumps. Start your day with a large glass of water
post_date: and make sure to keep sipping throughout the day. Aim for approximately 64 ounces of pure
post_date_gmt: filtered water each and every day. And remember — the more physically active you are
post_content: the more water you'll need to keep your body adequately hydrated.

post_author: antioxidants
post_date: and vitamin C
post_date_gmt: and is one of your most reliably satisfying energy foods. Fresh bananas
post_content: oranges
post_excerpt: and berries are easy to tote around
post_status: pack as a snack or lunch
comment_status: and will give you a dose of vitamins
post_password: and good carbs for a quick energy boost.

post_author: beneficial fats
post_date: and vitamin E and omega-3s which make for a nutrient-dense energy boost that will curb hunger cravings. Nuts are easy to overeat
post_content: so keep your serving to around one ounce.

ID: • Asparagus is a high energy food rich in B vitamins. Asparagus is also a good choice since it provides a low glycemic
post_author: gradual energy release for sustained energy throughout the day.
kale
post_date: and chard are very rich in energy-promoting nutrients
post_date_gmt: as well as brain-boosting compounds like folate
post_content: calcium
post_excerpt: and beta-carotene.

post_author: which provides solid energy. Highly concentrated dark chocolate is also excellent for brain health; it's high in nutrients and antioxidants that reduce stress
post_date: while amplifying energy and mental focus.

ID: Beyond eating the right energy foods
post_author: it's important to pay attention to adequate hydration
post_date: sleep hygiene practices
post_date_gmt: and daily movement and exercise. Exercise not only tones and strengthens the body
post_content: but it releases energy-boosting endorphins
post_title: and promotes better quality sleep. If you eat right
post_excerpt: move your body
comment_status: you will maximize your energy levels and feel better than ever!

Did you get a wearable fitness tracker over the holidays? Or are you planning to dust off the one you bought last year as part of a New Year's resolution? Whatever your motivation, and whether or not you have previous fitness tracker experience, we have recommendations for how to get the most out of your wearable. The instruction manuals will give you the nuts and bolts of setting up your Fitbit
post_excerpt: Apple Watch
post_status: or any of the other popular fitness trackers on the market. What we want to do here is give some relevant
comment_status: universal advice on incorporating your wearable fitness tracker into your life in a way that makes exercise more enjoyable and productive. It's all about setting goals and seeing them through. A fitness tracker can be a huge help.

ID: How to Use Your Wearable Fitness Tracker
TIP #1: Don't treat it like a novelty. Your wearable fitness tracker is a shiny new object. And
post_author: like many shiny new objects
post_date: the tendency will be for your initial burst of enthusiasm to wane as the newness fades. Don't fall into this trap! Yes
post_date_gmt: you could fiddle with your wearable for fun
post_content: show it off to friends

ID: But never forget that your tracker — for all its cool bells and whistles — is fundamentally a tool
post_author: not a toy. It is technology intended to help you measure progress and achieve goals. If you view it as entertainment
post_date: or a gimmick
post_date_gmt: or a fashion accessory... you'll almost certainly not get out of it what you could.

ID: TIP #2: Find friends. One of the best things about your wearable is how it allows you to engage with fitness buddies like never before. You can initiate some healthy competition
post_author: share your own stats and achievement
post_date: participate in group challenges
post_date_gmt: and otherwise tap into the instant connectivity provided by the tracker and associated apps.

ID: Research has long shown that people are likelier to stay motivated when they have partners in their health journeys. Sometimes it's a workout pal who's there at the gym with you or running alongside in the park. But in today's connected digital world
post_author: there are even more possibilities for peer interaction and motivation. Take advantage!

ID: TIP #3: Be thoughtful about your goals. It's good to be ambitious when setting health goals. But it can be counterproductive to set goals that are too distant from your current performance levels. If you bite off more than you can chew (so to speak)
post_author: you'll be more likely to get discouraged and quit.

ID: Make a point of being thoughtful about setting incrementally bigger goals for yourself. For instance
post_author: try to take 5 percent more steps in your first week — not 50 percent. You'll have a better chance of getting to 50 percent eventually if you focus on creating healthy habits you can manage and build upon
post_date: rather than trying to do it all in one fell swoop.

ID: Perhaps the single most important thing when using a fitness tracker is to stay encouraged. You want to set out to achieve goals that are a little beyond your comfort zone
post_author: but close enough to grasp without losing hope or focus. Your tracker can be an amazing motivator. But it's only as strategic as you are.

ID: TIP #4: Don't get stuck on steps. Depending on the specific fitness wearable and apps you're using
post_author: the number of steps you take over the course of the day may be the baseline number you're tempted to focus on when thinking about movement milestones. And don't get us wrong: Steps are definitely useful to track!

ID: But it's also important to remember that not all steps are created equal
post_author: and it's vital to pay attention to other metrics. After all
post_date: skipping the elevator and walking up six flights of stairs to get to the office is more physically challenging (and beneficial) than walking the same distance down the street to buy a doughnut. Even beyond how strenuous the activity is
post_content: 000 extra steps over the course of a day will have a different effect on your health than being sedentary for 10 consecutive hours and then taking a 1

ID: Just be sure to put that step count into context. Make sure you're also paying attention to your heart rate
post_author: movement intervals
post_date: active calories burned
post_content: and all the other bits of information your wearable can provide. If you're diligent about meeting daily goals
post_title: the steps will take care of themselves!

ID: TIP #5: Track your food. Exercise is only part of it. The more meticulous you are about carefully recording the food you eat
post_author: the more useful your overall fitness tracking will be. What you put into your body affects not just your health
post_date: but also your ability to work out
post_date_gmt: and the amount you need to work out. Use a quality nutrition app like MyFitnessPal to monitor your meals.

ID: When they begin to track their nutrition on a daily basis
post_author: many people are stunned by what they notice. Foods you may assume are \"healthy\" are anything but! Your presumed caloric intake could be way off. You may be neglecting key nutrients while overindulging in hidden sugars. And if your nutrition goals are not established and followed as closely as your fitness tracking
post_date: you could be off course.

post_author: getting into the habit of tracking your food makes you more aware of what you're actually eating. Awareness breeds mindfulness and better choices.

ID: TIP #6: Care about calories — to a point. When fitness tracking (or monitoring their nutrition)
post_author: many people look first — and sometimes exclusively —  at the number of calories burned. That's understandable. Calories are common nutritional shorthand
post_date: and it's important to have a basic awareness of how much energy you're consuming versus how much energy you're expending through exercise.

post_author: calories are only one measure of how healthy your diet is. Just like counting steps is a very useful but self-limiting view of overall fitness
post_date: so too is counting calories a very useful but self-limiting approach to nutrition. Watch your macronutrients (carbs
post_content: proteins)
post_title: be sure you're getting sufficient vitamins and minerals
post_excerpt: and understand how to maximize the nutritional content of the calories you're consuming and burning.

ID: TIP #7: Don't take it off. This is a bit of exaggeration. Obviously
post_author: there will be moments when it makes sense to remove your tracker. It shouldn't feel like you're under house arrest and wearing an ankle monitor!

ID: But the more you wear your tracker
post_author: the more useful it will be to you
post_date: and the more acclimated you'll be to its feedback. The entire experience of tracking your fitness is intended to create new
post_date_gmt: sustainable habits. Having something new on your wrist may (at first) feel uncomfortable. The alerts may (at first) be annoying. However
post_content: with a little time
post_title: you will have integrated the device into your life
post_excerpt: and using it will be second nature. That's why it's so critical to be consistent in wearing it early on. The mere act of wearing your fitness tracker is the healthy habit you must establish first!

ID: TIP #8: Be proactive... but patient. That said
post_author: consistently wearing your tracker is only the first step. It's an incredible tool
post_date: but it's not magic! What do we mean by that? Well
post_date_gmt: however great Fitbit or Apple's technology is
post_content: it doesn't actually do the work for you. It measures and enhances and puts into context that work. But you can't tap the screen and instantaneously lose weight or sleep better.

ID: Sustained improved health takes time! Stick with it. Figure out how best to use your fitness tracker to maximize its informational and motivational benefit to you. Guide it as much as it guides you. Make it an intuitive part of your day. You'll be amazed by the results if you let healthy habits take hold.
"

Water is really important. Good hydration is essential for every major body function and aspect of your health. There is no substitute for staying consistently hydrated with pure water. Water allows your body to regulate its temperature
post_excerpt: prevent constipation
comment_status: and deliver nutrition to cells. It's central to brain
post_password: and skin health. The liver and kidneys depend on it to detoxify the body. It facilitates healthy weight management. Hydration is a pillar of basic human performance.

post_author: meanwhile
post_date: can be extremely detrimental. Your body naturally loses water through breathing
post_content: urination
post_title: and waste removal. When you aren't consuming sufficient water to replace the outgoing water
post_excerpt: problems arise. At even one percent dehydration
post_status: you will begin to feel thirsty. Subsequent symptoms can include poor digestion and constipation
to_ping: and headaches. Headaches due to dehydration may also indicate increased bodily toxicity. Prolonged dehydration can crystalize the salts and minerals found in urine
pinged: potentially leading to painful kidney stones.

post_author: vegetables
post_date: and herbal teas are a big part of hydration
post_date_gmt: but regularly drinking pure water is still the easiest and most important step you can take to stay hydrated. Individual needs vary
post_content: but general guidelines recommend approximately 64 ounces of water per day for adults. Your physical activity
post_excerpt: medical conditions
comment_status: and other factors all play a role in determining your optimal personal daily water intake. Check out this handy hydration calculator for an estimate.

ID: • Drink two to three glasses when you wake up to rehydrate after sleeping. Starting your day with hydration is always wise and gets you in the mindset of routinely sipping all day. Sipping hot lemon water in the morning actually has the added benefit of jump starting your digestion.
• Flavor your water. Many people find water too bland
post_author: which becomes an excuse not to drink enough of it. Don't fall into this trap. If need be
post_date: add some lemon<strong>
post_content: or a little fruit juice to your water if it helps make it more palatable. You can also add flavored vitamin C
post_title: or vitamin and mineral packets to your water
post_excerpt: which can help you get the nutrition you need each day. Just make sure to avoid formulas with added sugars.

post_author: raw veggies
post_date: salads
post_date_gmt: and brothy soups are all hydrating and highly nutritious foods. Be sure to eat lots of fresh
post_content: natural foods. As always
post_excerpt: sugary
post_status: and refined junk foods whenever possible.

ID: Hydration keeps you healthy. It's one of the easiest (but most overlooked) elements of wellness. Remember to choose pure water: pollution and environmental contaminants can (and do) show up in our water supply
post_author: so filter your drinking water if you can. Since it’s best to avoid plastics and BPA
post_date: skip the bottled water and invest instead in a reusable stainless steel water bottle.
